Silver Lions Farms is looking for an experienced and dedicated Head Farmer to lead our farming & crop production Ely, Nevada.

Silver Lion Farms is seeking an experienced alfalfa farmer to plan and manage the execution of the day-to-day farming operations on our nearly 2400 organic acres to plant, grow, and harvest various crop rotations, including hemp, alfalfa, and trite. This includes directing and managing all permanent and temporary staff, outsourced resources, and training the field team on various tasks and execution. This is a leadership position that will work directly with the executive team to plan, manage, and lead all farming operations.

Our ideal candidate has at least 5 years’ of leadership experience and is an expert in growing alfalfa, plant cycles, field preparation, pivot equipment, and labor management. You will also have experience maintaining work orders and records using AgWorld or similar software and are a deadline-driven, confident, and dependable leader who can work well with their team and executive management to lead farming operations.

About Us:

Our Retail Products:

Silver Lion Farms is a privately held Silver Lion Farms is a privately held organic CBD supply chain company established in 2018 and based in Ely, Nevada. As a vertically integrated seed-to-extraction company, we are committed to setting the gold standard for industrial-scale standardization and efficiency in USDA-certified Certified Organic CBD production. We are a small but mighty team of 50, with most of our employees working onsite at our beautiful campus, which includes 2400 organic acres and a state-of-the-art greenhouse north of Ely, Nevada. The remaining team members collaborate remotely around the western United States. Our mission extends beyond revolutionizing the commercial CBD industry; we aim to positively impact the communities we invest in and transform the lives of our customers and team members.

What We Offer:

100% company-paid employee Medical, Dental, & Life Insurance (Vision insurance is also available)
Competitive PTO policy
401k Program
Employer-paid on-site housing
Career growth and development opportunities
Company vehicle

Head of Farming & Crop Production Core Duties & Responsibilities

Field Preparation

Ensure that fields are properly conditioned in the Fall to include required disc’ing/tilling, and nutrient treatments are properly applied
Cover crops are planted per the Farm Plan

Planting

Ensure that preparations are made prior to planting per the Farm Plan:

Seedlings are ready for planting
Seed is ready for planting
Equipment is ready and in proper condition

Plant fields in the cadence (timing, equipment, and fields) per Farm Plan:

Seedlings
Direct seed

Grow & Field Maintenance

Ensure watering is at a specified water depth of 12 inches or as specified by the Farm Plan
Ensuring pivots are maintained and operational
Ensure organic weed control is conducted according to the Farm Plan (rotation every 20 days)
Ensure soil testing is completed as specified in the Farm Plan
Ensure nutrients are applied per the Farming Plan
Partners with equipment mechanics manager to ensure maintenance records are maintained and identifies/coordinates repairs

Harvest

Ensure that the harvest is conducted per the Farm Plan

Management

Manages, leads, and trains a core team of Farm Laborers
Delegates work responsibilities as needed to properly supervise work activities, timelines, and labor staff
Coordinates with the Labor Administrator to plan and schedule labor team schedules
Ensures adequate staff are present and ready to execute the Farming Plan

Farm Planning

Works with the management team to plan the seasonal field preparation, planting, field maintenance, and harvest and develop the farm plan
Labor requirements
Farm and labor equipment
Crop requirements
Maintains daily work orders and records in AgWorld for all farm-related activities (watering schedules, topicals, planting, harvest, labor team’s job assignments, etc.)

Minimum Requirements

Education and Experience

Thorough knowledge of farming, plant cycles, field preparation, pivot equipment, and labor management
5+ years of experience farming, growing and harvesting alfalfa
5+ years of farm maintenance experience
Experience working and managing pivot watering systems and other large-scale farming equipment
Knowledge of and experience in current agricultural practices
Experience & knowledge of safe equipment operation
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite (MS Teams, Word, Excel, etc.)

Skills & Core Competencies

Leadership: Proven track record of leading, managing, and inspiring a team
Strategize: Ability to assess and communicate timelines, efficiency, and risk to crops’ season
Communication: Provide clear, transparent communication with leadership, reporting all changes, issues, and needs to the management team

Physical Requirements

Must be able to climb, squat, bend, twist, stand for at least 8–10 hours per day and lift up to 50 pounds
Must be able and willing to work outdoors in all weather conditions

The Rodale Organic Farm at St. Luke’s is an innovative and nationally-renown partnership between Rodale Institute and St. Luke’s University Health Network (SLUHN). This partnership aims to create a highly successful and impactful farm-to-hospital model that is creating a new paradigm in food-as-medicine and regenerative healthcare. The Senior Farm Manager will collaborate with the St. Luke’s University Health Network leadership and serve as a public-facing and collaborative leader of this institutional program. The primary functions for this position are to provide healthy, seasonal, and organic produce to all hospital campuses within the St. Luke’s University Health Network. Additionally, the Senior Farm Manager will facilitate a high degree of cross-collaboration, communication, and execution for the program by working closely with multiple stakeholders.

Responsibilities include:

Collaborate with St. Luke’s leadership team to develop programs for St. Luke’s patients and staff that focus on the food-as-medicine initiative.
Meet with outside interested individuals and attend conferences to present the farm to hospital approach
Lead day-to-day farm operations in relationship to crop production at the St. Luke’s Hospital Anderson Campus. Field responsibilities include, but are not limited to harvesting, washing, and packing produce, weed, pest and disease management, planting, building cold frames or hoop houses, equipment maintenance and repair, etc
Manage and coordinate labor efforts among the farm staff
Document field operations on Rodale Institute forms to satisfy organic certification requirements, research data collection needs, financial accounting and maintain production records on a regular basis
Coordinate CSA and wholesale deliveries
Coordinate maintenance schedules for tractor(s), truck(s) and other equipment
Coordinate landscaping and facility maintenance and repairs among St. Luke’s hospital staff
Operate equipment (tractors, tractor implements, small engine equipment, and hand tools) in a safe and efficient manner
Complete and follow the Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) implemented by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) as well as FSMA
Plan a growing schedule to ensure planting of crops are sufficient to meet needs of St Luke’s chefs and wellness goals
Ensure farm plan meets all organic certifications
Educate and train temporary staff and interns to carry out the day-to-day activities of the managed operation
Summarize and analyze production data to identify trends
Maintain a clean workspace and offices
Collaborate with St. Luke’s chefs and employee wellness personnel to ensure crop plan meet hospital requirements
Coordinate with Rodale Institute staff for travel needs and purchasing supplies
Assist the Communication Department with preparing media
Assist with the Research team when necessary
Prepare a yearly budget, budget narrative and quarterly reports
Other duties may/will be assigned on a case by case and as-needed basis

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in horticulture or agronomy or equivalent experience
5 years experience working in vegetable production environment
3 years leadership experience in vegetable production environment
Leadership experience successfully managing customer relationships/expectations a plus
Must be able and willing to work in all types of weather
Able to lift and carry 50 lbs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficient in MS Office suite
Experience giving presentations/training a plus
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously

Expectations: Individuals must be committed to the farm’s success, and in turn, the farm will be committed to the individual’s success. To be trustful and respectful to all staff and visitors.

Travel: Travel will be required between Rodale Institute in Kutztown, PA and the St. Luke’s Rodale Institute Organic Farm, and to conferences, grower meetings and workshops.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, ancestry, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity or handicap.

FARM HAND

What is Bonton?

For the last 200 years, racial injustice and systemic oppression prevented opportunities in Bonton that were a given elsewhere. People here experienced higher rates of diabetes, stroke and cancer, and 48% of residents lived in poverty. Residents have been denied access to the seven human essentials that are necessary to survive and thrive - health & wellness, economic stability, safe and affordable housing, transportation, a sense of belonging, education and access to fair credit. Today, the community is transforming, and healing is coming from within.

Who We Are

Bonton Farms is on a mission is to transform lives by disrupting systems of inequity, laying a foundation where health, wholeness, and opportunity are the norm for all people. While many nonprofits work to solve one issue, Bonton Farms focuses on place-based interventions to build community capacity for long-term change. As the ecosystem of community resources improves, the neighbors in Bonton use these resources to build successful, self-sufficient lives, ultimately interrupting the impact of decades of disenfranchisement. Bonton Farms’ programs focus on the following seven human essentials: economic stability, health and wellness, transportation, education, access to fair credit and community belonging.

THE MISSION - Transform lives by disrupting systems of inequity, laying a foundation where change yields health, wholeness and opportunity as the norm.

Position Description:

An experienced farmer to help plant, maintain and harvest crops at Extension at Bonton Farms. The successful candidate will play a key role in contributing to the farm team and crop production. Bonton Farms is the largest urban farm in the United States with two locations and over 40-acres in production.

Responsibilities:

Attend a daily farm meeting to learn about needs for the day
Prepare rows and plots for planting
Maintain rows according to Bonton Farm standards including watering, weeding and pruning
Harvest at least twice a week including harvesting, bunching and cleaning to be delivered to market
Help maintain the farm by cleaning supplies, putting up tools, etc.
Assist in greeting and leading volunteer groups that come to assist with a high degree of customer service representative of Bonton Farms


Requirements:

Previous experience working on a farm in particular helping with harvesting and planting
Understanding of farm techniques
Accuracy in executing assigned tasks
Familiar with industry’s best practices


The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience working on a farm. In addition, the candidate would have an understanding and passion for the mission of Bonton Farms.'

Work Location:

One location


Work Remotely:

No

Job Description

Summary:

We are searching for someone to manage our current production area and aid in the development of new production acreage. This position would be focused on monitoring the plants and production zones, delegating tasks to be completed by our labor crew, facilitating harvests, and communicating with buyers to market the fruit. We have a solid team of workers that are available to complete basic plant maintenance tasks (i.e. weeding, hoop house maintenance, pruning, trellising). You would be working closely with them as well as our plant health team to ensure the well-being of our cane bushes.

Manage all aspects of plant health and maintenance in coordination with Plant Health Team
Inspect, repair, and improve irrigation system

Ensure administration of foliar and fertigation recipes
IPM scouting
Batching fertilizer tanks as needed
Manage harvest crews and quality control of fruit
Coordinate with buyers and local CSA's to market fruit
Delegate labor for daily as well as annual tasks (i.e. weeding, pruning, trellising, etc.)
Planning and staying one step ahead of farm crew in carrying out daily tasks
Cultivate weeds in hoop houses
Record-keeping, suggesting, and implementing system improvements
Manage our expansion to our new ranch

Open-mined towards innovative regenerative practices

Confidence and communication skills to lead large labor crews

People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects

Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction
Physically fit (i.e. can lift at least 50 pounds) and able to work in variable climate conditions

Must be able to repeatedly carry or pickup 50 lbs daily
Must be able to stand for 7-8 hours daily

Qualifications

Applicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement, including specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.

FOR THE GS-05 GRADE LEVEL: General experience: Applicants must have three years of progressively responsible experience, one year of which was equivalent in level of difficulty and responsibility to the next lower level in the Federal Service (equivalent to the GS-04 level) (experience may have been obtained in private or public sectors). Plan and organize work.

FOR THE GS-07 LEVEL: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience (equivalent to the GS-05 grade level) that demonstrates:

Determine the grade, quality, and/or acceptability of livestock, or food grade product, and/or evaluate the sanitation, refrigeration, other facility procedures of food in production, processing, packing, storage, and/or transportation.
This could include weighing, sampling, inspecting, gauging temperature, or ensuring compliance with food grade and/or sanitation regulations in a processing plant, warehouse, livestock operation, food establishment, or similar workplace to determine quality against regulations and/or standards.

GPA requirements: 3.0 or higher out of a possible 4.0 as recorded on official transcripts or as computed based on 4 years of education, or courses completed during the final 2 year of the curriculum; OR 3.5 or higher out of a possible 4.0 based on the average of the required course completed in the major field or courses completed during the final 2 years of the curriculum (GPA will be rounded to one decimal place, e.g., 2.95 rounds to 3.0 and 2.94 rounds to 2.9).

BrightFarms is The Place to Grow!

At BrightFarms, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the way leafy greens are grown. But we don’t just want to grow great-tasting greens, we want them to do good as well: for the planet, for the health of people, and for the well-being of our employees. We give BrightFarmers the tools, training, support, and opportunities they need to do better for themselves and the world every day. Because when you do good for your people, they do good for the world.

BrightFarms is a national leader in the booming indoor farming industry, transforming how produce is grown and delivered with its expanding network of high-tech, sustainable hydroponic farms.  We currently operate six high-tech greenhouse farms, with four new regional salad greenhouse hubs breaking ground to begin opening in 2024.  BrightFarms' fresh lettuce options, from classic greens to crunchy mixes and salad kits, are available in more than 3,700 retail stores across the East Coast and Midwest.

At our greenhouse in Hendersonville, we grow more than 2 million pounds of leafy greens per year for the Carolinas. We are currently in need of a Grower to support our team. In this role you will help manage the greenhouse production of hydroponic baby greens and other crops for our operations throughout the U.S. In addition, the Growers may be trained to develop into more advanced roles at our existing and future facilities.

Specifically, You Will

Manage all environmental controls of the greenhouse using Hoogendoorn greenhouse environmental control software
Work closely with the Head Grower to determine ideal computer set points and ensure proper conditions are achieved
Be responsible for controlling all parameters related to the maintenance of healthy and productive production ponds
Be responsible for fertility and pH management, thermal management, pond aeration, pond sanitation, and pond mechanicals
Ensuring the product is free of insect pests and disease
Work closely with the Head Grower to develop, implement, and maintain a biologically based IPM program, and any chemical applications required
Scout and record keeping
Work closely with the BrightFarms Research and Development team to design, implement and track R&D projects to increase and optimize yields of existing products, and to develop new products for the BrightFarms sales portfolio
Support the Head Grower and will be accountable for revenue, for operating expenses, for quality and for the operation of the facility, including:
production planning and reporting
plant performance
labor management
balancing inputs
throughput & demand
facilities maintenance
Support the Head Grower and be accountable for maintaining a neat and orderly greenhouse facility
Work closely with the Head Grower to ensure that the food safety program meets all compliance requirements
Work closely with the Head Grower and other members of the management team to:
develop and execute the strategies to achieve BrightFarms’ mission
lead BrightFarmers to enable them to execute the strategies to achieve BrightFarms’ mission
Preferred Qualifications

4-year degree in horticulture and or related sciences
3 years of experience in commercial production of plants using soilless culture in environmentally controlled greenhouses
Experience with biological control agents (BCA’s) and knowledge of IPM required
Lead by example – set the highest possible standards for quality, efficiency, productivity, and behavior
The ability to be detail oriented and data driven
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and is a curious, self starter
Strong computer skills – Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook (Power Point and Access Database knowledge beneficial)

Ideal But Not Required

Preference will be given to candidates with experience in controlled environment agriculture and hydroponic production of food crops
Priva or Hoogendoorn experience a plus
Successful candidates will have strong knowledge of nutrient management and hydroponic nutrient solutions

Come grow with us - the future is BRIGHT!

BrightFarms is The Place to Grow!

At BrightFarms, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the way leafy greens are grown. But we don’t just want to grow great-tasting greens, we want them to do good as well: for the planet, for the health of people, and for the well-being of our employees. We give BrightFarmers the tools, training, support, and opportunities they need to do better for themselves and the world every day. Because when you do good for your people, they do good for the world.

BrightFarms is a national leader in the booming indoor farming industry, transforming how produce is grown and delivered with its expanding network of high-tech, sustainable hydroponic farms. We currently operate six high-tech greenhouse farms, with four new regional salad greenhouse hubs breaking ground to begin opening in 2024. BrightFarms' fresh lettuce options, from classic greens to crunchy mixes and salad kits, are available in more than 3,700 retail stores across the East Coast and Midwest.

Our Agriculture and Science department is looking to add a Grower to our team. These jobs will be located at our greenhouse in Macon, GA. In this role you will help manage the greenhouse production of hydroponic baby greens and other crops for our operations throughout the U.S. In addition, the Growers will be trained to develop into more advanced roles at our existing and future facilities.

Specifically, You Will

Manage all environmental controls of the greenhouse using Priva greenhouse environmental control software
Work closely with BrightFarms Director of Agriculture to determine ideal computer set points and ensure proper conditions are achieved
Control all parameters related to the maintenance of healthy and productive production ponds:
fertility and pH management
thermal management
pond aeration
pond sanitation
pond mechanicals
Ensure the product is free of insect pest and disease
Work closely with the Director of Agriculture to develop, implement, and maintain a biologically based IPM program and any chemical applications required
Scouting and record keeping
Work closely with the BrightFarms Product Manager and Director of Agriculture to design, implement and track R&D projects to increase and optimize yields of existing products, and to develop new products for the BrightFarms sales portfolio
Support the General Manager and will be accountable for revenue, for operating expenses, for quality and for the operation of the facility, including
production (WIP and people)
planning and reporting
plant performance
labor management
balancing inputs
throughput & demand
and facilities maintenance
Maintain a neat and orderly greenhouse facility
Ensure that the food safety program meets all compliance requirements
Work closely the General Manager and with the BrightFarms Director of Agriculture and other members of the management team to:
develop and execute the strategies to achieve BrightFarms’ mission
lead BrightFarmers to enable them to execute the strategies to achieve BrightFarms’ mission
The Ideal Candidate

4-year degree in horticulture and or related sciences
3 years of experience in commercial production of plants using soilless culture in environmentally controlled greenhouses.
The ability to exhibit excellent leadership skills: Lead by example – set the highest possible standards for quality, efficiency, productivity, and behavior
The ability to be detail oriented and data driven
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and is a curious, self starter.
Strong computer skills – Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook (Power Point and Access Database knowledge beneficial)
The ability to obtain a state pesticide applicators license

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in controlled environment agriculture and hydroponic production of food crops
Priva experience a plus
Experience with biological control agents (BCA’s) and knowledge of IPM required
A sincere passion for the BrightFarms mission

Come grow with us - the future is BRIGHT!

BrightFarms is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Silver Lions Farms is looking for an experienced leader to join our team as the Head of Greenhouse Operations & Production in Ely, Nevada

The Head of Greenhouse Operations & Production is responsible for leading our indoor grow and production team in our indoor “Glasshouse” facility located in White Pine County, NV. The facility is a 250,000+ square foot state-of-the-art Certhon (Dutch designed and built) glasshouse with Supreme Air and full computer automation using full computer controls (Priva).

The Head of Greenhouse Operations & Production is responsible for managing all greenhouse cultivation, grow production, harvesting, processing, and maintenance in the main and supporting facilities, and will play a key role in planning and managing budgeting in partnership with business operations.

Our ideal candidate is a seasoned leader with several years of experience managing all greenhouse operations and production and leading a greenhouse team. Experience optimizing production efficiency, maintaining quality standards, managing maintenance, and ensuring the continued readiness of all capital infrastructure within our facilities is crucial for this position.

Location We provide onsite housing for this position, which is in a remote, high desert region of northeastern Nevada.

About Us:

Our Retail Products:

What We Offer:

Competitive Benefits package includes 100% company-paid employee Medical, Dental, & Life Insurance (Vision insurance is also available) 401k Program and PTO
Career growth and development opportunities
Employer-paid on-site housing and Relocation

Core Duties & Responsibilities

Indoor Growing & Processing

Oversees the Greenhouse Cultivation and Production teams and ensures that weekly/monthly schedules and cadences are being met.
Oversees the acquisition of all raw materials, such as seeds and fertilizer, in quantities required to support the grow plan.
Works with internal and external partners to strategize, plan, and execute greenhouse operations.

Facilities & Maintenance

Acting liaison between Silver Lion Farms and the facility manufacturer, Certhon.
Oversees the equipment maintenance and repair function to ensure that preventative maintenance services (PMS) and repairs are completed on time and capital equipment is maintained and ready as scheduled.
Works with internal and external partners to strategize, plan, and execute glasshouse construction, maintenance, and operations.
Enforces job site safety standards.

Grow Facility “Glasshouse” Systems

Responsible for implementing glasshouse systems, and manufacturing processes.
Manages glasshouse system operations, process, design, planning, control, performance improvement efficiencies, and operations strategies.
Regularly check glasshouse systems for efficiency, and accuracy, and troubleshoot issues.
Analyzes glasshouse production metrics and makes recommendations for improvements and solutions to issues.
Works directly with cultivation to create and maintain a productive environment for all seeds, seedlings, and biomass contained within facilities.
Create SOPS and train staff to maintain capital equipment and systems
Reports all changes, updates, and risks to the executive team.

Quality Control

Oversees quality control to ensure that outcomes meet standards.

Safety & State Compliance

Enforces safety and OSHA requirements.
Ensures adherence to the Nevada Department of Agriculture and all Cannabis Compliance Board (CCB) regulations.
Stays current with and assures legal compliance with all regulations.

Budgeting

Works directly with the CEO/General Manager to create and manage all relevant labor, construction, facility, and systems budgets and project timelines.

Management

This position leads manages the entire Production Team including Greenhouse Leads, and Laborers

Minimum Requirements

Education And Experience

A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
5+ years of management experience in a glasshouse production environment; direct management of 15+ individuals is required.
3+ years of experience with automated irrigation/fertigation systems (we use Priva).
Willing and available to work outside of shift hours and respond to alerts and emergencies (power outages, labor issues, etc.) as required.
Expert knowledge of greenhouse operations and equipment
In-depth knowledge & understanding of Lean, Six Sigma and certifications are a plus

Skills & Core Competencies

Leadership and People Management – Ability to manage people, provide day-to-day supervision, and handle employee-related issues. Proven record of accomplishment in leading, managing, and inspiring a team.

Communication – Superior communication and interpersonal skills (verbal, non-verbal, written), with the ability to build relationships at all levels, both internally and externally.

Strategic Thinking – The ability to set and implement overall strategy, policy, and procedures to drive process and improvement amongst the company. The ability to make critical and thoughtful decisions concerning staff management, labor, overall strategy, and demanding timelines.

Compliance - Basic understanding of safety and labor compliances not limited to permitting, licensing, OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Administration) regulations, Cannabis Compliance Board (CCB) regulations, safety protocols, and crop testing. Familiarity with environmental protection practices.

Indoor Production - Thorough knowledge of indoor growing, entire hemp/cannabis growth cycles, planting preparation, transplanting, cultivation, and labor management.

IPM - Understanding of pest and disease management techniques.

Adaptability - Adapts and thrives in a demanding, early-stage environment.

Professionalism - Operates with a high level of professionalism and integrity, including dealing with confidential information.

Additional Requirements

Must pass required background checks.
Must be and remain compliant with all legal or company regulations for working in the industry.
Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
Must be able to get approval from the state agency to work in the cannabis industry.

Silver Lion Farms is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Silver Lion Farms is an E-Verify participant.

Position Title

Harvest Fruit Evaluator

Company Overview

Bee Sweet Citrus, Inc. is a grower, packer, and shipper of citrus and is a leader in today’s agriculture industry. Bee Sweet Citrus Inc. is a family owned and operated company, providing over 10 different varieties to its consumers. Located in the heart of California’s Central Valley, Bee Sweet Citrus, Inc. is focused on innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction.

Job Overview

Bee Sweet Citrus is looking for a highly motivated individual to join the Field/Farm Department as Fruit Quality Checker / Fruit Evaluator. This person will be report to the Field / Farm Coordinator (which is part of Bee Sweet’s Farming Department) and will be responsible for adhering to company values and will work to advance the growth of Bee Sweet’s field / farm department.

Responsibilities

Job duties include, but are not limited to the following:

Work closely with the entire farming team and FLCs to ensure ranch evaluations block by block and harvest procedures are followed;
Oversee labor crew’s picking quality;
Determine crop estimations and fruit quality by working closely with all members of the farming team (as part of the farming team your evaluation of the quality of the fruit and how it changes throughout the year is crucial to our farming operations);
Report harvest numbers and Fruit on Ranches to Field / Farm Coordinator Supervisor
Report any issues in the Field / Farm to Coordinator Supervisor
Ensure all field/farm paperwork is filled out accurately and taken to proper blocks

Skills & Other Technical Knowledge

Must be highly organized with the ability to work effectively, both individually and as a member of the Field / Farm Department
Must have strong communications skills, both verbal and written
Must be bilingual (English/Spanish)
Must have a clean CDL record

Pay Offered/Benefits

$20 - $25 per hour

Paid time off and sick leave

Industry-leading health, dental and vision insurance and health wellness program that covers regular doctor visits, eye exams, etc. with only a minor copay

401(k) retirement with guaranteed matching contributions

Requirements

Conditions of Employment

You must be a US Citizen or US National.
Males born after 12/31/1959 must be Selective Service registered or exempt.
Successful completion of one year probationary period, unless previously served.
Direct Deposit – Per Public Law 104-134 all Federal employees are required to have federal payments made by direct deposit to their financial institution.
Successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit https://www.e-verify.gov/.
CONFIDENTIAL FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE REPORT: If selected for this position, you will be required to submit an Annual Financial Disclosure Report within 30 days of your initial appointment date, and annually thereafter.
Successful completion of a Public Trust background investigation.
Subject to satisfactory adjudication of background investigation and/or fingerprint check. If selected you will be sent instruction on obtaining fingerprints. Please note we are not able to reimburse any fees incurred for fingerprints.

Qualifications

Applicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement including time-in-grade restrictions, specialized experience and/or education, as defined below.

For The GS-9

One full-time year of specialized work experience equivalent in difficulty and responsibility to the GS-7 level in the Federal service. Specialized experience is experience that demonstrates knowledge of the laws and regulations governing agricultural stabilization and conservation programs to assist in the determination of the application of national policies and objectives at the State level; Understanding of farming practices and customs in the United States, and of the economic needs of farm communities at the State level; Experience communicating with representatives of public organizations, farmers' associations, and others, to provide agricultural program information affecting them. OR

Two full academic years of progressively higher level graduate education or master's or equivalent graduate degree from an accredited college or university with a major field of study in dairy science, agricultural marketing, domestic agricultural development, farm management, agronomy, or other agricultural specialty areas: OR

A combination of graduate education and experience as listed above.

For The GS-11

One full-time year of specialized work experience equivalent in difficulty and responsibility to the GS-9 level in the Federal service. Specialized experience is experience which demonstrates knowledge of the laws and regulations governing agricultural stabilization and conservation programs to assist in applying national policies and objectives at the State level; Understanding of farming practices and customs in the United States, and of the economic needs of farm communities at the State level; Experience working with representatives of public organizations, farmers' associations, and others, to interpret agricultural regulations, programs, and policies affecting them. OR

Three full academic years of progressively higher level graduate education or Ph.D., or equivalent doctoral degree from an accredited college or university with a major field of study in dairy science, agricultural marketing, domestic agricultural development, farm management, agronomy, or other agricultural specialty areas. OR

A combination of graduate education and experience as listed above.

For The GS-12

One full-time year of specialized work experience equivalent in difficulty and responsibility to the GS-11 level in the Federal service. Specialized experience is experience that demonstrates knowledge of the laws and regulations governing agricultural stabilization and conservation programs to serve as an advisor on the application of national policies and objectives at the State level; Understanding of farming practices and customs in the United States, and of the economic needs of farm communities at the State level; Experience maintaining relationships with representatives of public organizations, farmers' associations, and others, to interpret agricultural regulations, programs, and policies affecting them.

Applicants must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of the announcement 05/24/2024 including time-in-grade restrictions, specialized experience and/or education, as defined.

Employment Status: Full-time (40 hrs. weekly) Location: Salem, Oregon

Number of Positions: 1

Schedule: TUESDAY-SATURDAY / 8hrs a day/ 40hrs a week

Who We Are:

The Asher House is a registered non-profit sanctuary in Salem, Oregon. We rescue animals that have been discarded or unwanted, providing them with a life of comfort, love and adventure. For over two years, their Founder, Lee Asher, traveled across 49 states to promote dog adoption and spotlight various shelters and rescues. After his Pitbull Stella passed away, Lee was determined to fulfill his lifelong dream of creating a sanctuary, where animals could feel treasured, protected, and free. In late 2020, Lee discovered a large parcel of property which was the perfect setting to turn his vision into a reality! We are here to help people have better days and get animals adopted. The Asher House is on a mission to make the world a better place, one rescue animal at a time!

Job Summary:

The Farm Animal and Horse Caretaker is an essential part of our team. This position is perfect for the detail-oriented animal lover who wants to be part of a dynamic team! This position will assist with basic animal care for the equine and livestock living on the property. This includes feeding, watering, and handling. Cleans animal living areas: pens, stalls, shelters, and enclosures. Performs routine maintenance of farm, and barnyard areas.

Role and Responsibilities:

Provide daily care for all farm animals including:
Feeding, watering, grooming, and handling of all farm animals.
Cleaning up all in all animal areas, ensure animals have a clean and safe, enclosures throughout the day and keep areas well maintained and orderly.
Ensure isolation areas are deeply cleaned and prepared for incoming animals prior to arrival when appropriate.
Provide ongoing daily enrichment for the animals.
Monitor animal health daily and report any changes or concerns that arise behaviorally or medically.
Clean and maintain property grounds to ensure the ideal environment for the animals.
Assist in any repairs or ground keeping as needed.
Ability to hold for vet and farrier appointments.
Provide daily care for all farm animals including:
Feeding, watering, and handling of all farm animals.
Cleaning up all in all animal areas, ensure animals have a clean and safe, enclosures throughout the day and keep areas well maintained and orderly.
Ensure isolation areas are deeply cleaned and prepared for incoming animals prior to arrival when appropriate.
Provide ongoing daily enrichment for the animals.
Monitor animal health daily and report any changes or concerns that arise behaviorally or medically.
Clean and maintain property grounds to ensure the ideal environment for the animals.
Assist in any repairs or ground keeping as needed.
Provide daily care and enrichment for all sanctuary companion animals.
Daily care includes:
Feeding, watering, medicating, exercising, and providing daily enrichment
Clean and sanitize animal housing areas.
Monitor animal health for signs of illness, or unusual behavior.
Make notation and report any problems regarding health and behavior of the animals to the appropriate staff to ensure the necessary medical appointments and follow ups are made. Including animals that may be isolated or quarantined.
Prompt communication around animal supply levels/inventory and work with staff to ensure that the necessary amount and type of equipment/supplies are always organized and maintained on the premises.
Assist in loading and unloading animal supplies at the sanctuary.
Ensure animals are in secured areas of the sanctuary when visitors arrive at the property for the sake of safety for both animals and people.
Act as a responsible and compassionate representative of The Asher House at all times.
Experience:

Minimum 5 years’ experience working with horses and other large animals such as working on a farm with livestock.
Experience working with and training horses, experience working with draft horses desired but not required.


Minimum Requirements:

Able to handle outdoor work and perform outside physical work in varying weather conditions.
Willing and able to clean up and care for farm animals.
Self-motivated individual who can learn to identify and complete tasks on their own or as directed.
Ability to stand, crouch, bend and be on your feet for 8 hours in various terrains and conditions.
Ability to recognize behaviors such as kicking, biting, bolting and respond with appropriate action for safety.
Observe animal daily activities, eating habits, behavior and appearance for any abnormalities and report to management.
Lift minimum of 75lbs.
Must be 21 years or older and have a valid driver’s license.
Must have dependable transportation.
Background check required.


Working Conditions:

Work is normally performed outside in all weather conditions.
Exposure to unpleasant odors and noises.
Exposure to bites, scratches and animal waste.
Possible exposure to contagious diseases.


Physical Requirements:

Often requires lifting and carrying materials weighing up to 75 lbs.
Walking and/or standing for long periods.
Frequently work in a bent position.
May be required to use strength or agility in capturing and restraining stronger, more active animals.
Must not have any allergies to farm or companion animals.


Salary:$20 an hour

Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Time Off, Holidays

The Asher House is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national or ethnic origin, disability, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law.

Former appointees: 1) must have been hired under competitive examining procedures to a time limited appointment with a land management agency; 2) must have served under one or more time limited appointment(s) by a land management agency for a period totaling more than 24 months without a break in service of 2 or more years; 3) must have separated for reasons other than misconduct or performance; AND 4) must have performed at an acceptable level through the service period.

The Greenhouse Project is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization based behind Carson High School, focusing on growing fresh produce for the community and educating youth on gardening and horticulture. They manage various facilities and work with students, including those in agriculture classes, special needs students, and community groups.

**Position Summary**

Members will support the growth and production of produce for donation to local food banks. They will also work with students and volunteers to promote sustainable agriculture and nutrition education.

**Schedule & Location**

Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5 pm, occasional weekends and evenings.

Location: Carson City, NV

Timeline: January 2022 - August 2022

**Primary Responsibilities**

Learn and apply innovative farming techniques
Maintain and cultivate diverse crops
Prepare planting sites
Train volunteers
Optimize production efficiency.

**Secondary Responsibilities**

Host tours and engage student groups
Facilitate hands-on activities
Complete required trainings
Recruit, manage, and train volunteers
Report program statistics.

Dedication and responsibility
Passion for Environmental Education & Sustainable Agriculture
Teamwork and public interaction skills
Safety awareness
Ability to lift heavy objects
Strong multitasking skills
Willingness to work outdoors in varied weather conditions
Punctuality
Driver's License.

**Qualifications**

Bachelor's degree in relevant field preferred
Strong communication and organizational skills
Experience with students, teachers, and volunteers
Preferred: Spanish language proficiency.

**Academic and Experience Qualifications**

High school diploma or equivalent
Bachelor's degree in relevant field (preferred).

**Term of Service & Requirements**

Half-time position from January 24th, 2022, to August 12th, 2022
920 hours of service.

**Evaluation & Reporting**

Regular performance evaluations
Biweekly timesheet submissions
Monthly reporting of performance measures.

**Host Site Agency Mission**

Truckee Meadows Parks Foundation (TMPF) supports local parks departments in Truckee Meadows, emphasizing park programming and citizen engagement to enhance community health and appreciation for natural and cultural history.

**Program Mission**

The Student Stewards Program engages K-12 students in park-based, citizen science projects to promote scientific learning.

**Member Benefits**

$8,471/year living allowance
Loan forbearance on qualifying loans
$3,172.50 Segal AmeriCorps Education Award.

**Evaluation and Reporting**

Mid-term and end-of-term evaluations
Biweekly timesheet submissions
Monthly performance measures reporting.

We grow the world’s BEST Strawberries & our Farm Operators are a huge reason why!

As part of our Production Team, a Farm Operator is responsible for the execution of farming and related tasks in a production farm contributing to our exceptional product and plant health. Individuals execute the day-to-day operations of the Farm which includes pruning, harvesting, cleaning, sanitizing and transferring plants. We are seeking a part-time Farm Operator to join the Oishii team!

What You’ll Be Responsible For

Ensure tasks such as pruning, harvesting, and cleaning/sanitizing are completed timely.
Operate and troubleshoot new farming technologies.
Manage all stages of the strawberry plant life cycle - propagation, cultivation, pruning, and harvesting.
Communicate and work cross functionally with packaging and distribution.
Engage in information and data collection as necessary so that we can continually improve our strawberries.
Escalate concerns to leadership as necessary to ensure the health and safety of our plants and our people.

The role is hands-on with about 90% of time spent in the farm tending to our plants.

Who will love this job: Individuals who identify with our Core Values and exhibit skills within those values will thrive at Oishii.

One Team, One Fight!
Ability to quickly shift priorities to meet deadlines and effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, clearly, concisely and with purpose.
Outgoing and collaborative work style- Ability to work cross functionally at all levels and collaborate at various levels of the organization.
Focus
Ability to remove obstacles in order to prioritize which could include problem solving, working through ambiguity and using fact based or sound judgment.
Ability to work independently, with a high attention to detail, and ability to create structure & process where none may exist.
GSD (Get Sh** Done!)
Capable of prioritizing tasks and always considering the resources available when doing so.
A bias for action! Ability to hold yourself accountable and take ownership of driving results that impact company outcomes.
Physical Requirements

Ability to lift up to 30 lbs
Ability to climb a ladder
Ability to crouch or kneel
Ability to reach and stretch
Hand dexterity
Comfortable in an active non sedentary role for lengths of up to 5 to 6 hours at a time
MUST NOT be allergic to bees

What We Look For In a Farm Operator

High School Diploma or GED.
Ability to maintain excellent punctuality and attendance.
You love strawberries and learning new things!
You love the natural rhythm of farming and would thrive spending hours every day in a farm caring for plants–experience with gardening is a plus
No growing experience necessary, on the job training will be provided.
Ability to work the following Shift & Schedule:
Sunday-Tuesday, 8AM to 4:30P
Perks At Oishii

Hourly compensation starts at $17.00/hour
Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
100% Employer Paid Life Insurance + Long Term Disability Insurance
EAP Access
Pet Insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan (Roth & Traditional)
Paid Parental leave
Office social events including happy hours, parties, and community service projects
Employee activity groups for basketball players, Yoga Enthusiasts, runners…

About Oishii

At Oishii, we grow the best fruit in the world by deploying ground-breaking vertical farming technology that pushes the boundaries of agriculture. We’re the first in the WORLD to grow fruit in an indoor vertical farm at commercial scale. We started with strawberries, which we debuted at Chef's Table at Brooklyn Fare, the three star Michelin restaurant considered by critics to be among the best in the world. Since then, we have supplied our strawberries to food-loving consumers, world-class restaurants, and specialty retailers across NYC. Our proprietary technology enables us to grow the very best produce year-round, at the same high level of quality, all without using any pesticides.

Oishii has been profiled in Eater, NPR, Time Magazine, and Fortune. Oishi was also one of the Fast Companies Most Innovative Companies of 2022.

At Oishii, everything we do works toward accomplishing our mission of transforming agriculture sustainably while bringing produce that truly delights people everywhere. This requires farmers, engineers, scientists, product managers, and members of many other backgrounds to work together day-in and day-out to innovate, while operating increasingly large farms. We have an amazing mission-driven team of highly motivated and engaged members.

Learn More https://oishii.com/

Employment Type: Full Time

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Compensation: $26.15/hour - $33.48/hour in 6 steps

Application Deadline: Open Until Filled

Mission Statement

Join Kings Community Action Organization (KCAO) and make a difference in Kings County, CA as a Nutrition Educator. KCAO envisions a future where all people in Kings County are able to live with dignity, have access to available resources and have the opportunity, motivation and ability to live economically productive and satisfying lives.

Our Mission: Working as a team, KCAO will seek and provide programs that develop self-sufficiency in individuals, families, and communities within Kings County.

Our Vision: Kings County residents and communities will achieve self-sufficiency through the high quality and client-focused programs of KCAO.

We are a private nonprofit helping people and changing lives in Kings County since 1965. Do you see yourself as part of our team of passionate, committed, and caring people?

Job Summary

The Nutrition Educator will plan, implement, and evaluate nutrition education programs that help individuals, families, and communities maximize and maintain a healthy lifestyle.

Duties And Responsibilities

Perform administrative support tasks, prepare and file check requests, track information electronically, and file documents.
Present nutrition education programs for individuals and families with low income in Kings County, including children, homeless individuals, and those with mental health issues.
Develop and maintain cooperative working relationships with agencies and organizations interested in nutrition and physical health education.
Identify evidence-based nutrition programs/curricula for use in nutrition education series.
Plant and harvest fruits and vegetables during the appropriate seasons.
Maintain community garden and tend on a weekly basis.
Develop nutrition education lesson plans and education materials that are culturally appropriate.
Distribute nutrition and physical activity education materials, such as bulletins, brochures and flyers to community agencies and individuals in natural community settings.
Document activities and record information, such as but not limited to, presentations conducted and numbers of participants.
Develop and engage in policy, systems and environmental work around nutrition, aiming to increase the access to fruits and vegetables, community and school gardens, farmer's markets, healthy retail, and more.
Collaborate with community organizations to determine community needs relative to nutrition and physical activity needs.
Conduct basic program evaluation and data entry.
Collect and analyze data to identify community needs prior to implementing programs designed to encourage healthy lifestyles, policies and environments.
Compile results and develop reports.
Perform ongoing planning and scheduling of program requirements based on the work plan.
May serve as a resource to assist individuals, providers, and the community.
May administer fiscal resources for health education programs.
Participate in staff meetings and attend other meetings and seminars as directed.
Assist with development of integrated work plan.
Perform other duties as required.

Education/Experience Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Public Health, Nutrition or closely related field from an accredited university.
AND
At least one year of experience in the public health or nutrition field, conducting presentations for individuals and groups.

Other Requirements

Bi-lingual (English/Spanish) is highly preferred.
Travel and attend out of area meetings and conferences as required per the funding source(s).
Work variable hours and days, including those outside regular Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. business hours.
Meet and maintain KCAO hiring requirements which include:
Criminal Record Clearance including California DOJ, FBI and Child Abuse Centralized Index (CACI).
Reliable, insured transportation and valid California Driver License.
Motor Vehicle Report (MVR) acceptable to KCAO's vehicle insurer.
Health examination with tuberculin clearance.
Ability to be contacted outside of regularly scheduled work hours in case of emergency.
KCAO is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace

KCAO participates in the E-Verify program that electronically confirms an employee's authorization to work in the United States that complies with the I-9 form.

Salary: $26.15 - $33.48 per hour

Farm Manager - Vegetables | Lincolnshire Worth Farms £DOE Are you passionate about sustainable agriculture, growing high quality crops, and managing a diverse and skilled team of people? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled and dedicated Farm Manager to join a forward-thinking company, and lead all of their vegetable production What's the Role? As the Farm Manager for vegetables, you will be responsible for the planning, cultivation, planting and husbandry of all vegetables crops as well as the harvesting of spinach crops. If you hold FACTS and BASIS, have previous experience managing a team, love being hands on with crops and are scientific in your approach, this could be the role for you. The role is hands on, and there's no doubt you will be working hard. Previous experience working in farming is essential with vegetable crop growing desirable.

The team are driven, and enthusiastic. There is a fantastic opportunity to manage the skills they already have and develop them into a highly skilled, and high performing team. Who do I get to work for? Worth Farms are part of the A H Worth group a 5th generation food and farming business. They are vertically integrated, growing most of the produce they sell on their own farms. They operate from two sites in South Lincolnshire, as well as farming operations in Spain and Italy, employing up to 750 people. They are always looking for ways to invest and grow the business, and farming is the foundation behind this.

Vegetable production in the UK is around 700ha and is run closely with arable production of 2500ha. What's next?

For an informal chat, please call me, Hannah on (phone number removed), email , or drop me a message on LinkedIn. Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date, just send what you have already, and we can sort the rest later

Help Help

Requirements

Conditions of Employment

You will be required to lift items weighing up to 70 pounds.
You may have limited exposure to hazardous materials.
Position has education requirements--see Qualifications/Education section.
You must submit a resume and required documents--see How to Apply section.
EPA and non-EPA applicants must submit transcripts/course listings.
You must be a U.S. citizen.

If you are selected, you will be required to complete a Confidential Financial Disclosure form within 30 days of your first day of employment and annually thereafter.

If you are selected, you may be required to complete a one-year probationary period if appointed as Competitive Service or a two-year trial period if appointed as Excepted Service.

This position is designated as High Risk and requires a background investigation. Unless an appropriate background investigation is already on record with the Office of Personnel Management, you must undergo a background investigation. All conditions of the pre-employment security process must be met before an official letter of employment can be issued with a report for duty date.

You must meet time in grade requirements no later than 30 calendar days after the closing date of this announcement.

You will be required to meet ongoing specialized safety training requirements in order to meet field safety standards.

Qualifications

NOTE: You must meet qualification requirements, including any requirements described in the Education section, by the closing date of this announcement.

In addition to the basic entry education requirements, you must have specialized experience and/or directly related education as described below:

To qualify for the GS-12 level, you must have 1 year of full-time* specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-11 level defined as preparing for investigations by applying civil and criminal provisions of environmental protection statutes, including the provisions of statutes and regulations governing the illegal generation, disposal and transportation of pollutants, toxic substances and hazardous materials.

To qualify for the GS-13 level, you must have 1 year of full-time* specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-12 level defined as conducting investigations involving disposal and/or handling of hazardous waste at Superfund sites to aid in determining who the responsible parties are.

Your answers to the online assessment will be used to evaluate your competencies in the following areas:

Knowledge laws and regulations to inspection, investigation, enforcement, and/or compliance work sufficient to plan and conduct complex investigations to identify potentially responsible parties (PRPs) at Superfund sites.
Skill in conducting interviews and interrogations.
Skill in planning, organizing and overseeing investigations; testify in legal, quasi-legal or administrative proceedings.
Skill in written communication.
Skill in oral communication.
Ability to apply them in analyzing voluminous, complex and often incomplete books and records to find evidence.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

If you have part-time work experience, read this: EPA Announcement Policies and Procedures.

Education

You need a degree or combination of education and experience as described below to qualify for this position.

0401/Life Science: You must have a bachelor's or higher degree from an accredited or pre-accredited college or university in biological sciences, agriculture, natural resource management, chemistry, or related disciplines appropriate to the position; OR a combination of education and experience with courses equivalent to a major, as listed.

0819/Environmental Engineering

All applicants must meet one of the following requirements to qualify for consideration for an engineering position:

Successful completion of a professional engineering degree at an accredited university or college

OR

Have a combination of college level education or training AND technical experience that has furnished you with (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying professional engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:
Professional registration as an engineer.
Evidence of passing the Engineer-in-Training written test.
Successful documented completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences as described by OPM.

Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's or higher degree from an accredited or pre-accredited college or university in engineering technology or in an appropriate professional field and at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance

1301/Physical Science: You must have a bachelor's or higher degree from an accredited or pre-accredited college or university in physical science, engineering, or mathematics that included 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science such as mechanics, dynamics, properties of materials, and electronics; OR a combination of education and experience with education equivalent to one of the majors listed that included at least 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

For information about accreditation requirements, visit EPA Announcement Policies and Procedures.

Excellence. Pride. Integrity. Compassion. Trust. Are you ready to plant your career in a place where words like these serve as the foundation for doing business every day? At Michigan Sugar, our purpose is Making Life Sweeter, and our mission is Creating Growth and Opportunity.

Michigan Sugar Company has an immediate full-time opportunity for a Agriculturist. This position will cover the company's East District.

Job Summary

The Agriculturist will work with assigned shareholders to consult on Michigan Sugar Company related activities and to serve as their agronomic specialist. In this role, the Agriculturist will be the direct contact for their assigned shareholders and will consult with shareholders on sugar beet production. At harvest, they will assist in monitoring grower loads to assure proper beets entering pile conducive to long term storage Additionally, the Agriculturist will guide shareholders through the necessary steps to meet shareholder requirements.

Primary Responsibilities

Provide sound agronomic advice to shareholders.
Serve as the agronomy specialist for their assigned growers.
Provide recommendations on soil fertility and crop health.
Consult with shareholders on variety selection and placement.
Track sugar beet acreage and yields from contracting to harvest.
Scout fields during the growing season, and provide recommendations to issues that may be observed, such as emergence, disease, insects, weeds, etc.
Guide shareholders through the process of contracting, share transfer, early delivery and other shareholder requirements.
Work with the Agronomists, Agronomy Managers to identify practices that can be implemented to benefit shareholders and/or Michigan Sugar Company.
Work with Ag Operations Team and shareholders to meet the needs of harvest.
Manage assigned early delivery lotteries.
Work with Ag Logistics to guide Maus operations.
Work with the Ag Communications team to support departmental programs.
Promote Michigan Sugar Company in a positive manner and support all teams in the Ag Department and the Cooperative.
Other duties as assigned.

Position Qualifications

Associate or bachelor’s degree in agronomy related study or equivalent work experience/degree
Experience with field consulting is preferred
Competent in computer software packages such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Ability to provide trusted advice to growers
Strong Agronomic skills

Key Competencies

Strong attention to detail
Must be self-motivated and able to work independently without supervision in a fast paced ever changing environment
Ability to work well with others in a team environment
Ability to work with confidential information
Ability to calmly handle adversity and professionally deal with conflict
Demonstrate ethics and integrity
Provide model behavior to demonstrate professional values
Ability to learn new software/computer programs

NOTE: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by staff assigned to this position. The above statements are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills that may be required. All staff may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

Michigan Sugar Company offers competitive salary, opportunity for professional growth, and provides excellent medical insurance 100% company paid. A comprehensive benefits package includes: dental and life insurances, 401k match, paid holidays, vacation, sick leave and more. To learn more visit www.michigansugar.com .

Michigan Sugar Company was founded in 1906 when six smaller sugar companies merged their operations. In 2002, Michigan Sugar Company became a grower-owned cooperative and in 2004, it merged with Monitor Sugar Company to form the company that exists today.

Michigan Sugar Company is headquartered in Bay City and has sugar beet processing facilities in Bay City, Caro, Croswell and Sebewaing, Michigan. Its nearly 900 grower-owners plant and harvest up to 160,000 acres of sugar beets each year in 20 Michigan counties, as well as Ontario, Canada. Those beets are sliced at the factories and turned into about 1.3 billion pounds of sugar annually.

That sugar is sold to industrial, commercial and retail customers under the Pioneer and Big Chief brands.

Michigan Sugar Company has 930 year-round employees and an additional 1,100 seasonal workers. It is the No. 1 employer in Huron County, the No. 2 employer in Bay and Sanilac counties and the No. 3 employer in Tuscola County. The company’s annual payroll is more than $65 million and its annual local economic impact is about $500 million.

Michigan Sugar Company is the third largest of eight sugar beet processing companies in the United States and Michigan is one of 11 states where sugar beets are grown in the country.

Michigan Sugar Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Who we are:

Semios is a leading provider of Digital Technology solutions, dedicated to revolutionizing the Agriculture industry through innovation, sustainability, and data-driven insights. With a global presence and a team of passionate professionals, we develop cutting-edge products spanning Farm Management Information Systems (FMIS), the Internet of Things (IoT), Crop Protection, Water Management, and Mating Disruption.

Our innovative work has received several industry awards:

AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2023) - Selected as winner of the "Overall Smart Irrigation Company Of The Year" award.
Sustainability Changemaker by SDTC (2022) - Named as one of the companies which recognize homegrown innovation in sustainable technologies in Canada
AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2021) - Selected as winner of the "Pest Management Solutions of the Year" award
Google Accelerator (2020) - Selected as 1 of 9 companies for the inaugural Google for Startups Accelerator Canada cohort, who are all using technology to solve complex challenges
Global CleanTech Top 100 (2020) - Identified as one of the companies best positioned to solve tomorrow's clean technology challenges

One of our partners produced this short video which shows what we do and our positive environmental impact.

We know our journey is only achievable by having a great team who shares ideas, tries new things and learns as we go.

Who you are:

As the Vice President of Product at Semios, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of the global agriculture Industry - through innovative solutions and digital transformation. You will lead our Product Organization, driving innovation, fostering collaboration, enabling ecosystem adoption, and spearheading the development of solutions that address the evolving needs of our customers and the industry at large. This role reports directly to the CEO.

What you will do:

Product Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy aligned with the company's vision, goals, and market demands.

Leadership: Recruit, lead, and inspire a talented team of Product Managers while fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous growth. This role also sits on the Executive Leadership Team (ELT) and will contribute to and lead the direction and strategy for the whole company.

Product Innovation: Drive product innovation by leveraging market insights, emerging technologies, and customer feedback to identify new opportunities and enhance existing solutions. This includes advising the CEO and ELT on M&A origination when strategically important.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Field Operations, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless alignment and execution of product initiatives.

Customer Focus: Champion a customer-centric approach to product development, prioritizing user experience, value delivery, and customer satisfaction.

Performance Monitoring: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track the success and impact of product initiatives, regularly reporting progress to senior leadership.

Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory developments, leveraging insights to inform product decisions and strategies.

Risk Management: Identify potential risks and challenges related to product development, implementation, and adoption, proactively mitigating issues to ensure successful outcomes.

Requirements

We want you to succeed, so you will need:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field; Master's or advanced degree preferred
Proven track record of success in product management or related roles, with at least 10 years of experience in technology or a relevant industry
Demonstrated leadership experience, including building and managing high-performing teams
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable product strategies
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across functions and levels of the organization
Passion for innovation, technology, and agriculture, with a deep understanding of industry trends, challenges, and opportunities
Results-oriented mindset, with a focus on driving measurable impact and value for customers and the business
Experience working in a product-led organization and familiarity with agile methodologies is highly desirable
Ability to travel domestically and internationally as per business needs


Salary range: USD $217,000 to $280,000 base per year, plus target bonus

Please note that the base pay offered may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and experience, as well as geographic location.

Benefits

Why this is the opportunity for you:

Sleep better knowing you're making the world a better place through more sustainable food production
Opportunity to contribute and make an impact by working on meaningful projects
Work with a team that values fun, laughter, and each other in a collaborative and casual work environment
Customizable health benefits plan for you and your family, which includes medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance
Employees are able to enroll in our company's 401(K) plan
Company paid holidays, paid vacation and sick leave

About Us:
ETRO is a fashion house that has defined Italian style around the world since 1968. From research into textiles and attention to detail, ETRO creates luxury clothing and accessories for men and women, where passion for travel and sartorial tradition are the key concepts of every collection.

POSITION OVERVIEW
ETRO is looking for an experienced Logistics Coordinator with an Import background. As a Logistics Coordinator, you will work closely with the Logistics Manager, Retail & Wholesale teams, and our 3PL, in order to make each shipment a success.

RESPONSIBILITY:
The Logistics Coordinator will work cross-departmentally to facilitate communication about the delivery stages of all ETRO products to promote an efficient and successful delivery experience.
This position includes administrative duties with oversight into shipping and tracking of orders to ensure orders are processed in accordance with the organization's customer service standards.
The position will work through data entry, email monitoring, reporting, and various other duties as required to ensure the workload is appropriately dispersed and managed.
Work as a liaison between Retail/Wholesale teams and our logistics partners to ensure prompt and proper movement of shipments.
Coordinate with freight forwarders, brokers, and 3 PL to ensure that freight orders are scheduled and shipped to meet customer expectations as well as secure proper documentation for scheduled orders
Administer weekly billing for assigned clients within the specified timeframe, including preparing invoices, transmitting invoices to clients, and delivering reports
Respond to ETRO internal and external customer inquiries with real-time information if applicable
Work with our logistics partners to track and fix shipping errors
Provide tracking information to ETRO customers which includes but is not limited to parcel shipments with FedEx, UPS and trucking companies while working with our 3PL to ensure that freight delivery appointments are tracked and scheduled
Ensure that the quality of all ETRO logistical services provided meets the required standards and SLAs (service level agreements)
Prepare and maintain inventory of samples received in the showroom.

Retail
Buying
Logistics
Finance

Bachelor's degree in business or a related field equivalent
3+ years of Logistics experience

SPECIFIC SKILLS
Mandatory proficiency with office software including AS400/BI and Microsoft products (Excel, Word, Outlook)
EDI knowledge and the ability to communicate in EDI terminology with internal customers, external customers, and suppliers
Data entry skills with Excel and some customer interaction required
Experience using a variety of operating systems with knowledge of networking, connectivity, and internet protocol
Customer service experience in a fast-paced, professional work environment
Strong management experience, analytical skills, process management or six sigma experience preferred
Demonstrated understanding of WMS (Waterfall)
Knowledgeable of a direct-to-consumer fulfillment operation
Excellent interpersonal skills are essential
Strong organization skills, attention to detail and follow-through to resolve any outstanding issues

$70,000 p/y - $75,000 p/y
