Savage X Fenty is currently looking for a Designer- Fashion Lingerie, based in Los Angeles.

How Do You Fit In?

The Designer is responsible for the creation, execution and management of the Fashion Lingerie collections. Your aesthetic should translate into designs that are clear, compelling & visually exciting. You’ll be able to clearly communicate creative ideas to both supervisors and stakeholders, collaborate on ideation with fellow designers, and work with the product development team to deliver solutions that are timely and effective. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners on the fit and execution of all products as well as work closely with merchant partners to understand customer needs and drive sales.

This position will report into the Sr Designer.

Please submit your portfolio/website to be considered for this role.

What You Will Do

Design/create

Pull inspiration tears to create mood boards at the start of each season.
Stays abreast of trends, new techniques and resources in the lingerie space.
Design Bras, Bralettes, undies, Lingerie & accessories that scream our Savage X Fenty aesthetic!
Hand sketching and CAD skills a must
Brainstorm and partner with Graphic & print design on print, graphic & hardware ideas, as needed.
Travel to Asia, Europe as needed.
Be able to confidently present Design ideas to small and large groups.
Innovate and partner with R&D teams on new fabric & trim development.
Be an inspiring, energy-giving member of the team. Be positive. Be proactive.
Send out seasonal labdip requests

Team/collaborate

Partner with technical design & PD in the creation of tech packs as well as during fit sessions
Partner with pattern maker, as needed on 1st prototypes.
Work with sourcing team to execute high quality product within calendar timelines.
Follow up on all pre-production details: color, fabric, and trim; to ensure consistent with brand aesthetic.
Take ownership of projects from concept through production.
Take initiative to streamline and innovate processes to help make workflow more efficient.
Prepare presentation material for seasonal meetings with Fenty & Leadership team.

Housekeeping

Manage linesheet updates and ensure that they are regularly updated digitally & physically.
Well-versed in PLM systems. Ensure meticulous management of all styles in PLM.
Manage your time within the brand calendar, to ensure all major milestones are hit.
Position is located in Los Angeles

Knowledge

Have a great knowledge of lingerie fabrications, especially laces & embroideries.
Well-versed in Bra & undie fitting & be able to translate your vision & design aesthetic through fit & overall garment quality

What You Can Bring

8+ years of design background with experience in Bra’s & undies
Highly skilled in Adobe Creative Suite including Illustrator, and Photoshop.
Incredibly creative and innovative with strong knowledge of intimates market
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
A team player, you contribute positively to team dynamic, cultivate passion and productivity. You are solutions driven and an efficiency advocate as well as having an all hands-on deck mentality
Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills
Detail oriented and organized.
BFA/ BA in Fashion Design.

Where We Are

This role will be based in our El Segundo Headquarters on a hybrid schedule

Pickle is a rental marketplace that aims to monetize the billions of underutilized assets sitting in consumers closets and brands inventory. Users can easily tap into shared closets within their community through flexible and/or on-demand delivery options. Our goal is to provide affordable and convenient access to quality items exactly when our users need them. We are starting with P2P clothing/accessories and expanding to other categories.

We are excited to offer a dynamic and hands-on design internship opportunity for an experienced Design Intern to join our team. This internship will provide a unique chance to contribute to the visual identity of our platform by designing app features that will drive a seamless user experience and increase user engagement. As a design intern you will work closely with our product and engineering teams to create intuitive, seamless, and visually appealing user interfaces.

Pursuing a degree in UI/UX design, interaction design, graphic design, or a related field
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, or simliar
Strong portfolio showcasing user-centered design projects and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with responsive design principles and mobile-first design
Experience designing mobile app interfaces and responsive web designs is essential
Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate design decisions
Passion for fashion, sustainability, and user-centered design


Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user needs, business requirements, and technical constraints
Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups that illustrate design concepts and user flows
Design user-centered interfaces that reflect a deep understanding of user personas and journey maps
Conduct usability testing and gather feedback to iterate and enhance designs
Work closely with developers to ensure design specifications are accurately implemented
Assist in the creation of marketing materials, social media graphics, and promotional visuals that align with the brand identity
Support the design team in maintaining and updating design guidelines, templates, and design asset libraries


Benefits

Hands-on experience working on a real-world project with a dynamic startup
Opportunity to contribute directly to a platform that promotes sustainability and empowerment.
Potential for future collaboration or employment opportunities.

About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Visual Designers weave space, typography, color, iconography, and texture together to help people successfully navigate our products. We believe that all of our products should be beautiful and accessible.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the behaviors and perceptions of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As a Visual Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. About The Job

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.

Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.

As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

Location: NYC office // hybrid

Description:
Do you ever read a piece of branded content and think “I could do that so much better?” Did your teacher call you a “social butterfly” during your parent-teacher conferences in 5th grade? Are you so chronically online that you can share every single twist and turn of the Love is Blind love triangles? If you answered “yes” to any of these questions, you might be *perfect* as Betches’ next Branded Content Associate.

Betches Media is seeking a hilarious and creative branded content associate to help our team craft fun, effective web, newsletter, and social content for our brand partners. We’re looking for someone who can nail the delicate balance between hilarious content and showing our clients off to our audience in a way that makes them say, “I want that!!” The ideal candidate is a huge Betches fan, a marketing wiz, and, above all, an ace at seamlessly combining voice-driven language with client KPIs.

This role reports to the Senior Director of Branded and Affiliate Content and will work cross-functionally with multiple departments, including sales, editorial, and marketing. You should have demonstrated strong, clean writing skills, be extremely organized, and have experience in branded content.

If interested, candidates should have receipts, proof, timelines, and screenshots of all relevant work experience. In other words, we want to see examples of your funniest writing, especially for branded or marketing projects.

Role & Responsibilities:
Write engaging, humorous content for our branded web and newsletter inclusions that incorporate brand messaging while staying true to the Betches voice
Work closely with the data and analytics teams to assess content performance and shift strategy based on those findings.
Advocate for our content during all stages of the branded content process to ensure it’s executed in alignment with our most recent findings, best practices, and audiences in mind
Spearhead frequent conversations with Content to gather valuable insights related to their verticals, organic content, and potential ideas that could inform branded content
Support the branded content manager with ideating and writing social copy for branded campaigns when schedule allows
Collaborate frequently and efficiently with other areas of the business, including marketing, editorial, and sales
Sit-in on kick-off calls and work closely with the account management team to craft and edit content that aligns with client needs
Serve as the touchpoint for Content Managers to ask questions, share suggestions, and raise concerns regarding branded content day to day

Qualifications:
2-3 years of branded content strategy and/or editorial experience

About The Job

Louis Vuitton is seeking a Media Coordinator to plan online and offline media as well as lead all aspects of campaign execution and real-time post campaign analyzation in partnership with the Media Manager and local agencies. The role will own digital display, OOH, print and lightbox creative production along with media across North and South America.

Profile

Coordinate digital display, print and OOH media planning with local agencies and ensure all media plans are always up to date.
Cross check all digital display, print, and OOH media plans against overarching budget.
Partner with Media Manager on strategy development and efficient partner/channel mix to meet campaign objectives.
Lead digital display, OOH, print and lightbox campaign creative with LV HQ.
Manage lightbox allocation, production and changeout calendar.
Lead all aspects of digital display asset production with local agencies and publishers, collaborating closely with LV HQ for asset approval.

As a Media Coordinator, you will work closely with e-commerce and merchandising teams to analyze campaign buys for allocations, working with vendors and agencies to ensure digital activity is running efficiently and making optimizations as needed. In this role, you will closely partner with external agencies, production teams and Shopping center's media teams as well as our internal Merchandising, Communications and Store Planning teams.

You will be responsible for leading and sharing digital display test link previews and secure vital approvals for on time campaign launches. As a Coordinator, you will be responsible for OOH creative production for all placements in conjunction with multiple agencies as well as produce creative allocation by campaign for print insertions. Additionally, you will compile digital display campaign overviews and reporting by outlining targets, metrics and details per partner. Finally, you will be sure to review layout, color and copy (key priority for role) prior to production to align with LV HQ guidelines and lead production of weekly newspaper insertions.

We are eager to speak to individuals who have previous print and/or digital experience as well as Microsoft Office. The ideal candidate will be able to clearly communicate timelines and handle projects independently, be very organized and detail oriented to meet multiple deadlines. You will possess strong work ethic, be an excellent problem solver, have a collaborative spirit and accountability.

Additional information

The appointed candidate will be offered a salary within the range of USD $28-$30 per hour, a comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks and two retirement plans both with employer contributions.

Please note that restrictions may apply to part-time employees

The position requires 4 days per week on site in the Louis Vuitton Corporate Office, located in the heart of Midtown, Manhattan.

Louis Vuitton is a company that respects the uniqueness of each employee and offers everyone the means to find their place and prosper. We promote initiatives aimed at supporting professional equality for everyone. We strive to go above and beyond purely symbolic measures by building a culture passionate about meaningful strategies aimed at crafting an inclusive workforce.

In addition to a generous benefits package, unparalleled career development opportunities, both locally & globally, as an employee at Louis Vuitton, you can expect to be provided with industry leading training which will offer you an in-depth insight into the luxury and retail environment.

Job Description:

At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:

Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.
Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.
Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.
Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.

We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.

Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.

Job Title: Assistant, Video Content

A little bit about our team:

You’ll be working with the talented Video and Content department at Elektra Music Group. This team handles commissioning official videos, coordinating, and shooting live content, and editing footage. Your role will directly support the creative process from inception to completion for visual projects with our diverse roster of artists.

Your role:

You will be supporting the Video Department with basic administrative duties, researching, and curating some of today’s most talented creatives, and assistant editing and archiving video projects. We are looking to delve into the industry’s most cutting-edge platforms and technologies. We want to make the videos and visuals that your friends talk about. That disrupt pop culture in the best of ways and create a buzz that propels an artist to an icon.

Here you’ll get to:

You will handle and oversee basic admin for the department (i.e., processing invoices, managing expenses, scheduling meetings and calls, booking travel, etc.)
You will oversee the landing and archival process for all video projects (i.e., official videos, lyric videos, content, etc.)
You will handle Quality Control upon landing (checking audio levels, visual inconsistencies, etc.)
You will assist with basic editing on various projects and have potential to attend set or assist with production
You will help research creatives and facilitate the video commissioning process

About you:

You have basic organizational skills and time management
You can efficiently and proficiently handle administrative tasks
You have basic editing and software knowledge
You’re passionate about music and music videos and where audio and visual intersect

We’d love it if you also had:

Basic understanding of Adobe Suite (Premiere, After Effects, Photoshop, etc.)
Basic knowledge of filming on DSLR & small-to-medium body cameras

About us:

As the home to Asylum, Atlantic, East West, Elektra, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.

Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.

Love this job and want to apply?

Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.

Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.

Our Company
At Pixi, we're dedicated to redefining beauty standards and empowering individuals to express themselves through makeup and skincare. As a leading beauty brand in the industry, we've gained global recognition for our innovative products and commitment to inclusivity. To continue our journey of growth and creativity, we are seeking an exceptional Director of Social Media & Content to join our team.

Role Overview:
As the Director of Social Media & Content, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our brand's digital presence and driving engagement across various social media platforms. You will lead a team of creative professionals and collaborate closely with marketing, creative, and product development teams to develop and execute impactful social media and content strategies. Your creativity, strategic thinking, and passion for beauty will be essential in building brand awareness and fostering meaningful connections with our audience.

Responsibilities / Accountabilities

Social Media Strategy: Develop and oversee a comprehensive social media strategy (including Live Content) that aligns with our brand’s values and objectives. Continuously evaluate and adapt the strategy to stay ahead in the ever-evolving digital landscape.
Content Creation: Lead the creation of visually stunning and compelling content, including photos, videos, graphics, live streams, and written copy, for use across our social media channels, website, and other digital platforms.
Team Leadership: Manage and inspire a team of social media and content creators, providing guidance, feedback, and mentoring to ensure the highest quality of work.
Platform Management: Manage and optimize our presence on various social media platforms, including but not limited to Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube, and Twitter. Stay up-to-date with platform updates and trends to maximize engagement.
Audience Engagement: Foster and nurture relationships with our online community by responding to comments, messages, and feedback promptly. Encourage user-generated content and meaningful interactions.
Brand: Ensure that all content is consistent with the Pixi brand in terms of style, quality, and tone of voice.
Analytics and Reporting: Utilize analytics tools to track and analyze social media performance metrics. Provide regular reports and insights to the executive team, highlighting successes and opportunities for improvement.
Content Calendar: Develop and maintain a content calendar that ensures a consistent and cohesive brand presence across all digital platforms.
Trend Spotting: Stay current with beauty and social media trends to identify opportunities for innovative content and marketing strategies.
Budget Management: Responsible for the budget allocated to social media and content creation, ensuring efficient allocation of resources.
Compliance: Ensure all content adheres to industry regulations and best practices for transparency and authenticity.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field (Master's preferred).
Proven experience in a senior-level social media and content role within the beauty industry.
Strong understanding of social media algorithms, advertising, and digital marketing trends.
Exceptional creative and storytelling skills.
Proficiency in social media management tools and analytics platforms.
Strong leadership and team management abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Passion for beauty, makeup, and skincare trends.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Do you want to work for a Championship organization? We have the job for you! The Miami HEAT Digital Content Team is seeking a Digital Content Producer/Editor!

What drives you? We are seeking a creative, and innovative Producer/Editor that has a drive and passion for telling stories to our digital audience. Our ideal candidate would be able to explore the digital landscape for the “next thing” as inspiration but also has the prowess to take an idea from conception to completion. The perfect candidate understands the internet and thrives on crafting a piece of content that ends up in a group chat because of how engaging it is. You want to build work that stands out. You love being creative, and crafting high-quality work is what matters to you. All in an environment that fosters growth and creativity. We are looking for someone who can help us develop and build outstanding branded content.

Ultimately, you should be able to maintain quality and consistency across media types and web platforms and drive increased traffic and brand visibility.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The following are examples of the various functions required. The job requirements are not limited to the items on this list.

Collaborate with the creative team to brainstorm and develop content ideas for HEAT digital properties.
Produce and build video and audio content as it pertains to the Miami HEAT digital content strategy.
Responsible for the use and essential maintenance of industry-leading video and audio equipment.
Work with content project managers and creative leadership to maintain content quality standards and optimize content for digital channels.
Help coordinate, label, and manage assets key to the production of creative & video-related content.
Keep up to date with the ever-shifting social media landscape to help capitalize on social moments.
Assist the Digital Content team in the ideation and execution of HEAT-branded digital content.

Job Title: Social Copywriter (Part-Time)

Hourly Pay: $45/hour

Department: Creative

Manager: Editorial Director

Who We Are

Launched by Lady Gaga, Haus Labs is a vegan and cruelty-free cosmetics brand with a mission of spreading kindness, bravery, and creativity. Filled with versatile products that encourage self-expression, this collection boasts high-impact eye makeup, lipsticks, highlighters, and more. Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive, equal opportunity workplace.

Overview

We are looking for a Part-Time Social Copywriter in Los Angeles to help drive creative and disruptive marketing efforts across all brand-owned social media channels, through supporting the execution of social media and community copywriting. We are looking for a strong writer that’s obsessed with beauty and social media. The Social Copywriter will report into the Editorial Director and will collaborate closely with the Social Media Team to optimize copy to meet product marketing objectives, develop hooks, as well as elevate storytelling and brand voice. You’ll need to be extremely creative, collaborative, and open to feedback.

What You’ll Do

Write compelling and creative copy across brand-owned social touchpoints and contribute to 360° brand storytelling ideas, including writing for TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, video scripts, paid media, among other touchpoints
Build community on socials by engaging with and posting open-ended conversation openers on public facing comments
Keep a thumb on social trends and tapped into the conversations happening across all the different platforms, not to mention you’re acutely aware of the differences among TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and Pinterest and know exactly how to write for each of them
You understand how copy enhances the paired visuals
Work with social media team, designers, and art directors to create high-performing visual-verbal storytelling
Have flexibility of writing tone with a consistent brand voice
Optimize copy based on feedback
Own and enforce our social style guide
Be cognizant of legal copy regulatory requirements to flag and liaise with Legal and PD to ensure that copy meets all legal and regulatory requirements
Prioritize SEO Copy when possible
Proofread to ensure copy is spotless and error-free across all channels
Respond to incoming comments in brand-voice on all social channels daily (Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, Threads, etc),

What We’re Looking For

Exceptional writing, grammar, and proofreading skills are a must
A passion for beauty, makeup and social media. You are in tune and follow the trends, influencers, and brands to be able to push the conversation forward in the industry
Strong passion for customers and community & therefore the ability to spark social conversations
Be a high energy go-getter, who’s got a positive, friendly attitude
Strong work ethic with exceptional project management & organizational skills
Meticulous attention to detail and an ongoing commitment to achieving high-quality results
Well-versed in social media platforms and have a deep understanding of platform tools (ex. TikTok and IG stories features, etc)

What We Expect

At Haus Labs, how you communicate is as important as what you communicate. We are seeking driven team players with strong communication skills and enthusiasm for collaboration.
You’re a self-starter who possesses an entrepreneurial spirit.
You thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment.
You are a team player who approaches solutions from a place of curiosity and positivity.
We are seeking HAUSmates who welcome constructive criticism and have an impeccable attention to detail.

Our Pillars

ART: We are a creative collective that believes art has the power to shape the future.

SCIENCE: We unlock innovation using science and artistry.

KINDNESS: We are a collective community: universal, inclusive and non-binary.

Meet REVOLVE

REVOLVE is the next-generation fashion retailer for Millennial and Generation Z consumers. As a trusted, premium lifestyle brand, and a go-to online source for discovery and inspiration, we deliver an engaging customer experience from a vast yet curated offering totaling over 45,000 apparel, footwear, accessories and beauty styles. Our dynamic platform connects a deeply engaged community of millions of consumers, thousands of global fashion influencers, and more than 500 emerging, established and owned brands. Through 20 years of continued investment in technology, data analytics, and innovative marketing and merchandising strategies, we have built a powerful platform and brand that we believe is connecting with the next generation of consumers and is redefining fashion retail for the 21st century. For more information please visit www.revolve.com.

At REVOLVE the most successful team members have the thirst and creativity to redefine fashion retail for the 21st century, making REVOLVE the leading online retail destination targeted towards Millennial and Generation Z consumers seeking premium fashion. With a team of 1,000 strong, we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level. It’s our goal to hire high-energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast-paced work environment.

Some of the sweetest perks we offer aren’t in a typical benefit package like hefty discount on items we carry – as in 50% or more off retail prices, free weekly lunches, and pretty rad company parties.

Working closely with the Brand Marketing and Merchandising team, the Instagram team will strengthen REVOLVE’s visual presence, voice and brand equity with our audience. This role is creative and executional, and will also contribute to broader storytelling across a variety of channels – including REVOLVE.com blog and REVOLVE YouTube – by way of copywriting, content creation and more.

Major Responsibilities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Work closely with the Instagram Social Media Manager to establish an annual social calendars that includes all of REVOLVE’s key commerce initiatives, brand initiatives and events
Contribute to the development of detailed social campaigns for key brand initiatives
Plan, schedule and post daily Instagram story content, ensuring they serve merchandising /business goals
Write compelling, on-brand copy – often under tight deadlines – that fit the specific goals of each initiative
Attend REVOLVE events / editorial shoots to capture video content and edit for reels, as needed
Support community management / audience interaction, as needed
Contribute to creative brainstorms to develop new content concepts
Support the day-to-day posting and performance monitoring to ensure creative quality and cohesion
Work closely with Brand Marketing cross-functional teams (Influencer Relations, Events, Partnerships) to ensure excellent social integration and support for events and marketing campaigns
Quarterly competitive research to identify new opportunities, messaging and creative approaches

You are an organized, strategic, creative, and analytical marketer who wants to impact all stages of the digital marketing funnel and consumer journey. Learning from seasoned channel experts, this role is ideal for anyone wanting to refine their digital marketing skill set by supporting the delivery of brand, product, and commercial initiatives/campaigns. You have a knack for organization and are highly collaborative; you will be partnering with a wide range of cross-functional regional and global stakeholders, aiming to bring to life the digital strategy for the Dr. Martens Americas’ e-commerce organization.

THE GIG

The Digital Marketing Specialist will report to the Digital Marketing Manager – Affiliates, while supporting the entire Digital Marketing team (channels include: affiliates, paid media partnerships, paid social, paid and organic search, video/display, email and SMS). Day-to-day support will adjust seasonally based on team’s needs; however, majority of time will be dedicated to affiliate/partnerships and paid media channels, supporting campaign planning/project management, campaign building/production, QA, and reporting. Role responsibilities include:

Paid Channel Support – 60% of role
Execute against affiliate and partner marketing strategies to expand program reach and drive performance
Support affiliate and paid media channel managers with campaign setup and builds within ad platforms (not limited to Google, Bing, Meta, TikTok) in accordance with outlined strategies, methodologies, and budget.
Audit campaigns and provide refreshment recommendations.
Ongoing competitive and best in class industry/channel insight gathering to arm the Digital Marketing Team to optimize internal programs and testing roadmaps.
Partner with channel owners on potential coverage support for key holidays (i.e. Thanksgiving, Black Friday, and Cyber Week) as needed on a predetermined basis.

Administrative – 30% of role
Collaborate with global and regional brand, digital, site merchandising/content/operations teams.
Coordinate, track, and document regional execution plans within our project management system (Asana) for brand, product, and commercial initiatives that require digital marketing support.
Organize campaign materials and communicate to appropriate cross-functional team members.
Occasional event and meeting coordination and/or note-taking.

Reporting & Ad-Hoc Projects – 10% of role
Weekly, monthly, and quarterly channel, campaign, and testing performance reporting.
QA support for digital marketing channels where needed (i.e. promo code functionality, customer journeys).
Ad hoc research assignments to support.
Own the monthly internal digital newsletter – highlighting competitor activity, industry benchmarks/trends, as well as showcasing the team’s applied learnings via tests/implementation.

THE STUFF THAT SETS YOU APART

1-2 year(s) of experience with a media agency, E-Commerce, or marketing organization (knowledge of affiliate and paid media channels a plus).
Interest in strengthening their digital marketing, paid media and/or e-commerce expertise.

Strong organization, proactiveness, attention to detail (experience with Asana and JIRA a plus).

Analytical and data-driven mindset (experience with Google Analytics 4 or comparable analytics tools a plus).
International travel: 0%; domestic travel: 0%.

Job Description:

At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:

Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.
Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.
Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.
Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.

We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.

Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.

Job Title: Assistant, Publicity

A little bit about our team:

The publicity department at Elektra Entertainment is based in NY and LA and is responsible for all outreach and liaising with all print, TV, online and regional media on behalf of our artists and the company. Elektra Entertainment is comprised of Elektra, Fueled By Ramen (FBR), Roadrunner, Low Country Sound, DTA Records, and more.

Your role:

The PR team at Elektra Entertainment works closely together to formulate and implement national/regional publicity campaigns. This job is based in NY and will be responsible for working directly with the NY-based department and a LA-based national publicist, as well as many of the administrative duties for the department as a whole.

The publicity department works with a roster of artists across different genres, maintaining the profiles and overall visibility of our artist through coverage in print, TV and online media. The PR department maintains photos, bios and issues official press releases to the media and company. We also plan and execute special events, interaction and planning with certain industry awards and award shows.

Here you’ll get to:

Work directly with the NY department and LA-based national publicist on developing and executing media campaigns for Elektra Entertainment artists across different genres of music, with specific target lists for each active project, including print, TV, and online targets.
Help manage quarterly publicity budgets throughout the course of a campaign.
Assist in communicating the status of all media outreach regularly to artist management and company management.
Assist in the drafting, routing, and dissemination of all press links, bios, and press releases.
Help organize, plan, and produce special events for artists, including album release parties, platinum/gold certification parties, and artists showcases among others.
Oversee the hiring and activity of department interns.
Assist with administrative tasks, including invoices, expenses, and calendar management

About you:

You are detail-oriented, proactive, and energetic.
You like to write and have excellent verbal and written communication skills externally and internally (note: we highly encourage you to submit a writing sample or cover letter in your application to showcase your capabilities)
You have strong organizational skills
You maintain composure under stressful situations
You have an interest in pursuing a career in publicity and building relationships with the media, as well as a knowledge and expertise in dealing with the media.
You are a team player
You are familiar and able to work across different genres of music

We’d love it if you also had:

Experience (as an intern or paid position) within the music industry and, ideally, in publicity
Experience and interest in writing
Bachelor’s degree, ideally in communications or public relations

About us:

As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.

Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.

Love this job and want to apply?

Forbes believes in the power of entrepreneurial capitalism and uses it on various platforms to ignite the conversations that drive systemic change in business, culture and society. We celebrate success and are committed to using our megaphone to drive diversity, equity and inclusion.

The editorial team drives the look and feel of the brand. We creatively lead a range of work, from daily feature stories to large scale Forbes lists like 30 Under 30, Top Creators, the Forbes 400 and the World’s Billionaires List. Our designers collaborate across the newsroom, product, tech, marketing and live event teams to tell holistic stories that add value to our audience's everyday lives.

The ideal candidate has a great eye for photography, enjoys finding unexpected images and is skilled in file organization and production work. This position reports to the Director of Photography.

Responsibilities

Ensure a consistent style of photography across all platforms that aligns with Forbes’ Brand Guidelines.
Photo Research for feature stories and lists:
Research, edit and license imagery from stock sources, photographers and external sources.
Research, organize and license headshots for notable Forbes lists, including 30 Over 30, 50 over 50, the Forbes 400, America’s Richest Self-Made Women, top athletes and more.
Collaborate with Forbes international partners to update headshots or provide US images.
Aid in the creation of timelines for photo deliverables on lists in collaboration with Sr. Photo Editor and Project Managers.
Aid in the flow of post-production on photography for lists by suggesting retouching improvements, creating diptychs and resizing photographs.
Proper image crediting and file organization on the Forbes’ servers and Digital Asset Management System (DAM)
Knowledge of The Forbes Collection archival imagery dating back 10+ years.
Knowledge of Forbes Event Photography systems and workflow.
Distribute photos to internal colleagues such as editorial, PR, video, sales, marketing, etc …
The Ideal Candidate

BA/BFA in Photography or related field with 3-8 years of experience at a media or editorial publishing company.
Comfortable working within a DAM system.
A portfolio that demonstrates an eye for storytelling, excellent taste, a passion for photography and a keen sense of what will perform well across different digital platforms.
Must have a positive attitude and be a team player with strong communication skills.
Excellent organization skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced breaking news environment under tight deadlines.
You enjoy staying current on creative trends and industry technology, sharing findings with the department to facilitate new ways of thinking, working and problem solving.

The hourly rate for this role is $35.00 - $35.00

As the nation’s largest media representation firm, Katz Media Group delivers local relevance at scale. Whether you want one idea that sounds local in a hundred different markets or a hundred unique ideas, we have your solution.

Over our long history, the Katz name has been synonymous with leadership in the media industry. Founded in 1888, Katz was the nation’s first media representation firm. Today, Katz Media Group is comprised of two divisions, Katz Radio Group and Katz Television Group. Collectively, the company represents both the on-air and online assets of more than 4,000 radio stations and 800 television stations, making Katz Media Group the largest media representation company in America. In addition to our deeply rooted media expertise, our unique regional sales structure is key to driving our clients’ success. Katz Media Group is based in New York City, with 15 regional offices across the country, providing advertisers and agencies with local expertise and insights across the nation.

About Carrot

Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility care platform, serving people of every age, race, income, sex, sexual orientation, gender, marital status, and geography. Trusted by hundreds of multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. Whether there is a need for care through fertility preservation, male-factor infertility, pre-pregnancy, IVF, pregnancy and postpartum, adoption, gestational surrogacy, or menopause, Carrot supports members and their families through many of the most memorable and meaningful moments of their lives. With Carrot, you can pursue your possible.

The Role

Interested in Carrot, but don’t see an open position that aligns with your background? Let’s Connect.

While we may not have an open position now that aligns with your background, we are always looking for good talent and may have future opportunities suited for your skillset and expertise. By connecting with us, we will have access to your resume and application information for future reference, and we will be sure to reach out if something aligns, and to keep you informed about new positions. As always, if you see any opportunities that open up, please also feel free to submit your application to those roles as well!

We love that you want to help us in our mission of making fertility care accessible to all, and we hope to chat with you soon!

Why Carrot?

Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Best Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Product from the Anthem Awards, Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, CNBC's 100 Barrier Breaking Startups, and more. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, healthcare innovation and diversity, equity, and inclusion, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more.

Carrot is a remote-first company with teams in more than 40 states across the United States and dozens of countries around the world. It has received numerous workplace awards, including Fortune's Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Quartz’s Best Companies for Remote Workers, and Great Place to Work and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.

Descrição da Vaga:
The Company

Based in Bloomfield, CT, LiquidPiston, Inc. is an MIT rooted R&D company that develops power-dense, fuel-efficient, low-vibration, and multi-fuel capable combustion engines.

The company is funded by a mix of Venture Capital, Crowdfunding, and DoD contracts.

A comprehensive patent portfolio includes engine architectures, components, and enabling technologies for the world’s most efficient rotary engines.

LiquidPiston maintains state-of-the-art lab facilities in a 12,000 sq. foot headquarters, including two fully equipped dynamometer cells, engineering offices, and a 4,000 sq. foot machine shop.

THE MARKET

Building on over 15 years of R&D, LiquidPiston provides scalable power solutions to address the needs of the $400B internal combustion engine market, and is a key enabler for emerging mobility technologies including electric cars, urban aircraft, and drones. The company is currently focusing on military and aerospace applications and markets. Longer term plans include entry to the industrial, commercial, marine, UAV, urban mobility, and automotive spaces.

Position Overview

Reporting to the CEO, the Vice President of Engineering will be a key member of the executive team, leading LiquidPiston into the next phase of growth and development as it transitions from R&D into Product Development and Commercialization. As the Engineering leader, the selected candidate must have both the technical and people skills to manage a passionate, high-performance team. The current engineering headcount of approximately 20 is expected to double over the next year.

The VP of Engineering will be responsible for leading and driving engine and generator development programs while providing oversight, technical direction, management, and leadership for designers, analysts, engineers, technicians, machinists, and contractors in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Additional responsibilities include co-authoring technical papers and proposals, as well as preparation for and participation in meeting with existing and potential customers.

Professional Experience

It is expected that the VP of Engineering will have at least a BS in Mechanical Engineering, with an MSME and/or Ph.D. preferred. Ideally, s/he will have a working knowledge of rotary/diesel engine development, heavy fuel engine calibration expertise, and working knowledge of power generation and storage electronics (alternators, batteries, PLC).

Previous experience working with government agencies (DOE, DARPA, etc.) is desirable, as is prior success leading startups or small companies with manufacturing environments. Ideally, the VP of Engineering will be familiar with software including SolidWorks, Labview, Mastercam, Converge, Matlab, GT Suite, ANSYS.

PERSONAL QUALITIES AND CULTURAL FIT

Excellent team/people skills, with a motivating, collaborative style. Delegates effectively and shares credit where due
A quick learner. Can quickly assess the landscape and then prioritize objectives and opportunities. Is decisive.
Open communicator of ideas and willing to stand behind and support his/her opinions
Is proactive vs. reactive. Can foresee potential opportunities and roadblocks.
Gets excited about the opportunity to transform an industry
Strong presentation skills for board, investors, customers, and partners
Motivated by a high need for achievement.
A fast mover with high energy
Consensus builder; a good listener

Individuals tentatively selected for drug testing designated positions will be required to submit to urinalysis for illegal drugs prior to appointment and are subjected to random drug testing.
Position has been designated as a Top Secret Security designation level Special Sensitive. Incumbent is required to obtain and maintain a Top Secret/SS security clearance.
The incumbent must adhere to DoD Standards of Conduct

Qualifications

In order to qualify for this position, you must meet the requirements described below.

Basic Requirements

Computer Engineer GG-0854 or Electronics Engineer GG-0855

Degree: Engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by ABET; or
include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.

OR

Combination of education and experience -- college-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:1. Professional registration or licensure -- Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT)1 , or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.
Written Test -- Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE)2 examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico.
Specified academic courses -- Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in the basic requirements under paragraph A. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in paragraph A.
Related curriculum -- Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. (The above examples of related curricula are not all inclusive.)

Computer Scientist GG-1550

Bachelor's degree in computer science or bachelor's degree with 30 semester hours in a combination of mathematics, statistics, and computer science. At least 15 of the 30 semester hours must have included any combination of statistics and mathematics that included differential and integral calculus.

Qualifying Experience

To qualify at the GG-13, your resume must describe at least one year of experience that demonstrates the competencies necessary for immediate success in the position. Experience refers to any paid or unpaid experience, including volunteer work and Military service, that would be considered equivalent to work normally performed at the next lower grade level in the federal service.

For this position, qualifying experience is defined as: Experience in providing technical guidance with respect to AI, AI-enabled systems, data science, data analytics and other fields such as scientific concepts, principles, standards, methods, techniques, practices, and procedures.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Candidates must describe how they meet the qualifying experience and/or selective placement factor(s) within the body of their resume. All qualifications must be met at the closing date of this announcement.

Education

There is no substitution of education for the qualifying experience at the GG-13 grade level.

Transcripts The absence of this information will result in an ineligible rating. (WHS serviced employees will be verified via eOPF or you may include them in your application package. However, it is the employee's responsibility to ensure that his/her eOPF contains the required transcript and is up-to-date).

To be creditable, education must have been obtained in an accredited college or university. You must report only attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions that are recognized by the U.S. Department of Education .

Foreign Education: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show that the education credentials have been evaluated by the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services at the time of application. National Association of Credential Evaluation Services .

Job Description

Lead Product Development process, for all PVE products, in supplier evaluation, definition of product spec., development of test plans, competitive product testing and analysis, and patent clearance.
Design, develop, and test electrical systems and components.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, and designers, to integrate electrical systems into overall product designs.
Troubleshoot and debug electrical systems, identifying and resolving issues in a timely manner.
Work with sales/engineering/manufacturing to develop and launch new Product offerings which meet Quality, Cost, and Delivery goals.
Present updates and new product suggestions on an ongoing basis.
Assure supplier (and sub-suppliers) have manufacturing process capability and capacity to meet requirements.
Responsible for confirmation of working prototypes, engineering samples, and pilot lot samples meeting all requirements.
Evaluate and resolve safety concerns, both internal company standards and safety listing agencies.
Responsible for executing the Milestone Process and communicating project status/updates as required.
Work closely with Production to ensure that all the manufacturing procedures are followed.
Engineering background is preferred.

Company Description

Pneumatic Vacuum Elevators LLC is the designer and manufacturer of the world's only Air-Driven Home Elevator, the Vacuum Elevator.

Headquartered in South Florida, PVE currently manufactures four versions of its air driven residential elevators, ranging from single to a three-passenger, wheelchair-accessible home elevator. All of PVE’s vacuum home lift systems are capable of up to a 50 foot (15m) vertical rise over as many as five stops. The unique design of the vacuum residential elevator is a perfect choice for any retrofit or new construction project and will enhance the value of one’s home without the consuming footprint of a traditional home elevator. These innovative home elevator do not require any pre-construction shaft, pit or machine room and can be installed in as little as two to three days. By using a vacuum pump to generate areas of higher and lower atmospheric pressure within the cylinder hoist way, the unit smoothly moves between floors while using much less energy than other home elevators.

Join a company revolutionizing the elevator industry with our eco-friendly home lifts!

Job Title: Home-Based Hotel Scheduler (Remote)

Job Type: Remote

Position Overview: We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive individual to join our team as a Home-Based Hotel Scheduler (Remote). In this role, you will be responsible for managing hotel reservations, coordinating room assignments, and maintaining accurate records of bookings and availability. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a customer-focused mindset, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, remote work environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Liaise with hotels and accommodation providers to manage room availability, negotiate rates, and secure reservations on behalf of clients
Coordinate with clients to understand their accommodation needs, preferences, and special requests, and provide personalized recommendations based on their requirements
Utilize hotel management software and reservation systems to input, update, and track reservations, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in all scheduling tasks
Monitor hotel occupancy rates, forecast demand, and adjust reservations as needed to maximize room utilization and revenue opportunities
Communicate effectively with clients via phone, email, and online chat to confirm reservations, provide booking details, and address any inquiries or concerns in a timely and professional manner
Collaborate with team members and hotel partners to resolve scheduling conflicts, manage cancellations and modifications, and ensure a seamless booking experience for clients
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of hotel policies, rates, and amenities to provide clients with accurate information and recommendations
Generate reports and analyze data related to hotel occupancy, booking trends, and client preferences to identify opportunities for optimization and improvement

Qualifications:

Previous experience in hotel reservations, hospitality management, or a related field is preferred but not required
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact professionally and courteously with clients, colleagues, and hotel staff
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to prioritize tasks, multitask, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment
Proficiency in using computer systems, online booking platforms, and hotel management software to process reservations and manage scheduling tasks
Customer-focused mindset with a commitment to delivering exceptional service and creating positive experiences for clients and hotel partners
Ability to work independently and remotely, with a reliable internet connection and a dedicated workspace conducive to productivity
Flexibility to accommodate varying work schedules, including evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed to support client needs and business operations

Benefits:

Competitive compensation package with opportunities for performance-based incentives and bonuses
Flexible remote work arrangement with the ability to work from home or any location with internet access
Ongoing training and professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge of the hospitality industry
Employee discounts on hotel accommodations and other perks
Collaborative and supportive work environment with opportunities for growth and advancement within the company

Descrição da Vaga:
We Create Products and Brands That People Trust to Clean, Sanitize, and Protect Their Homes, Pools, and Cars.
When you join KIK Consumer Products, you’re joining a team that cares about the work we do and also about each other. We bring exceptional brands and products to consumers that help them protect the health and wellness of their families, the cleanliness of their homes and pools, and the life of their automobiles. We are committed to building a culture of performance driven by accountability, empowerment, collaboration, and agility that enables timely fact-based decision-making and exceptional execution with unwavering ethics. As one of North America’s largest independent manufacturers of consumer products, KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life.

Your Role at KIK
The VP of Process Engineering will build a high-performance engineering organization to drive value creation across the KIK Manufacturing Network. They will oversee 16 U.S. manufacturing sites across the Auto, Household and Pool divisions. The VP will develop and drive a project pipeline of value-added projects that reduce conversion costs, provide new and enhanced manufacturing capabilities, and improve quality across the network through ingenuity and capital investment. The VP will develop and deploy an enterprise-wide continuous improvement program to improve throughput, OEE/ reliability and reduce waste through manufacturing initiatives. They will oversee the execution of operational capital expense projects and the corresponding enterprise CAPEX budget.

What You’ll Be Doing
Lead, grow, and develop both their direct KIK engineering team, outsourced engineering and the operations team to build a continuous improvement mindset with a focus on value creation.
Ensure all capital projects are delivered on/ahead of schedule and on/under budget. Be transparent for situations that arise around schedule/ budget expectations.
In partnership with Operations Leadership, articulate, role model, and hold the Operations organization accountable to a culture of value creation, continuous improvement, and service while driving integrity, collaboration, innovation, transparency, and high-performance.
Drive Value to identify opportunities to enhance processes in order to improve reliability, reduce labor cost, and improve quality.
Develop pipeline of value creation, value engineering, continuous improvement, and LEAN projects to support enterprise financial targets through the execution of operational goals that drive efficiency, cost management and growth opportunities.
Establish enterprise operational excellence discipline that drives efficiency, cost management, scalability and value creation.
Exhibit the L.E.A.D.S. (Learner, Entrepreneur, Articulate, Driver, Self-Motivated) characteristics with the Executive Leadership Team, Integrated Supply Chain, and Operations Leadership and other key stakeholders to drive collaboration and team success.

What You’ll Bring
Bachelor's degree in chemical, mechanical, electrical, or related discipline from an accredited institution.
10 years of people leadership experience with 15 years or more of engineering experience in a consumer-packaged goods or similar manufacturing environment, including managing an Engineering team to support and transform a business platform.
Proven track record of driving continuous improvements and operational reliability through sustainable processes.
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio.
Project management and time management experience with a record of success.
Packaging process knowledge a definite plus.
Job requires 50% travel; Driver’s license and Passport are required.

What You Will Get
KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

About KIK
We create the products and brands that people trust to clean, sanitize, and protect their homes, pools, and cars. We are one of North America’s largest independent consumer product manufacturers with 20 North American manufacturing facilities. We also operate globally in Europe, Asia, UK, Australia, New Zealand, and South Africa. We are known by our portfolio of over 40 brands including Spic and Span® and Comet® cleaning products, Clorox® Pool&Spa™ (under license), BioGuard®, and Natural Chemistry® pool chemicals, and Prestone® and Holts® automotive performance chemicals. We are also the #1 producer in North America for store-brand (“private label”) bleach and a leading private label provider of laundry detergent and additives, dishwashing products, general purpose cleaning and other home care products.

Our global team of over 2,500 employees drive our capabilities in product development, product formulation, strategic sourcing, manufacturing, packaging design, brand marketing, project management, quality assurance, compliance, distribution, and logistics.
Our organization is constantly evolving and is driven by a set of “One KIK” values – a dedication to following through on commitments in a customer-focused, profit-motivated way; while never compromising on safety, ethics, or integrity.

KIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. KIK does not discriminate against qualified applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, status in uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.

KIK is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, or to perform the essential functions of the job, please contact Human Resources immediately.

Descrição da Vaga:
Vice President of Engineering

Full-time / Permanent

About Us

Vantedge Medical is the premier metals-based med-tech solutions partner from concept to full-scale manufacturing. We are at the forefront of precision engineering and innovation, specializing in the development and manufacturing of vital components for medical markets such as Robotic Assisted Surgery, Orthopedics, Surgical Instruments, Dental, and more. Our teams work in unison, collaborating and problem-solving to serve the manufacturing needs of the top Medical Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) around the globe. Making a difference in the lives of patients and their families drives us to go above and beyond every day. With a steadfast commitment to advancing medical technology, we take immense pride in the work we do – and have a lot of fun doing it.

About This Opportunity

The Vice President of Engineering will have the responsibility to establish and implement best practices to improve cost, delivery, and quality. This role will interact with all Vantedge sites to provide direct leadership of the quoting function, guidance and support to site engineering and leadership teams regard value creation activities involving the engineering function.

Responsibilities

Create a quoting (virtual) center of excellence with consistent standards and methodology designed to achieve accurate cost estimates.
Develop cost savings plan including insourcing outside operations, optimizing cycle times, man to machine ratios, automation and process efficiency.
Support and provide guidance as needed to various sites utilizing knowledge of large format machining, sheet metal, CNC turning and milling, Wire EDM, Laser Etch/Mark/Welding, Welding, Polishing, Finishing, Cleaning, Assembly, and Inspection.
Develop methods to improve machine uptime including predictive maintenance, real time monitoring, quick / reduced changeovers, etc.
Standardize the use of DFM tools where appropriate.
Provide analysis of equipment capacity and develop a strategy to ensure future demand coverage through efficient use of existing capacity and timely investment when needed.

Company Overview
Our client is a global manufacturer of high-quality COMMERCIAL/RESIDENTIAL KITCHEN EQUIPMENT, accessories, and appliance solutions. They also provide workspace optimization services for the foodservice and convenience store industries. Our client is part of a multinational conglomerate with several divisions and operations across continents, offering over a century of experience in crafting tailor-made equipment for the largest and most recognized organizations in the food service industry worldwide. They are also strong business partners with brands in expansion and chain organizations in different segments.

Their corporate strategy is built on insightful knowledge of their customers' core business, positioning them as strategic partners in tailoring solutions for automation and equipment interoperability. Their customers seek more efficient and modern ways to operate restaurant systems, finding our client highly competitive and reliable.

Additional information will be provided to qualified candidates later in the process.

Title: Global Vice President of Engineering, Product Development and R&D
Location: Nashville area, Tennessee
Reports to: CEO

The Position
The VP of Engineering, Product Development and R&D is a crucial global leadership role responsible for driving the innovation and development of new products within the division to marketing specifications. In this role, you will define the vision of product development for the division to ensure continuous growth and success in the highly competitive food service industry by using technical expertise, leadership skills, industry knowledge, and a passion for leading change.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate a track record of driving successful product launches, have a strategic mindset, and have the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. This individual will be responsible for driving the development of products from engineering through manufacturing, along with quality assurance product acceptance procedures, to market release under marketing specifications.

Candidates must have prior experience building a strong global team, creating centers of excellence, increasing technical competencies, and being a champion of design quality, product management alignment, and design for manufacturing.
In line with corporate goals, the ideal candidate will develop strong relations with the appropriate authorities and testing laboratories for product approval. You will provide direction on managing all product-related regulatory matters including the legalities of patent infringement, patent application, patent research and product liability. This person will be the face of the company at trade association meetings, conventions, and client summits.

Duties and Responsibilities
Ensuring the development of new products to Marketing specifications and corporate goals
Creating conceptual design, recommending materials and manufacturing details
Managing the development process for new and/or potential products; liaising with customer and/or other departments to gain approval along with appropriate authorities and testing laboratories
Provides direction and/or manages all product related legal issues including patent infringement, patent application, patent research and product liability
Designing, implementing, and standardizing, policies, and procedures in the Product Development department across continents, with a strong continuous improvement mindset
Representing the Company at trade association meetings, conventions, and client meetings
Analyzing and controlling expenditures of the department to conform with budget requirements
Approving products for market release, maintaining all relevant data records and providing accurate information to product management. Work with other departments to recommend selling price and forecast sales of new and/or potential products
Coordinates, with Human Resources, all aspects of employee relations including recruiting, hiring, training & development, coaching and counseling, scheduling, among others
Liaise with FAS to ensure all materials and processes are compliant with ANSI/FDA standards and testing is conducted to ASTM standards
Ensures employees Business skills requirements and current level of FAS, providing necessary training.
Manage all global smallware product complaints and any subsequent liability to ensure corrective actions are established and executed to minimize impact to the Division and its customers
Take lead role in the development and establishment of all business tools and standards for the global smallware product development groups; support of all global smallware’s teams to maximize information sharing and minimize product duplication
Negotiate and establish price adjustment terms based on commodity indices and exchange rates.
Research, recommend and implement new manufacturing/sourcing channels to maximize competitive advantage

Qualifications
An ENGINEERING DEGREE is required, preferably with a master's degree in relevant fields (engineering, or industrial design)
A robust experience in COMMERCIAL/RESIDENTIAL KITCHEN EQUIPMENT, accessories, and appliance product development is essential, in the foodservice industry or industries with similar challenges. Candidates should have a proven track record of successfully launching new products and managing the end-to-end product development process in a global business environment with a low volume high mix production
Influencer, results driven, process oriented, and competitive global orientation with a hands-on leadership style
A deep understanding of the food service industry dynamics is necessary. This includes knowledge of market trends, customer needs, and a competitive landscape. Commercial kitchen equipment and systems knowledge
Extensive experience building/rebuilding global high performance teams in the US and Europe or US and Asia
Ability to travel within the US and abroad (25-30%)
Strong strategic thinker, organizational leadership skills, innovation mindset, communicator and collaborator, project management skills and quality focus approach

Complete required loan submission checklists
Manage pipeline within allotted turn times
Document all communication related to the loan application in the conversation log.

Minimum of 1 year of experience in the mortgage industry

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
