Hello, Financial Leaders!

We're Emma and Jordan, the Co-Founders of Gameway. Gameway is the world's first premium video game lounge located in airports. We revolutionize airport travel by making the start of your journey fun and entertaining. Based on how much time you have until your next flight, you can enjoy a first-class video game experience to make time fly by.

We are seeking a Financial Director to lead the financial strategy and operations at our rapidly expanding business. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in financial management for multi-state, multi-location businesses, demonstrating expertise in navigating the complexities of commercial hubs and bank negotiations. This role calls for a strategic leader capable of building and guiding our team from the outset to drive our transition from a 7 to 8-figure revenue business. With exceptional relationship management and negotiation skills, this individual will be pivotal in steering our company through its next phase of growth, making strategic decisions that align with our ambitious objectives.

This is an In-Office Position.

Requirements

Has 5+ years of experience in a Finance/Accounting leadership role (ex. CFO, Financial Director, Lead Controller, etc)
Strong Financial Operations/Controller background.
Experienced in overseeing the financial operations critical to growing a company's revenue from 7 to 8 figures
Significant experience in multi-state financial operations. Potential Industries include: Airport Concessions (highly preferred), Commercial Real Estate, Retail, F&B, Construction, Hospitality
Strong relationship management and communication skills, with a focus on negotiating with commercial hubs (e.g., airports, malls) and financial institutions
Demonstrated expertise in debt financing (including structuring, negotiating, and securing loans or credit facilities)
Comfortable and ready to take a hands-on approach with a lean team, starting with one direct report
Has experience leading and managing projects with deliverables, accountability, and a timeline
Quickbooks Online and related SaaS integrations
Comfortable working occasional overtime/weekends.


Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

Lead the finance and accounting team in setting and aligning strategic financial goals with the company's growth objectives, while developing and implementing scalable financial policies and procedures
Oversee daily financial operations, ensuring accuracy and efficiency across all accounting and financial reporting
Manage and optimize financial operations across multiple states (especially with new locations), adapting strategies to meet regional compliance and operational needs
Analyze financial performance and identify opportunities for improvement and expansion
Direct structuring, negotiating, and securing of loans or credit facilities to support business expansion, managing relationships with financial institutions to ensure favorable financing terms
Negotiate leases and contracts with commercial hubs, such as airports and malls, securing optimal terms for the business
Build and maintain strong relationships with financial institutions, vendors, and partners
Initially oversee a lean finance team with one direct report, guiding, training, and supporting growth, while fostering a culture of accountability, precision, and continuous improvement
Build, improve and manage execution of internal SOPs
Lead and manage finance-related projects, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to budgets and specifications
Leverage QuickBooks Online and related SaaS integrations for efficient financial operations and reporting, continuously seeking and implementing technological advancements to enhance financial insights and operational efficiency
Demonstrate flexibility and commitment by being willing to work overtime and weekends as needed to meet critical deadlines and support business needs


Benefits

Retirement plan
Bonus compensation, Stock options
We promote work-life balance
We have a family-friendly team culture
PTO - vacation & sick leave
X Paid Holidays
Assistance in relocation if needed
Be part of a company that has exponential growth
Interact with Board of Directors and other key investors on a regular basis


This Position Is Perfect For You If...

You're Self-Motivated.

Don't need a micromanager to keep you on track. You have the ability to motivate yourself and your team in a positive way to get great results.

You're a Passionate Problem Solver.

You're comfortable working in a high-growth startup environment where there may be ambiguity and quickly changing environments - especially since you'll be dealing with new locations, institutions, and regulations on a regular basis. Your dedication for tackling complex challenges drives you to continuously think creatively, ensuring tailored and effective strategies for each unique situation.

You're Highly Organized and Detail-Oriented.

You excel in organization and precision, crucial for overseeing financial operations and strategic guidance. Your ability to meticulously plan and execute financial strategies, coupled with your focus on detail, ensures accuracy and reliability in your day-to-day work.

You're Dependable.

You demonstrate dependability by consistently producing high-quality work and ensuring reliable outcomes. Your commitment is fundamental to our team and company's success.

What we do:

Please check us out to get an understanding of our company:

www.gameway.gg

Our hiring process is made up of five parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, two 1-on-1 interviews and a test project.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Jordan & Emma

Integrated Dermatology is a leading national dermatology platform that acquires and partners with dermatology practices across the United States. Our environment is entrepreneurial, informal, hard-working and dynamic. We are growing rapidly and operate with integrity and a can-do attitude. Our goal is to be the strategic dermatology partner of choice for physicians, as the industry consolidates.

We are searching for a highly-analytical and hands-on Vice President of Finance to oversee our company’s financial planning and analysis. Your duties include valuing acquisition targets, supporting our capital markets debt and equity activities, developing budgets and performing financial analysis. The ideal candidate will be acutely intelligent with highly developed financial analytical skills and leadership abilities. Your goal will be to guide the company towards increasing profitability and financial success. This position will be an integral part of our acquisition, management reporting and capital markets process.

The ideal candidate resides within a commutable distance to Boca Raton, FL.

Job Description:
Oversee the financial strategic planning of the company by evaluating and tracking its performance and risks
Perform regular financial analysis and reporting
Cash flow forecasting
Develop and update budgets and forecasts
Monitor and track compliance with covenants and loan agreements
Lead periodic creation of KPI’s, metrics and management reports for use by business unit leaders, executives, board and capital providers.
Recognize patterns in company spending, revenue, expenses and recommend solutions to problem areas
Support acquisition process in pricing of deals to select which opportunities to pursue
Support capital markets activity, including debt and equity

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or relevant field; MBA preferred
A minimum of 8-10 years’ experience in financial management
In-depth knowledge of accounting software and financial analysis
Experience in an entrepreneurial environment
Excellent communication skills
An analytical mind with good organizational skills and commitment to getting things done promptly and correctly
Takes ownership of projects

Job Type:
Full-time

Experience:
8-10 years FP&A experience (Required)
Acquisitions due diligence experience preferred
Retail healthcare or multi-site businesses

Education:
Bachelors’ Degree (Required)
MBA Preferred

Role Responsibilities
Assisting with transaction due diligence and execution

Performing company and industry research
Compiling and writing investment memos and presentations to CIO
Participating in management calls, company meetings, and industry conferences

In this role, within the Credit Department, the analyst will review commercial loan writeups (including new loans, line of credit renewals and household reviews) to ensure accuracy and help to make recommendations for technical and structural edits to the presentations. The role is designed for new credit professionals to learn the following basics of credit with the intention of moving to an underwriter role on a commercial loan team in a 12-24 month timeframe.

Essential Functions

In this role, you will develop a strong understanding of the following components within the credit analysis process:

Financial Statement Spreads

Spread and balance an income statement and balance sheet
Reconcile cash
Develop business cash flows, personal cash flows and global cash flow analysis

Northern Bank Loan Policy:

Understand Approval Authorities, NBTs Risk Rating methodology
Understand Commercial C&I, CRE and Construction Lending underwriting standards
Understand our “out of market” requirements and franchise lending requirements

Credit Memo

Understand the following:
The keys to structuring the credit memo
Importance of application dates and where they are input
Knowing where fields are in nCino that populate the credit memo templates
How total exposure is calculated
How the effective yield is calculated
When to add a condition
How covenants work and how to add and test them
Knowledge of the different loan types and the importance of selecting the right one
Understand the Boarding Summary fields and why each is important

Other Credit Exposure includes:

How to read an appraisal and some general FIRREA guidelines
General FDICIA rules and regs
How to prepare an industry analysis
Overview of loan legal documents
Intro to SBA lending
Understanding of Credit Reports (also how to acquire one)
Review of Personal Financial Statements

Learn the how to analyze lending deals relating to:

Real Estate
Construction
C&I
Franchises

Job Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or quantitative related fields
Strong analytical and math skills required
Strong attention to detail
Related work/internship experience preferred
Ability to multi-task, prioritize work, and adapt to changes in working environment required

About Northern Bank & Trust Company

Northern Bank is a full-service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers live their lives and grow their businesses. From deposit products to loans to payment and collections services, we work hands-on with our entrepreneurial customers, both locally and across the country, to provide the financial support they need to realize their personal and business goals. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of $2.65 billion with 13 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. For more information on online banking services, please visit www.NBTC.com or follow Northern Bank on

Are you searching for some good, clean fun? We've got the job for you!

We’re looking for someone who loves kids, is super energetic, and who wants to make a positive impact on the families in their community. This person will help us deliver on the promise of Serious Fun with serious health and safety in mind. If you think you might be a good fit for our fun and fast paced environment, then keep reading!

What We Expect From You…

Teach amazing classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don’t worry, we’ll teach you how!)
Provide an outstanding customer service experience. We treat our members like family!
So fresh and so clean, clean! It’s important that we work to keep our gym and lobby area cleaned and disinfected at all times.
Party like a Rockstar…errr HOST a party like a Rockstar and hang ‘late night’ (or like 6-10pm, but who’s counting?) with awesome kids while their parents get some much needed ‘adult time’.

You’d fit in here if…

You’re totally open to being a goofball and love celebrating kid’s success. (A background in child development, physical education, gymnastics or dance helps as well.)
You live to serve! Making others feel good makes you feel good.
Kids really like you, but their parents really like you too.
You were voted most likely to be in a good mood by your high school classmates.
You love to have fun but you know when to buckle down and do work.

You may think we’re awesome because…

Kids walk out of our classes more confident than when they walked in.
You’ll get your steps in and close your activity rings while you work because you’ll be moving all day.
We get to build relationships with kids and their families and those relationships last a lifetime!
You could get paid to fold t-shirts or you could get paid to act like a dinosaur. The choice is yours.
This may not be your career but we’re sure going to train you like it is.

But seriously, read the fine print…

With more than 300 locations across the globe, The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for kids ages 4 months through 12 years. For over four decades, The Little Gym has helped millions of kids experience the thrill of achievement, develop new skills, and find new confidence through a variety of gymnastics-based programs. Parent/Child, Pre-K and Grade School classes are all taught in a clean, fun, safe and nurturing environment which encourages children to develop at their own pace.

As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. If this sounds like the job you’ve been dreaming about, what are you waiting for?

Compensation: $13.00 per hour

When you work somewhere this fun, it doesn’t even feel like a job.

Want to wake up excited to go to work every morning, confident that you’re making a difference while having a blast? You’ve come to the right place. The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for children ages 4 months through 12 years. Programs offer children a Springboard to Life’s Adventures by using movement-based learning and imaginative play to help build the confidence and skills needed at each stage of childhood.

For over 40 years, our trained instructors have nurtured happy, confident kids through parent/child classes, gymnastics, dance and sports prep, plus enjoyable extras like camps, Parentsʼ Survival Nights and Awesome Birthday Bash parties. As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. We are looking for fun, outgoing, talented individuals who are looking to make a difference in their community. If this sounds like you, check out our open positions!

All associated locations are independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchise, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. American University is a student-centered research institution located in Washington, DC, with highly-ranked schools and colleges, internationally-renowned faculty, and a reputation for creating meaningful change in the world. Learn more about American University

Department

Athletic Performance

Time Type

Full time

Work Modality

Full On Campus Presence

Union

Job Description:

Summary

Under the direct supervision of the Assistant Athletic Director of Athletic Performance this position is responsible for assisting with all aspects of the University’s varsity strength and conditioning program. The Assistant Strength & Conditioning Coach will direct the strength & conditioning of men’s basketball, men’s and women’s track and one other team.. This position requires frequent interaction with the Assistant Athletic Director of Athletic Performance, head coaches and athletic trainers to draft and implement physical development and flexibility programs to enhance strength, speed, cardiovascular endurance and sports specific skills for each of American University’s varsity teams. This position works directly with the student-athletes in the aforementioned teams to enhance their strength, speed, cardiovascular endurance and sports-specific skills. This position is also responsible for assisting with rehabilitation of sports related injuries to student-athletes.

Essential Functions

Responsible for the physical development for approximately three American University sports teams and student-athletes. Physically develop student-athletes for all phases of season, pre- and post-season.
Oversees day to day management of strength room, records, and equipment under supervision of Assistant Athletic Director of Athletic Performance and keeps all equipment, room and records in good order. Reports any major concerns or need for equipment maintenance or repair to the Head Strength & Conditioning Coach.
Coordinates with Athletic Training Staff on all aspects of team strength and conditioning programs and injury recovery and prevention with assigned sports or athletes.
Participate in continuing education through attendance at conferences, symposium and readings to maintain knowledge of current techniques, trends and advancements in physical development.

Competencies

Prioritizing and Organizing.
Acquiring and Analyzing Information.
Making Accurate Judgments and Decisions.
Developing Plans.
Displaying Creativity.

Position Type/Expected Hours Of Work

Full-Time.

Required Education And Experience

Bachelor’s degree in kinesiology, exercise science, biomechanics or related field and certification in strength and conditioning (NSCA/CSCS or SCCC) required.
1-3 years of relevant experience.

Preferred Education And Experience

Master's degree.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

One year experience as a graduate assistant/intern or assistant strength and conditioning coach on the collegiate or professional level required.
Experience with multi sport weight training programs and individualizing workouts to reduce risk of injury and enhance performance.
This position also requires experience with the instruction and implementation of alternative training techniques to include: plyometrics, speed and agility programs, conditioning to enhance student-athlete’s sport specific skills.

Benefits

AU offers a competitive benefits package including a 200% matching retirement plan, tuition benefits for full-time staff and their families, several leadership development certificates, and has been recognized by the American Heart Association as a fit-friendly worksite. Click here to learn about American University's unique benefit options.

Other Details

Hiring offers for this position are contingent on successful completion of a background check.
Employees in staff positions at American University must deliver their services to the university from either the District of Columbia, Maryland, or Virginia, or perform work on-site at the university.
Please note this job announcement is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
American University is an E-Verify employer.

Current American University Employees

American University current employees must apply through their employee Workday account. If you are a current employee at American University, please log into Workday and select the Find Jobs report which will take you to our internal career listings.

Contact Us

For more information or assistance with the American University careers site, email theworkline@american.edu.

American University is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution that operates in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The university does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, personal appearance, gender identity and expression, family responsibilities, political affiliation, source of income, veteran status, an individual’s genetic information or any other bases under federal or local laws (collectively "Protected Bases") in its programs and activities.

Purpose Care is a leading provider of health and wellness services, committed to empowering individuals to live their best lives. We are currently seeking a dynamic and passionate Health and Wellness Coach to join our team. As a Health and Wellness Coach, you will play a crucial role in supporting our clients in achieving their health and wellness goals through personalized coaching and guidance.

In this role, you will work closely with clients to create tailored wellness plans, educate them on healthy lifestyle choices, and offer ongoing support to help them make positive changes. You will provide individualized coaching sessions, conduct wellness assessments, and develop strategies to address clients' physical, mental, and emotional well-being. Your ability to build trust and rapport with clients will be essential as you guide them through the process of behavior change and help them overcome obstacles on their wellness journey.

The ideal candidate will have a background in health and wellness, with a strong understanding of holistic health principles. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are a must, as you will be collaborating with clients and other members of the Purpose Care team. Additionally, you should have a passion for helping others and a strong commitment to promoting overall health and well-being.

Responsibilities

Conduct initial wellness assessments to understand clients' health and wellness needs and goals
Develop personalized wellness plans based on clients' individual needs and objectives
Provide ongoing coaching and support to clients, helping them implement and maintain healthy lifestyle changes
Monitor clients' progress and make adjustments to their wellness plans as needed
Educate clients on topics such as nutrition, stress management, exercise, and sleep hygiene
Guide clients in setting goals and developing action plans to achieve them
Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as nutritionists and therapists, to provide comprehensive care for clients

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in health and wellness, nutrition, or a related field
Proven experience as a health and wellness coach or similar role
Strong knowledge of holistic health principles and practices
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to build rapport and establish trust with clients
Empathy and compassion for others
Strong organizational and time management skills
Certification in health coaching or a related field is preferred, but not required

Benefits

Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home
Wellness Resources
Show less

Bonus based on performance
Employee discounts
Opportunity for advancement
Training & development
Wellness resources

Group Fitness Instructor

GYMGUYZ Bay Ridge conducts 100 Aqua Exercise classes from June 1- Sept 10

We are looking to bring on a group fitness instructor with a great personality and some experience.

This is a seasonal position. Classes conducted outdoors at Fort Hamilton Army Base in Bay Ridge.

Class schedule Tuesday Thursday Friday 8AM

Tuesday Wednesday Thursday 5:45

Additional Opportunity For Personal Trainer

Are you ready for an amazingly different fitness career experience? It’s time to BUST OUT of the gym! GYMGUYZ is #1 in Home Personal Training nationwide. We are seeking to grow the management team of one of our premier franchises in your area. GYMGUYZ team members bring the positive energy and a selection of up to 365 pieces of equipment right to the client's doorstep. We save our clients time and space, provide the most effective accountability model possible as we bring the workout to them, and create a strong emotional trainer-client bond. This unique approach gets clients training with much more consistency and frequency, producing results that have escaped them via gyms, classes, and diets. GYMGUYZ is often the last stop for clients seeking to finally transform their bodies. We thoroughly assess the health and fitness of our new clients through a proprietary and technology-driven process that allows us to hyper-customize their fitness program, producing effective training sessions right from the start. With over 615+ cities served in the U.S., Canada, and the UK, GYMGUYZ has been recognized by Entrepreneur Magazine in its “Top 100 Fastest Growing Franchises" in 2017, 2018, 2019, and 2020!

Job Summary

The Certified Personal Trainer will be responsible for providing one-on-one personalized fitness instruction to clients while encouraging them to reach their fitness goals. A GYMGUYZ Trainer will provide professional instruction for each client's health, fitness and wellness goals while providing the highest level of customer service. A GYMGUYZ Trainer must adapt to various working type environments to include private homes, offices or an appropriate setting of the client's choice.

Responsibilities

WORKING TASKS

Follow the workout program developed from the initial assessment
Choose customized exercises that provide optimum results per the client’s needs
Demonstrate each exercise and ensure the client is performing correctly with or without modifications
Complete session notes after each client training session
Conduct client reassessments every 4 – 6 weeks
Maintain client sessions through GYMGUYZ scheduling software
Able to collect and secure payments from clients, as needed
Able to provide a flexible schedule to accommodate client appointments

BEHAVIORAL

Able to motivate clients to their physical limits while providing encouragement and morale support
Able to be punctual and effectively manage appointments and rescheduling of the make-up training session
Able to adhere to all company policies

SAFETY, ENVIRONMENTAL, PHYSICAL

Ensure that the exercise equipment is kept clean and in good working condition after each session
Ensure safe and effective use of equipment by client and/or groups
Ensure the integrity of each client's home, office, or the setting of choice
Able to apply first aid procedures and respond to emergency situational needs
Able to drive and maintain the GYMGUYZ cargo van for business purposes only
Other duties as assigned in accordance with the scope of the Personal Trainer position

Qualifications

High school diploma or GED equivalent
1 year of personal training
Good communication skills; verbal, written, and technical
Have a basic understanding of nutrition and healthy living practices
Knowledgeable of a variety of exercise equipment and personal training methods
Clean Driver’s License
Certified Personal Trainer (NCCA or DEAC accredited organization)
Certified in CPR/AED
Able to lift, push and pull up to 50 lbs. and perform athletic calisthenics duties

Benefits/Perks

Competitive Compensation Rates
Bonus Opportunities/ Incentives
Recertification Education Discounts
Opportunity for Career Growth
Great team to work with!

Description
CELSIUS is one of the fastest growing Energy Drink Brands nationally!

At CELSIUS we pride ourselves in providing our employees a culture and atmosphere of inclusiveness that challenges individuals to be thought leaders, innovators and game changers as every employee is an owner of the CELSIUS Brand upon joining the Organization.

We are looking for someone with the drive and the experience to seek out, sell and cultivate new business in the Fitness/ Specialty Channel for CELSIUS while amplifying existing businesses and Partnerships. Someone who can effectively and efficiently expand assigned business in coordination with CELSIUS Distributor and Retailer Partners. The position will be expected to participate in local and regional level fitness field sales strategy development, planning and execution of key initiatives at 10 – 15 stores/gyms per day while providing real time feedback, opportunities, results and direction utilizing CELSUIS’ Field Sales selling platform. The candidate must show an ability to be a self-starter, competitive by nature and have a drive to succeed individually and WIN BIG as a member of a Team.

This is your opportunity to join the expanding CELSIUS Fitness Sales Team!

Responsibilities
Within assigned market, execute the Celsius Inc. sales plan through the attainment of shelf distribution, cold box placement, promotional execution, displays and the placement of brand collateral at retail.
Secure new outlet availability by influencing distributors through route rides, crew drives and local/ regional key account calls as required.
Provide ongoing communication on sales, marketing and executional opportunities with assigned Distributor Partners.
Assist District and/or Regional Sales Manager with bill backs and other duties as assigned.
Participate in weekly recap and planning calls outlining objectives, results, barriers and opportunities.

Special Requirements

Ability to travel within the assigned territory including overnight travel.
Must be on the road meeting accounts and new business prospects a minimum of 4 days a week, and1 administrative day.
Must be able (with or without accommodation) of bending and lifting to set up displays, adjust shelves during resets, move product, etc.

Knowledge and Skills Required
Fitness/ Specialty Channel experience required.
Strong business acumen with an entrepreneurial spirit.
Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills (verbal/written) with the ability to interact effectively internally as well as with external contacts.
Deep rooted understanding of the assigned territory and the surrounding area.
Creative and strategic thinker.
Experience negotiating.
Strong team player.
Problem solver.
PowerPoint, Excel and Word proficient.

Opportunity to grow at a breakthrough fitness-tech startup

About System2

At System2 Technologies Corp. (https://getsystem2.com/), our vision is to bring fitness coaching to everyone. We accomplish this by empowering elite fitness influencers with a fully-integrated technology and business solution to reach a massive audience.

We are a San Francisco based company funded by prominent silicon valley venture capital firms. System2 founders Dilan Dane & Yuran Lu are ex-MIT serial entrepreneurs who've previously built and sold companies to Google, Dropbox etc.

Your role

We are looking for an excellent personal trainer to help us train clients remotely. We work with elite fitness influencers, and you'll work as part of their team. You'll design workout programs, check-in with clients, provide motivation, and make sure the highest quality of service to each client.

On a day-to-day basis you will be,

Work with elite influencers to understand and absorb their coaching philosophy.
Design workout programs using the tools we provide.
Check-in and provide motivation to remote clients assigned to you.
Identify clients who need extra help and do whatever you can to help them reach their goals.
Help with other social media outreach tasks.

Ideally, you...

Have a degree in exercise science or a similarly highly qualified personal trainer.
Extremely good with attention to detail.
Love serving your clients and are dedicated to growing as a coach.
Understand how to promote fitness on social media.
Can be remote but located in a time zone that makes it easy to work with a US-based team.

Compensation & Benefits

We provide very competitive salaries and benefits. In addition, we also provide equity to full-time employees, so you can share in the financial upside of our long-term successes.

For US-based full-time employees, we provide:

Health, Vision, and Dental insurance
401(k) coverage
Flexible working hours, and the ability to work remotely
Unlimited PTO
Reimbursement for remote-working equipment and expenses

You'll have the opportunity to work on exciting and innovative technologies and make a meaningful difference in many lives every day. We hope you are excited to join us!

Summary Objective: The Assistant Fitness Director is at the forefront of all New Member Orientation and Fitness Sales in each club location. The Assistant Fitness Director manages the New Member Orientation process, assigning sessions to Personal Trainers as appropriate, to ensure all members receive a welcoming experience. The Assistant Fitness Director engages with new and existing members to safely and effectively help members achieve their fitness goals through US Fitness Programs and Services that appropriately meet the needs of those members.

Descrição da Vaga:
Position Purpose & Summary

In this position as a Fitness Specialist, you will utilize a trifecta approach to providing fitness coaching and instruction. You will be required to perform 1 - 2 shifts as a Fitness Concierge. As the welcoming, first-impression of STRATA Fit, the Fitness Specialist is critical to ensuring that each athlete has a positive, enjoyable, rewarding, and memorable workout experience - with every interaction, every session, and every day. The Fitness Specialist greets and directs athletes, guests, members, and team members as they enter the facilities and provides exceptional service and assistance with inquiries about fitness operations, gym policies, personal training and fitness coaching opportunities, workout reservations, group fitness class schedules, and various key administrative functions, including phone and email management, facility and equipment cleanliness, and retail sales.

Applicants will also be responsible for teaching 1 - 4 group exercise classes. Providing group fitness instruction in an enjoyable atmosphere, while monitoring and educating our athletes on fitness and safety.

Lastly, applicants will be responsible for filling out their remaining schedule recruiting and coaching personal training clients. Assessing bodily strengths and weaknesses while creating and implementing customized workout plans.

Essential Functions

Operate efficiently and effectively all functions of the Fitness Center, equipment, and workouts.
Create up-to-date athlete records and workout preferences in database management systems.
Maintain constant sanitation, cleanliness, and tidiness of gym facilities, locker rooms, and lobby, including retail.
Maintain full stock of equipment, towels, supplies, and athlete amenities.
Manage workout reservations appointments, including recurring and cancelling, and assistance with bookings.
Perform check-in, check-out, and payment transaction processes in accordance with policies.
Execute Guest Pass procedures for affiliates utilizing the facilities and collaborate with Membership.
Maintain product knowledge for retail, including brands, costs, promos, specials, and contacts, and know fitness equipment, vendor brands, specifications, and benefits for use.
Deliver consistent friendly and professional phone and email etiquette.
Teaches scheduled group exercise classes, beginning on time, provides adequate warm-up, exercises, stretching, and cool-down.
Instructs athletes on effective workout methods, explains proper techniques; demonstrates exercises; identifies different muscle groups, and teaches appropriate methods to strengthen muscles.
Prepares appropriate equipment, music, and cues for each class.
Assume the responsibility of personally training athletes who are interested in increasing the fitness levels, losing weight, and entering competitions.
Provides athletes with safe, reasonable exercises that they can perform in the gym as well as at home.
Communicate to members and guests about their goals and introduce them to our personal training packages.
Deliver "I Am Proud" service standards and department-specific signature touch points.
Establish cross-departmental channels of communication among teammates that are consistent and complete.

Additional Duties And Responsibilities

Greet every guest, member, and team member with "I Am Proud" standards and set a positive tone for every interaction.
Provide extraordinary service that is "Enriching by Nature."
Embrace, embody, demonstrate, and encourage wellness and the STRATA virtues through interactions, performance, and commitments.
Uphold the Garden of the Gods Resort and Club's brand, culture, vision, mission, and values.
Be empowered to make things go right if they go wrong.
Give the guest/member a fond farewell.
Address feedback by utilizing the LEARN Model.
Demonstrate a professional appearance and be attentive to what matters most.
Comply with company policies and procedures.

Marginal Functions

Perform other duties as assigned.
Interface positively with other departments, offering assistance when needed.
Displays care in use of equipment and maintains an organized and professional work environment.

Position Requirements

Minimum Knowledge & Skills: Must be able to think critically and creatively, have knowledge of proper body mechanics to prevent injury. Must have financial knowledge, including basic math, money handling, and pricing. Requires excellent communication skills, computer (technology) skills - including Excel, interpersonal skills, and record keeping. Working knowledge of human anatomy, kinesiology, and training principles.
Formal Education and Job-Related Experience: High School Diploma is required and some college preferred. Background experience and education in physical education, exercise science, sports medicine, kinesiology, biology, or sport management is preferred. Previous gym, fitness, wellness, or personal trainer (or relevant role) experience required.
License, Registration, and/or Certification Required:
Nationally recognized Personal Training certification
Current CPR certification
Group Exercise certification (ACE, AFAA) or equivalent.
Additional specialty/certifications preferred.
External And Internal Personal Contact

Communications:
Daily - Verbal and written.
Weekly - Participate in shift meetings, read communication logs, and provide support and partner collaboratively with instructors to ensure successful class check-in. Complete and initial opening and closing operational checklists to launch and end shifts/days.
Occasionally - Participate in one-on-one coaching sessions. Assist Wellness Management in facility activity, tasks, projects, and other duties as assigned.
Teamwork and Collaboration: This position requires continuous teamwork as well as internal and cross-departmental communication. Work alongside fellow concierge and all team members to ensure efficiency and camaraderie. Partner collaboratively across full-property and know FAQs of outlets, hours, and contacts.

Dog Walker: Lower Manhattan Route

Are you a dog enthusiast with a love for Lower Manhattan? MixyPaws is searching for a reliable and experienced dog walker to join our team. This specific route operates Monday to Friday, from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, offering a rewarding opportunity to interact with furry friends.

Why MixyPaws?

We offer competitive compensation tied to the number of walks completed, coupled with a performance-based bonus that sweetens every paycheck for our dedicated dog enthusiasts. Eager for more quality time with dogs? Our walkers have the chance to take on after-hours and weekend walks as well as pet sittings.

What We Value:

Punctuality: Dogs are counting on us for potty breaks, exercise, meals, and on-time medications. Our walkers must be the reliable, unwavering anchor in their furry friends' lives
Communication: Effective communication is the heartbeat of our work. From answering questions to following instructions, from reporting health or behavioral concerns to showering dogs with love and care, we're all ears
Responsibility: Our walkers embody trustworthiness, establishing meaningful connections with our four-legged clients and their owners. Professionalism and strict adherence to safety and handling protocols are non-negotiable
Must Love Dogs: We work with dogs of all shapes, sizes, temperaments, and ages. Our walkers need to be dog-whisperers, exuding comfort, patience, and boundless compassion in every stride
Commitment: Building a lasting bond with the pups entrusted to your care is key. MixyPaws welcomes walkers who are in it for the long haul—committed to sharing their love for dogs with us for at least six months

Requirements:

Eligibility to work in the U.S. and a minimum age of 18
Availability Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM
1+ years of professional experience with dogs
Physical fitness: Ability to move up to 8 hours a day, outdoors in various weather conditions, and perform tasks such as bending, squatting, taking stairs, handling leashes, and lifting dogs
A working smartphone with a data plan for tracking walks and seamless communication
Familiarity with Lower Manhattan and its streets and public transit

Benefits:

Paid time off
Employee referral program
Performance bonuses
Paid training
Opportunities for career growth

Apply Today:

Send your resume along with a working phone number and email. Include a note highlighting your deep passion for dogs!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay Range: $400.00 - $600.00 per week

Join MixyPaws and make a difference in the lives of dogs. Apply now!

Life’s too short to not work somewhere that makes you happy! If you agree, have tons of energy, love kids and are looking for a way to give back to your community, you may be the person we are looking for. At The Little Gym, our jobs are serious, Serious Fun!

What We Expect From You...

Gym Director: Reinforcement and Leading of the Core Values and Mission Statement of The Little Gym, understanding the philosophy and program, and communicating information accurately and professionally to team and customers.

Teaching: Teach amazing gymnastics classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don’t worry, we’ll teach you how!). Teaching is your job, you need to love what you do, so you need to love to teach!
Leadership: Develop, grow, and maintain a fun and professional work environment for staff. Fostering growth for both the business and the team to promote a healthy atmosphere and culture for the gym environment. Staffing and team scheduling.
Business Indicators: Studying, maintaining, and assessing key business indicators to develop and grow the business in both enrollment and finances.
Customer Service: Providing outstanding customer service and membership experience. We treat our members like family here. We respond in professional ways, but with a personal touch, every time.
Office Tasks: Including answering phone calls, texts, emails, Instaply, voicemail, and walk in inquiries required
Public Speaking: Sharing knowledge of all the programs and events we offer.
Cleaning: Maintaining a clean and safe environment by cleaning equipment thoroughly.
Schedules: Mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends are all possible shifts, this is not a 9 to 5!


You’d fit in here if…

You love having fun, like giving high 5’s, and can play like a child! (A background in child development, physical education, and/or gymnastics helps as well)
You live to serve! Making others feel good makes you feel good.
Kids really like you, but their parents really like you too.
You were voted most likely to be in a good mood by your high school classmates.
You love to have fun, but you know when to buckle down and do work.


What you should expect from us!

We are here to help you grow! Some jobs will train you to do a specific job, here, we like to make sure we are helping you achieve your dreams and professional goals.
We live to serve! Making you feel good about coming into work and enjoying what you do.
Professionalism and Communication. Although we are goofballs, we still promote respect, compassion and integrity. We will continuously display healthy communication and fairness.
Fun! We don’t like boring, be prepared for us to be silly!


Our Back Story

The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for children ages 4 months through 12 years. Programs offer children a Springboard to Life’s Adventures by using movement-based learning and imaginative play to help build the confidence and skills needed at each stage of childhood.

For over 40 years, our trained instructors have nurtured happy, confident kids through parent/child classes, gymnastics, dance and enjoyable extras like camps, Parents’ Survival Nights, skill clinics and Awesome Birthday Bash parties. Once you become a part of The Little Gym squad, you will be part of a team dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe.

All associated locations are independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchise, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to The Little Gym Franchising Corporate.

Job Type: Full Time (weekends required)

Salary: $45,000 - $50,000 per year

Benefits: Paid Time off, Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Bonus Compensation Plans

Description

Position Summary

As a Recruiting Coordinator, you will play a vital role in supporting the recruitment process by coordinating

various activities to ensure the seamless and efficient hiring of top talent. Your primary responsibilities will

include managing recruitment logistics, scheduling interviews if needed, initiating background checks,

onboarding deployment and maintaining candidate records. You will work closely with the HR team, hiring

managers and candidates to provide exceptional candidate experiences and contribute to the overall success

of our talent acquisition efforts.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Essential duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Coordinate recruitment activities: Assist in organizing and coordinating the end-to-end recruitment process, including posting job openings, reviewing applications, and scheduling interviews
Schedule and coordinate interviews: Coordinate interview schedules with candidates, hiring managers, and interviewers. Ensure that all parties are informed of interview details, such as time, location, and required materials.
Candidate communication: Serve as the main point of contact for candidates, providing timely updates on their application status, interview details, and any necessary pre-employment documentation.
Applicant tracking system (ATS) management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the ATS. Input candidate information, track applicant progress, and generate reports as needed.
Background checks and references: Facilitate background checks and reference verifications for selected candidates, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
Recruitment events: Coordinate and support recruitment events such as career fairs, information sessions, and campus visits. Assist in preparing event materials, scheduling interviews, and representing the organization professionally.
Data analysis and reporting: Generate recruitment reports and provide regular updates on recruitment metrics, including time-to-fill, source of hire, and candidate pipeline status.
Process improvement: Identify areas for process optimization and propose solutions to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the recruitment process.
Compliance and documentation: Ensure compliance with applicable employment laws and regulations. Maintain accurate and confidential candidate files and records

Requirements

Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities)

The Ideal Candidate Will Have

Proven experience as a recruiting coordinator or in a similar administrative role.
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software.
Excellent organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively with team members, hiring managers, and candidates.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Knowledge of HR and recruitment best practices.
Demonstrated commitment to maintaining confidentiality and handling sensitive information with discretion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organization and problem-solving skills.
Hands-on approach. Able to manage multiple priorities and work collaboratively with teams to ensure the highest quality deliverables.
Self-starter with a project management mindset.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
Desire to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Ability to build rapport with, and gain the confidence of, entire organization to quickly integrate into the current team while adapting to, and fostering, the TruFit’s culture.
Fitness industry experience is a plus.

Education & Experience

A minimum of 2 years of related

Experience Is Preferred.

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a teammate to

successfully perform the essential functions of this position which is exposed to typical office working

conditions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the

functions.

Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 25 pounds.
Visual acuity, speech, and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment.
Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office and/or gym environment

Work Location

The Recruiting Coordinator position is required to check into the Corporate Office daily or to a pre-assigned

club location. The ideal candidate will be based in San Antonio, TX.

About TruFit Athletic Clubs

TruFit Athletic Clubs is a purpose-driven organization. Our purpose is quite simple, Building A More

Powerful You! That YOU, represents every Teammate, every member and every community we serve. By

living our Purpose, we are committed to leaving everyone in a more powerful position than when they met

us.

How Do We Do This? By Living Our Core Values Which Are Our Moral Compass And Are Non-negotiable. These Core Values Are

We Do the Right Thing
We Are Inspired To Serve
We Are Courageous
We Are Personally Responsible
We Have Fun!

TruFit Athletic Clubs offers a competitive pay and benefit package which includes healthcare coverage for

ALL Teammates, full AND part-time, to further live our Purpose! Some of the other benefits available to

full-time Teammates working 30+ hours per week include dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term

disability and life insurance.

At TruFit Athletic Clubs, each and every teammate is a leader. You matter! You count! You will always impact

the outcome of everything you do! If you have the passion and desire for this type of culture, we would love

to have you on our team!

Our mission is to empower healthier and happier lives through cutting-edge technology and superior care. We are committed to fostering a culture of passion, innovation, and trust, inviting you to be a part of our dynamic team as we transform healthcare globally.

Your New Opportunity

Join our team as a Healthcare Assistant in our Remote Patient Monitoring division, focusing on Chronic Care Management. This full-time, fully remote position offers a competitive salary, stock options, comprehensive benefits, generous Paid Time Off, and robust opportunities for professional growth.

Job Role

Responsibilities

As a Healthcare Assistant, you will be instrumental in enrolling new patients into our Remote Patient Monitoring programs. Your primary responsibilities include:

Engaging with new patients, explaining the value of our programs, and securing their enrollment.

Collaborating with care coordinators and nursing staff to deliver seamless enrollment services.

Monitoring patients with chronic conditions, ensuring adherence to treatment plans, and providing progress updates.

Acting as a liaison between patients, families, healthcare providers, and community resources.

Facilitating the use of our digital tools and devices for patients, enhancing their management of medical conditions.

This Role Might Be for You If...

You excel in building relationships and can effectively communicate and empathize with patients.

You are detail-oriented, with stellar time management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities.

You value precision in your work, especially regarding patient documentation and adherence to healthcare guidelines.

2+ years of experience in a healthcare setting.

Outstanding communication skills in English, with additional languages being a plus.

Proficiency with digital healthcare platforms, particularly in Remote Patient Monitoring and Chronic Care Management.

Work Hours & Benefits

This role requires availability during Eastern Standard Time business hours (8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday). Our benefits package includes health, dental, and vision insurance, tuition reimbursement, a referral program, and stock options after a qualifying period.

What’s Your Why?

Why Join Our Team: At VIPcare, we value you. We see you. At VIPcare, it’s the little things we do each and every day

that set us apart from other primary care practices. Our patients are family, and we want to keep our family healthy. Be part of a team that is transforming healthcare one patient at a time. We take great care of our team so they can take great care of our patients and achieve: Better Care. Better Outcomes. Better Health.

THE OPPORTUNITY

The Director of Healthcare Operations will possess a high level of understanding of how to lead physicians, managers and care teams in a value-based healthcare delivery environment as well as traditional Medicare and commercial payor environments. The Director of Healthcare Operations will partner with our VIPcare Regional Practice Managers to operationalize 5 Star Service to our patients. This key team leader collaborates with other team leaders and departments to design and implement thoughtful growth and patient-based services. Director of Healthcare Operations will work closely with physicians and leadership team to implement our core health care delivery strategies, as well as managing multi region daily clinic operations and driving our expansion efforts into current and new markets. The role operates in a fast paced and engaging environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Leadership:
Partner with Regional Managers, Operations and Medical Director for best practices in Regions
Develop and maintain a successful platform - people, process and technology - to deliver on our culture and purpose
Works in conjunction with Physician Partners team and Shared Services Departments to support vital functions of Regions
Recognize opportunities and work collaboratively to design and implement solutions for clinic operations
Serve as additional support to Regional Managers to ensure smooth implementation of clinic acquisitions, moves and openings within region working with members of the M&A and De Novo Teams
Meets regularly with Region leadership and support partners (Providers, Regional Managers, Office Managers, Clinical Navigation) to give up to date reporting of metrics and solve for challenges
Participates in VIPcare Leadership meetings
Team Building:
Provide physician recruitment support through interviews and on site visits
Recruit, develop, train and motivate a best-in-class Regional Manager Team
Counsel and coach Regional Managers and Office Managers on leadership tactics
Create and set the tone for a culture of 5 Star Service with providers and care teams
Support provider relationships (physicians and mid-levels) and serve as escalation point for provider operational or team issues
Conduct ongoing one-on-ones and regular reviews with Regional Managers as determined by Team Resources Process
Onboard new Regional Managers with orientation to VIPcare culture and monitor/design training program as necessary
Results:
Focus on Quality, Care Management, Stars and Growth with relation to program adherence and results
Measure and report KPI’s on behalf of applicable regions
Guide, coach and drive the team to meet and exceed our goals
Coordinate resources and departments to set goals and effectively work through Quality and STARS Program for each Region
Whiteboard Program Reviews and guidance through regular reviews of workflows and Clinical Navigation Metrics
Grow clinics to capacity through health plan and Physician Partner Relationships
Collaboration:
Collaborate effectively with other operational team leaders and physicians
Communicates annual operational goals and expectations, devises plans to meet objectives
Demonstrates extraordinary customer service to all team members and other departments to include regularly scheduled meetings and communication
Facilitate Health Plan escalation issues as related to Regions
Work collaboratively with the Director of Operations to effectively solve operational challenges and implement solutions focused to improve clinic performance as it relates to additional internal departments.
Vision:
Know our business, our industry and our care model and meaningfully contribute to shaping the future of health care
Identify, plan and implement areas of strategic growth within regions for new office expansion
Participation in active Physician Recruitment to region clinics
Steer region growth deliverables in conjunction with Marketing and Physician Partners
Preferred Education Skills/Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in healthcare or business management, or appropriate experience; Master's preferred
Minimum 5 years of progressively responsible experience in practice or healthcare management
Experience in developing strong physician relationships and able to lead others in initiatives aimed at strengthening patient and physician experience, integrating and optimizing services and developing a motivated, high-performing team
Demonstrated knowledge of physician group operational and financial performance; revenue generation, cost control, productivity enhancements and patient satisfaction
Strategic and tactical skills, including data/metric analysis, action planning, decision support, and operations
Demonstrated ability to identify trends and act on opportunities gained from insights
Ability to think critically, solve complex challenges and productively manages conflict
Experience and comfort working in a matrixed organization with shared services and resources
Possesses dynamic skills in organizational standardization and transformation
Demonstrated dedication to the mission, vision, values and goals of the organization

Compensation & Benefits

We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package:
Competitive base salary with bonus potential upon placement/retention
Medical, dental, vision, disability and life
401k, with employer match
Paid time off
Paid holidays

Start your career in an international, modern healthcare consulting firm! In this role, you will have the opportunity to help different doctors in running their practices. You will be trained to handle the different facets such as clinic management, medical billing, checking of insurances, and other related tasks.

Within 3 months, you will be under probation and will go through 1-week initial training plus 3 weeks service specific training with assessments. You will be trained and certified to handle basic remote front desk/ practice concierge tasks, EHR certified/masters, insurance benefits & eligibility, and prior authorization. Lastly after rigorous immersion and cross-training, you are someone who can independently work on multiple accounts. You will be notified of your eligibility for employment benefits.

Job Title: Director of Operations
This pivotal role will oversee the operational aspects of our practice, with a primary focus on finance, growth strategies, and HR operations. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a proven track record of driving operational excellence and fostering growth in a healthcare setting. As the Director of Operations, you will play a critical role in shaping the future success and sustainability of our practice.
Responsibilities:
Financial Management:
Develop and oversee the annual budget, working closely with the executive team to ensure financial objectives are met.
Monitor financial performance, analyze variances, and implement corrective actions as needed.
Manage billing processes, revenue cycle management, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Identify opportunities for cost savings and revenue enhancement initiatives.
Growth Strategies:
Collaborate with leadership to develop and implement strategic growth plans that align with the practice's mission and vision.
Evaluate market trends, competitor activity, and patient demographics to identify growth opportunities.
Lead initiatives to expand service offerings, enhance patient experience, and increase market share.
Establish partnerships and strategic alliances to support business development efforts.
HR Operations:
Oversee all aspects of human resources management, including recruitment, onboarding, performance management, and employee relations.
Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and programs to foster a positive work environment and ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations.
Provide leadership and guidance to the HR team, fostering professional development and employee engagement.
Conduct regular audits of HR practices to ensure alignment with best practices and industry standards.
Operational Excellence:
Streamline operational processes and workflows to improve efficiency and productivity.
Implement performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and monitor operational performance.
Identify areas for process improvement and lead initiatives to optimize operational effectiveness.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the practice.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, including physicians, clinical staff, and administrative team members.
Serve as a liaison between the executive team and departmental leaders, facilitating communication and collaboration.
Represent the practice in external forums, community events, and professional organizations to enhance the practice's reputation and visibility.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in healthcare operations management, with a focus on finance, growth strategies, and HR operations.
Proven track record of driving financial performance, implementing growth initiatives, and optimizing operational efficiency in a healthcare setting.
Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve organizational goals.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
Knowledge of healthcare regulations, compliance requirements, and industry trends.
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Relevant professional certifications (e.g., CMPE, FACMPE) are a plus.

Job Description

Summary:

Come join MDVIP as a MCE Referral Coordinator. Based in Boca Raton, FL, MDVIP has been recognized as a Great Place to Work® employer for four consecutive years and recently named by Fortune and Great Place to Work® as one of the 2021 Best Workplaces in Healthcare & Biopharma™.

The role provides administrative support and assistance for the Medical Centers of Excellence (MCE) Program. The coordinator facilitates communication, compiles necessary documentation, and communicates with the member and other approved parties. Additional duties include varying administrative support functions, customer service excellence which includes an emphasis of adhering to high quality and compliance standards set by regulatory bodies and in accordance with departmental standards.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Coordinator Responsibilities:

Organizes all pertinent data/materials to securely transfer to the appropriate person(s) and ensures their receipt as well as maintain accurate documentation to ensure true data integrity.
Submits referrals and documentation to designated MCE facilities adhering to HIPAA and privacy regulations. Ensures follow-up is completed within the specified timeframe in accordance with the MCE process guidelines.
Prioritizes work to ensure timeliness of the referral process and various touch points or tasks.
Initiates and maintains contact with the member and MDVIP affiliated physician or office staff to ensure that all parties are aware of the referral process and each step along the way.
Provides the member with a thorough explanation of the MDVIP referral process, as well as the selected facilities’ process. Coordinates and/or assists with providing travel assistance information to aid the member in booking their specific travel and lodging arrangements.
Confirms appointment dates and times prior to the member’s appointment with both the member and the affiliated physician or office, as well as confirms with the member if any additional assistance is needed.
Contacts all members following their appointment to inquire about their experience and to receive approval to send a member MCE Program satisfaction survey.
Coordinates and schedules teleconferences, as needed, between MCE specialty physician and MDVIP physicians.
Manages chart reviews with specialists as requested by MDVIP physicians. Ensures any pre or post appointment requests as related to medical recommendations or reports are forwarded to the MDVIP physicians in a timely matter and adhere to department protocols.

Administrative Responsibilities:

Drafts and prepares correspondences to be reviewed and approved by management when applicable.
Prepares / mails approved correspondence to members, insurance companies, diagnostic centers via Federal Express, certified return receipt, or standard mail.
Answers telephones, faxes and scans documents, assists with reception duties, as needed.
Prepares and updates appropriate reports or presentations as needed.
Files and maintains electronic filing system.
Follows up with physician offices to guarantee documentation is delivered after member’s appointment with the specialist.
Provides administrative support to the Insurance Services department, as needed.
Maintains data integrity by notating appropriate application systems and following through on tasks.

This job profile is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Education / Experience / Knowledge:

Associate's degree (A. A.) from two-year College or university and 3 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience where two years of related experience equals one year of schooling.

Demonstrated knowledge of medical terminology, insurance products, and health care coverage is needed.
Knowledge of medical conditions, and familiarity with the referral process, is preferred.

Computer Proficiency:

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft applications including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Outlook, MapPoint, document storage systems, as well as Internet Explorer and Adobe Software.
Net Docs and Salesforce.com experience preferred.
Able to learn new software easily.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and using hands/fingers for working on a computer.
Specific vision abilities include close vision and the ability to adjust focus from near to far.
Must talk and/or hear for significant periods of each day.
Must be able to lift and/or move up to 15 pounds periodically.

Corporate based roles:

As a corporate based role in Boca Raton, FL, employees are expected to work from the corporate office unless deemed eligible for the company’s Work from Home program. At no time may work be performed, or computer systems accessed, from outside of the U.S.

We are seeking a talented individual to join our team as a Project/Program Manager IV. This role offers the flexibility of telecommuting with potential for occasional onsite meetings, subject to mutual agreement between our agency and the selected candidate. Remote work will require utilization of agency-provided equipment while ensuring your availability during standard working hours via phone, email, or instant messaging. Access to agency systems will be facilitated through VPN or similar software.

About Us

We are embedded within the Oregon Immunization Program (OIP) and are dedicated to enhancing public health through innovative projects like the ALERT Immunization Information System (IIS) Replacement Project. Our mission is to provide a comprehensive platform that ensures access to immunization records while addressing emerging healthcare needs, including equity and inclusivity.

Role Overview

As a key member of our Project team, you will collaborate closely with the OIS Senior Project Manager to deliver exceptional Project Management Services and Deliverables for the ALERT IIS Replacement Project. Your primary responsibilities will include:

Developing and refining project planning and scheduling to enhance efficiency and accuracy.

Managing and assisting in the completion of project deliverables for ALERT IIS.

Acting as a liaison with the OIS technical support team.

Maintaining detailed schedules, timelines, and critical paths.

Conducting stage gate review meetings with the OIP team.

Advising on and escalating key issues that impact project schedules.

Ensuring optimal allocation of resources for assigned tasks.

Generating resource capacity reports for informed decision-making by senior management.

Crafting ad hoc reports as needed.

Required Skills And Experience

Proficiency in Office 365 and Tableau.

Prior experience in state government projects.

Strong project management skills.

Exceptional communication abilities.

Demonstrated effectiveness in remote work settings.

Preferred Skills And Experience

Familiarity with WSDL Language.

Basic understanding of HL7, with desired HL7 immunization profiles.

Proficiency in Visio for process mapping.

Join Our Team

If you're passionate about making a difference in public health and possess the requisite skills and experience, we encourage you to apply. Come be a part of our dynamic team dedicated to creating healthier communities through innovative solutions.

Note: This position is remote with potential for onsite meetings as agreed upon.

Wits Solutions Inc. (WITS) is a SBA certified 8(a) company with headquarters in the metropolitan Washington D.C. area. WITS has been providing best-in-class solutions in professional IT and administrative consulting to various Federal, State, Local and commercial customers. At WITS, we believe in working not for our clients but with them. This is why right from the beginning; our analysts and solution-builders work closely with our clients to ensure that the project outcomes continue to deliver value long into the future.

Job Description

Work Experience Mandatory:

At least ten years of federal law enforcement experience.
At least five years of federal health care fraud investigative experience in a similar position.
At least five years of forensic accounting experience.

Education/ Certification Mandatory

Bachelor’s Degree or higher.
Must have valid Kentucky driver’s license and dependable vehicle.
U.S. Citizenship.

Education/Certifications Nice To Have

Certified Fraud Examiner, Financial Crime Certification, or Certified Health Care Fraud Investigator credentials are preferred.

References/Certificates/Diplomas Required

3 professional references

Security Clearance

Eligible for Clearance

Roles And Responsibilities

Assists AUSAs in developing an investigative plan in all cases and matters assigned and ensure that investigative goals are clearly stated and met.
Working with the assigned AUSAs and/or supervisory attorneys, determines applicable criminal law, and identifies possible violations or causes of action.
Develops an understanding of all applicable federal, state, or local laws to the extent necessary to make sound decisions on direction and scope of investigations. Determines proof required to assist in affixing legal responsibility for litigation, and devises methods for obtaining, preserving, and presenting evidence to greatest effect.
Assists AUSAs in deciding the most efficacious methods for planning, scheduling, and conducting investigations, and identifies any resources that may be required.
Assists AUSAs with audit and financial investigations, typically involving one or more violators who are highly successful, professional, or recognized community business leaders; or financial entities having substantial business operations outside the immediate locality with a large number of activities, operations, and transactions whose interrelationships are difficult to establish;
Effects financial accounting examination of the books, records, computer tapes, data processing material, and activities of persons subject to investigation, including contractors. In the absence of records, obtains detailed financial information from other sources to include interview of business associates, firm employees, and competitors. Reconstructs partial or inadequate records are to the extent necessary for the purpose of investigation.
Obtains evidence through the interrogation of a large number of employees, business people, and other persons throughout the area who have knowledge of the operations.
Prepares concise and accurate audit reports, including criminal reference reports involving assembling, correlating, and analyzing the facts obtained and prepares detailed charts and schedules as necessary.
Assists AUSAs with conducting conferences and interviews with members, officers, directors, and representatives of financial institutions, law enforcement agents of the state and city governments and other branches of the Federal government, Certified Public Accountants, and attorneys
Performs a variety of ancillary investigation-related services in direct support of litigation. Support activities include one or more of the following:
Initiates contacts with federal, state, and local officials, and other organizations and individuals related to the subject of investigation, for the purpose of gathering facts, obtaining statements, learning sequences of events, obtaining explanations and otherwise advancing investigative objectives. Examines books, ledgers, payrolls, cost reports, billing statements, invoices, correspondence, computer data, and other records pertaining to the transactions, events, or allegations under investigation. Establishes and/or verifies relationships among all facts and evidence obtained or presented to confirm authenticity of documents, corroborate witness statements, and otherwise build proof necessary for successful litigation.
Utilizes laboratories and other forensic services to identify handwriting, fingerprints, questioned documents and substances, sound and video recordings, and other physical evidence. Arranges for secure storage, preservation, organization, and indexing of voluminous documentary evidence.
Conducts in-person and/or telephonic interviews of witnesses. Identifies the need for service of warrants and subpoenas, and secures participation of appropriate law enforcement agents in executions of same. Types hand scribed notes from interview discussions.
Coordinates surveillance of suspects with appropriate law enforcement/investigative agencies. Occasional surveillance activities personally performed occur in locations that are open and accessible to the public where there is little or no risk of physical harm to incumbent or others. The incumbent does not have arrest authority nor is authorized the use of deadly force. “Undercover” work characteristically does not involve physical interaction with the subject or target of a criminal investigation.
Prepares interim and final reports on progress of investigations for use by AUSAs and supervisory attorneys. Includes significant findings and conclusions, recommendations for additional investigative actions, and candid assessments of strengths and weaknesses of witnesses, documentary evidence, or other aspects of case.
Assists in compilation of documents and physical evidence, and creation of charts, graphs, videotapes, and other audio-visual materials for use by AUSAs in motions and at trial. Provides advice to AUSAs on selection of witnesses and ensures their attendance through subpoena or otherwise. Testifies in court regarding investigations, as required.
Performs other related duties as assigned
