Job Description

As the VP of Sales for our Fiberon brand of products, you will be responsible for establishing, managing, and directing the execution of sales plans and initiatives achieving strategic, financial, and sales goals in the United States. Your responsibilities include strategic planning focused on sales growth and delivering a culture focused on excellent customer service while engaging in strategic problem resolution.

Reporting to this role is a team of approximately 5 district/regional sales managers and 40 indirect territory managers. You will be reporting to the General Manager/President of Fiberon.

The ideal candidate will have (10+) years of sales management experience in the building materials/timber/composites industry, particularly, with two-step distribution, managed a large sales team and P&L, and is a strong people leader and motivator. You will need to be able to travel overnight at least 4-6x a month.

This role is remote- based in the United States with preference to those in a larger metropolitan city with a large airport for ease of travel. The salary range is anywhere from a base of $170K-200K annually plus bonus based on performance and other factors.

What You Will Be Doing

Develop and oversee annual sales plans aligned with organizational objectives, driving revenue growth through effective policy implementation.
Coordinate communication efforts, ensuring adherence to expenditure guidelines and supporting sales goals in collaboration with the VP of Marketing.
Utilize market research to recommend and implement sales strategies for continuous improvement.
Manage distribution strategies and diverse channel selling approaches proficiently.
Lead, nurture, and empower a sales team to execute initiatives effectively.
Conduct comprehensive strategic planning and analysis to ensure organizational success.
Drive business growth through technical expertise in strategic and sales planning.
Implement training programs to enhance team skills and a customer-centric approach.
Demonstrate exceptional interpersonal and communication skills to deliver impactful presentations.
Cultivate a high-performance culture and contribute as a collaborative team member to support organizational success.

Qualifications

Sales professional with a record of green-fielding and closing large deals.
Minimum of 10 years industry sales experience with 4 years in a leadership role developing and managing a successful sales force.
Must have building materials industry experience, ideally in related specialty (non-commodity) building materials that are branded and are purchased based on aesthetic/performance/price equation.
Proven track record of dealing with the distributor, dealer, pro builder.
Previous experience building and executing dealer programs in a similar distributor, dealer, pro builder community.
Ability to understand and communicate various technical elements related to our product and processes.
Ability to leverage technology tools such as; GoToMeeting, Microsoft, Power Point, Word, etc.
Must be able to create and present detailed proposals/solutions for prospects.
Confidence and competence to carry on a business conversation with executives and decision makers from senior level and down throughout the three channels.
History of extensive business travel and ability to travel on on-going basis approximately 3-4 nights a week.
Must be a proactive individual with a passion to both plan and execute.
Street savvy with the ability to keep others accountable is required.

Preferred Qualifications

BS/BA Degree highly preferred.
Prior experience working with contractor facing Pull-Through Specialists is desired.

Additional Information

At Fortune Brands Innovations, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous ERGs (Employee Resource Groups) to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.

Who We Are
Standard International is the company behind The Standard, Bunkhouse Group and The Peri Hotel, with offices in New York, Bangkok, London and Austin. The company has 21 hotels and food + beverage properties open with more to come. Standard International is on the forefront of immersive experience creation at its properties and technology-driven innovation in the industry, including its spontaneous booking application, One Night Standard.

The Purpose of the Role

The Corporate Director, Sales & Events is responsible for the planning, development, execution and overall management of hotels sales programs consistent with, and supportive of, the overall business objectives of portfolio hotels. The Corporate Director of Sales will support the sales team within North America + Europe.

The Duties and Responsibilities

Lead Property Director of Sales to drive results from sales related segments and achieve overall hotel revenue goals.
Achieve non-revenue related goals such as KPIs, proactive sales efforts, cross-selling, etc.
Direct and coordinate company sales functions.
Comply with company SOPs as detailed in the Sales Handbook and directed by EVP, Commercial & Revenue Strategy.
Develop and coordinate property sales selling cycle and methodology.
Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of sales, methods, costs, and results.
Develop sales budgets and oversee the development and management of internal operating budgets.
Directly manage major and critical developing client accounts.
Establish and implement short- and long-range goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures.
Represent the company at various community and/or business meetings to promote the company.
Supervise the preparation, issuance, and delivery of sales materials, exhibits, and promotion programs.
Assess and monitor the on-going financial performance of each hotel through continuous review of revenue generation efforts and through the development, analysis and implementation of the annual budgets, sales and marketing plans and forecasts.
Develop, build support for, and implement strategic sales and tactical plans that align with the Company's overall strategies and lead to positive business results.
Develop in-depth market research and competitor intelligence to ensure understanding of local market trends and conditions.
Direct and assist in developing new and expanding market share in existing accounts by leveraging the attributes of each hotel and the surrounding area against each group's, company's or individual's specific needs and buying tendencies.
Collaborate with General Managers and Corporate Officers regarding strategic direction and sales revenue performance against determined budget expectations.
Promote positive relations with partners, vendors, and distributors.
Recommend and administer policies and procedures to enhance operations.
Develop, implement, track quarterly and annual sales incentive plan for property teams.
Weekly one on One, Coach and Mentor.
Reporting on Pace, Pipeline and Activities and gap to forecast.
Establish and implement short and long-range departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures.
Serve on Corp office planning and policymaking committees.
Attend hotel wide social, community and associate functions.
Create, review, and advise on property action plans.

The Qualifications, Knowledge and Skills Needed

College degree preferred.
5 years of Hotel Sales Experience.
3 years property DOS Experience.
Strong leadership and communication skills.
Strong managerial skills.
Compute accurate mathematical calculations.
Fluency in English both verbally and non-verbally.
Previous experience in hospitality industry, preferably a 4- or 5-star hotel.
Familiarity with statistical reports.
Experience in strategic planning and execution.
Knowledge of contracting, negotiating, and change management.
Knowledge of structuring sales quota goals and revenue expectations
Ability to understand and communicate market trends, demand generators, supply/demand and economic factors affecting hotel performance.
Ability to motivate teams to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects.
Ability to participate in and facilitate group meetings.

Physical Requirements:
Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 lb. without assistance.
Requires grasping, writing, standing, sitting, walking, repetitive motions, bending, climbing, listening, and hearing ability and visual acuity.
Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period or for an entire work shift.
Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping.
Remain in stationary position for extended periods of time.

Company Description

At Fortune Brands Innovations, we believe that our innovation and success are fueled by the passion of our people and the strength of our teams. Together, we work to fulfill dreams of home by aligning around common goals, being agile in the face of change, holding ourselves accountable, and acting with integrity and transparency. We succeed when everyone belongs and strive to build a Home for All where all associates can be their true, authentic selves at work. Learn more about our culture here.

Job Description

As the VP of Sales for our Fiberon brand of products, you will be responsible for establishing, managing, and directing the execution of sales plans and initiatives achieving strategic, financial, and sales goals in the United States. Your responsibilities include strategic planning focused on sales growth and delivering a culture focused on excellent customer service while engaging in strategic problem resolution.

Reporting to this role is a team of approximately 5 district/regional sales managers and 40 indirect territory managers. You will be reporting to the General Manager/President of Fiberon.

The ideal candidate will have (10+) years of sales management experience in the building materials/timber/composites industry, particularly, with two-step distribution, managed a large sales team and P&L, and is a strong people leader and motivator. You will need to be able to travel overnight at least 4-6x a month.

This role is remote- based in the United States with preference to those in a larger metropolitan city with a large airport for ease of travel. The salary range is anywhere from a base of $170K-200K annually plus bonus based on performance and other factors.

What You Will Be Doing

Develop and oversee annual sales plans aligned with organizational objectives, driving revenue growth through effective policy implementation.
Coordinate communication efforts, ensuring adherence to expenditure guidelines and supporting sales goals in collaboration with the VP of Marketing.
Utilize market research to recommend and implement sales strategies for continuous improvement.
Manage distribution strategies and diverse channel selling approaches proficiently.
Lead, nurture, and empower a sales team to execute initiatives effectively.
Conduct comprehensive strategic planning and analysis to ensure organizational success.
Drive business growth through technical expertise in strategic and sales planning.
Implement training programs to enhance team skills and a customer-centric approach.
Demonstrate exceptional interpersonal and communication skills to deliver impactful presentations.
Cultivate a high-performance culture and contribute as a collaborative team member to support organizational success.

Qualifications

Sales professional with a record of green-fielding and closing large deals.
Minimum of 10 years industry sales experience with 4 years in a leadership role developing and managing a successful sales force.
Must have building materials industry experience, ideally in related specialty (non-commodity) building materials that are branded and are purchased based on aesthetic/performance/price equation.
Proven track record of dealing with the distributor, dealer, pro builder.
Previous experience building and executing dealer programs in a similar distributor, dealer, pro builder community.
Ability to understand and communicate various technical elements related to our product and processes.
Ability to leverage technology tools such as; GoToMeeting, Microsoft, Power Point, Word, etc.
Must be able to create and present detailed proposals/solutions for prospects.
Confidence and competence to carry on a business conversation with executives and decision makers from senior level and down throughout the three channels.
History of extensive business travel and ability to travel on on-going basis approximately 3-4 nights a week.
Must be a proactive individual with a passion to both plan and execute.
Street savvy with the ability to keep others accountable is required.

Preferred Qualifications

BS/BA Degree highly preferred.
Prior experience working with contractor facing Pull-Through Specialists is desired.

Additional Information

At Fortune Brands Innovations, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous ERGs (Employee Resource Groups) to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.

Fortune Brands Innovation (FBIN) is built on industry-leading brands and innovation within our operating segments: water, outdoors and security. We have an impressive track record of strong financial results, market outperformance and growth, which translates into career and professional growth opportunities for associates. Please visit our website at fbin.com to learn more.

Equal Employment Opportunity

FBIN is an equal opportunity employer. FBIN evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability/handicap status, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Job Description

Luxury jewelry brand seeks a Sales Development Assistant to report directly to the Managing Director. The position involves supporting 3 senior sales staff and the Director by setting up the salon displays daily, tracking all jewelry, creating style sheets with Photoshop, assisting with client visits and transactions and overall inventory management. The Sales Development Assistant also manages budgeting, logistics and vendor contracts for all off-site trunk shows and works with the marketing team to develop invitation lists, gift bags and other requirements for special events. The Assistant will travel with the sales team to trunk show locations four to six times a year and manage all logistics on site.

This role requires a luxury goods sensibility, excellent communication skills and the ability to multitask. The ideal candidate is highly organized, detail oriented, PC literate, Photoshop proficient and possesses a strong desire to build relationships with vendors and clients.

Salary commensurate with experience.

Company Description

Verdura is a jeweler and specialty retailer, headquartered in New York. Founded in 1939 by Duke Fulco di Verdura, its present-day collection is based on designs created by Fulco during his lifetime, as well as vintage estate pieces.

Job Title: Healthcare Sales Administration Analyst
100% Remote
Pay Rate: $24/Hour
12+ Months Contract (with higher possibility of an extension)
The Select Segment New Business Assistant is responsible for initiating the presale process in a timely and accurate manner, using documented Hub processes and procedures.
Role Summary:
The New Business Assistant is responsible for reviewing Request for Proposals (RFPs) and entering the opportunity in SalesForce.com. The New Business Assistant works closely with the New Business Manager (NBM), Brokers, Presale Team and internal matrix partners to ensure accurate and complete set-up of prospective clients for quoting purposes.
The ideal candidate is able to recognize this role’s importance in us “getting it right the first time.” As the first point of contact, attention to detail and ability to be organized while working in a fast paced environment would be key. The role does allow a pathway into the Presale Analyst role, allowing the ability to have career progression if skills align with the outlined expectations.
Role Components:
The New Business Assistant will be responsible for starting the presale process by:
· Establishing a SalesForce.com opportunity for each new business prospect.
· Maintaining accountability for the central mailbox and meet submission turnaround times.
· Ensuring accuracy of information and opportunities in Salesforce.com
· Ensuring timely assignment to Presale Consultant with a “cc” to the NBM
· Proactively communicating with internal and external customers to facilitate the RFP workflow.
· Communicating effectively with Brokers to fully understand their RFP needs as it relates to system entry
· Tracking opportunity assignments in Velocity
· Willingness to pilot new processes in order to remain efficient
· Developing and building relationship with matrix partners
· Supporting the Presale Consultant through the notification of cross quote opportunities/activity.
· Order requested RFP sales reports through Salesforce.com
· Strong analytical ability, with ability to design, track, and work toward specific measurable performance targets for self and team
· Proficiency with multiple software and system-based applications, including database and spreadsheets (Excel, tracking systems)
· Engage in career enhancing activities to improve personal development
Minimum Qualifications:
· Associate's Degree or equivalent work experience may substitute in lieu of degree
· Strong written & verbal communication skills
· Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
· Detail oriented with exceptional follow-up skills
· Ability to work in a production-like, fast paced environment and adapt quickly to change
· Strong organization skills with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment; manage, prioritize and work on numerous projects at one time.
· Ability to consistently meet tight deadlines and work under pressure while anticipating the needs of the customer and/or business partner and understanding the consequences of actions.
· Strong computer based technical skills including Outlook, Excel and Word and internet/web navigation
Competencies Required:
· Balances Stakeholders: Anticipating and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders
· Plans & Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
· Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
· Manages Complexity: Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
· Manages Ambiguity: Operating Effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear

If you thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment and have a passion for driving business growth, they want to hear from you!

Our client is more than just a florist—it's a revolutionary way to express emotions, celebrate occasions, and leave a lasting impression. Key Responsibilities:

- Lead and motivate a team of sales representatives to achieve and exceed sales targets

About Motorsport Network

Motorsport Network is a global media powerhouse, producing premium racing and automotive content with a reach of over 50 million fans, professionals, and enthusiasts across more than 25 markets. Our portfolio includes some of the most respected and influential properties in the category, including Motorsport, Autosport, Motor1, and InsideEVs. Led by world-class editorial talent, we deliver news, entertainment, experiences, and intelligence spanning digital, video, social, and audio. Acquired by GMF Capital in June 2023, Motorsport Network is emerging as the leading platform for motorsports and automotive culture in the U.S. and worldwide. Motorsport Network’s commercial division leverages our influence on behalf of brands, orchestrating industry-defining sponsorship, advertising, and marketing partnerships.

Position Overview

Motorsport Network is in search of a seasoned Sales Director to join our team as an individual contributor. With a minimum of 5 years of digital media sales experience, the ideal candidate will thrive in driving revenue growth not only through media sales but also through partnership and sponsorship sales. An appreciation and enthusiasm for motorsports and automotive are essential, with direct or indirect sports experience considered a valuable asset. Motorsport Network collaborates with brand partners spanning various sectors such as automotive, technology, financial services, travel, beverages, consumer packaged goods, apparel, footwear, watches, and luxury goods. This role presents a unique opportunity to take ownership of sales strategies, foster key client relationships, and unlock new business opportunities that propel Motorsport Network forward.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies focused on digital media advertising, partnership, and sponsorship sales to meet and exceed revenue targets.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key clients, media and sports marketing agencies, and potential partners, serving as the primary point of contact for all sales-related activities.
Identify and pursue new business opportunities through proactive outreach, networking, and strategic prospecting efforts.
Collaborate closely with internal teams, including marketing, editorial, and product, to develop customized advertising solutions and partnership packages that align with client objectives.
Lead negotiations and contract discussions with clients and partners, ensuring mutually beneficial terms and agreements.
Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.
Provide regular sales performance updates and reports to senior management, highlighting key achievements and areas for improvement.
Represent Motorsport Network at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to promote our brand and expand our network within the motorsport community.

Skills/Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in digital media sales, with a proven track record of exceeding sales targets.
Strong understanding of the digital advertising landscape, including programmatic buying, native advertising, and branded content.
Experience in partnership and sponsorship sales within the sports or media industry is highly desirable.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and solutions to clients effectively.
Strategic thinker with the ability to identify and capitalize on market opportunities.
Proactive, self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a passion for motorsports and automotive.
Ability to travel as needed for client meetings, industry events, and conferences.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) is desirable.
Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
Results-oriented mindset with a commitment to driving revenue growth and achieving business objectives.

Compensation

The hiring range for this position is $130k-$160k per year, plus eligibility for an annual bonus based on meeting OTE (“On-Target-Earnings). The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate's geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The compensation package also includes the medical, dental, and vision and an unlimited PTO plan a 401(k) with employer match.

Application Process

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply here, and we will review your application as soon as possible.

Motorsport Network is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.

We are Ketone-IQ, a brand rooted in fueling elite endurance athletes, now positioned to disrupt the energy market. From cyclists winning the Tour de France, to EMT workers pulling a double-shift, Ketone-IQ is a new kind of energy - not only what gets you off the starting line, but across the finish.

In 2019, we secured a $6MM contract with the US Department of Defense SOCOM to innovate this ketone nutritional superfuel. Ketone-IQ is trusted by high performers of all kinds, including Olympic athletes, Tour de France cyclists, Navy SEALs, and athletes in every major sports league in the US — and now, we’re bringing it to everyone.

Ketone-IQ is High Performance Energy. We’re changing the way people fuel and rapidly expanding as we lead the ketone movement.

What You Will Do

As a key member of the sales team, you will be laser-focused on opening new accounts and elevating performance in existing accounts through strategic sales plans and promotions. This role is an incredible opportunity to take what is already the top-performing product in the category to the next level. This role reports to the Head of Commercial Strategy.

Who You Are

You a high-performing sales professional with a proven track record of growing sales in conventional and/or natural grocery. You have experience calling on national chain buyers and distributors that will allow you to make an immediate impact from your previous relationships and work experience. You have strong attention to detail yet love to get creative on ways to drive volume and build relationships. You have a passion to win and having the chance to make Ketone-IQ ubiquitous lights you up.

Responsibilities

Open new conventional and natural grocery accounts and expand existing accounts to deliver growth against Company sales and business targets
Proactively identify areas for improvement or new opportunities among assigned retailers, and take action across distribution, product placement, merchandising solutions, and promotional effectiveness
Build winning relationships with the retailers, broker, distributor team, and category managers to ensure top-notch execution and continued growth
Execute promotional plans that drive positive gains and ROI
Analyze sales data and market trends to identify opportunities for improvement
Develop and manage forecasts, financial targets, P&L and budgeting for assigned retailers / accounts
Offer strategic insights and direction for the development of assigned retail channels, customer/distributors, and sales strategies
Directly manage key accounts, identify opportunities, build, plan, and execute within the distributor network
Represent Ketone-IQ at retail meetings, trade events, broker meetings, and industry conferences
This position is responsible for the West and the ideal candidate resides in Los Angeles or nearby areas

Qualifications

Minimum 5+ progressive experience working in sales and account management within the conventional grocery and/or natural channels
Strong existing relationships with major conventional and natural retailers such as Whole Foods Market and Albertsons
Experience from a high-growth CPG company, preferably beverage or shots
Experience with UNFI and KeHe
Substantial experience with syndicated data (Nielsen, IRI, SPINS, etc.)
Proficiency in sales planning, forecasting, budgeting, and leveraging sales data to drive narratives and strategic decision making
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Team Player with the ability to mentor, train, and inspire a team to achieve revenue targets
Excellent negotiator and influencer
Passion to win
Curious, forward thinker with an owner mentality
Self-starter with a strong sense of urgency
Results Oriented
Ability to travel 25-50% of the time if needed

Purpose for the Role

To establish and grow the ICO dealer base in Florida (Remote) and to establish the ICO brand as the dominant leader in our markets within the area. To acquire new dealers in other regions in North America if and when they are added to your portfolio.

Vision for the Role

To build and grow a superior presence in the regions that beats the competition, and positions ICO as the superior supplier in service and quality. To ensure all new products are quickly and successfully launched into all existing customers. To deliver on the ICO vision – to become the favorite vendor of discerning bathroom showrooms throughout North America.

Accountabilities & Measures
Account manage and grow ICO dealer base –

Measures for Performance - Consistent sales growth in accordance to company sales targets Regular planned dealer visits to:
Gain visibility and identify problems and competitive threats, deliver new brochures, price lists, etc.
Organize dealer training initiatives.
Ensure ICO displays are installed and presented properly, and that ICO real-estate in the showroom is maximized.
New product introductions, stock orders and display deals including installations.
Accurate reporting on all sales visits with detailed notes and action items – follow up tasks completed promptly.
High scores on service from customers on company surveys.
High quality negotiations with upper level management that yield profitable deals.

Progressing dealer leads through the sales cycle in the pipeline - set up new dealers in the region, until the ICO dealer base is complete, and displays/accounts are set up in every showroom that ICO wants to partner with new dealers are then account managed to grow sales as quickly as possible F2F with customers 4 out of 5 days / week CRM always accurate and up to date KPIs consistently reported on, and are achieved or outperformed.

Grow ICO brand presence with pull through sales –
Measures for Performance - Frequent visits and sales presentations to designers, architects, home builders etc to create pull through sales to the dealer base and generate and close whale opportunities Work with inside sales team and be available for when any F2F presence is needed.

New business development in other regions in USA as needed –

Measures for Performance - Progressing dealer leads through the sales cycle in the pipeline.

Product & Market Feedback –

Measures for Performance - Provide feedback to the R&D team on product and market development Participate in new product feedback campaigns and customer surveys.

Essential Skills

Embrace ICO’s mission, vision and values.
Excellent ability to communicate, negotiate, and influence upper level management/decision makers, as well as with showroom consultants / designers.
Able to build fast relationships with the team at each dealer, to win them round and make ICO their “go to” line to sell.
Excellent business sense - understands profit and loss, expenses, business dealings, sales and showroom mentality.
Previous success and sales experience in aggressive growth situations for a wholesaler or manufacturing / distribution – ability to identify and close whales.
Diligent and hard-working, organized and methodical.
Trustworthy, confidential and loyal.
Loves travelling.
Can work remotely from home with same discipline and focus, and can utilize the head office team efficiently to run the regions.
Money motivated, but with customer service focus.
Humble, hungry and a killer team player – easy to work with.

Required Training & Experience
Will train in our products and services.
Will train in our CRM, ERP system and other software used within ICO.
Must have previous sales experience, both phone and F2F, with a proven track record of opening new accounts and managing / growing existing accounts.
Must understand the dealer sales model and the value of pull through business

Description

HIGHLIGHTS

If you've been a sales leader at early-stage SaaS startups, this is a great opportunity to move into a Head of Sales role where you will lead all prospecting and closing efforts and report to the CEO.
It's a great time to join as you’re early enough to have a significant impact, but not so early that we don’t already have a strong product and repeatable sales process (hundreds of paying customers, #1 on G2, etc).
This is a front-line leadership role. You will get to build an in-person sales culture at our SF office and get in the weeds by coaching reps, co-selling larger deals, and doing what it takes to win.


About Perfect Venue

Private events and catering can significantly increase restaurant revenue, but many restaurants are stuck using outdated, error-prone manual processes - unlike the sophisticated software employed by large chains. Perfect Venue is leveling the playing field by offering local restaurants an affordable, user-friendly, event management tool to help local restaurants compete with big chains. This is just the start, with plans to expand into a broader marketplace that includes venues and other event services (DJs, florists, etc).

Recently featured in TechCrunch, Fortune, Axios, Eater, and others.

OUR CULTURE & VALUES

We love helping people. Above all, we see our job as solving our customers' problems. Small business owners work tirelessly to serve their customers, and we work just as hard to serve them. We are competitive and love to win; someone once described us as "low-key Type-As". Here are some of our core values:

We’re customer obsessed
We build exceptional products
We FITFO
We play to win
We think like scientists


Requirements

THE OPPORTUNITY

We're obviously biased - but this is a phenomenal opportunity for an ambitious sales leader. You’ll be early enough to have a significant impact, but not so early that we don’t already have strong PMF and a repeatable sales process (hundreds of paying customers, #1 G2, etc).

We have customers nationwide paying hundreds of dollars per month and are backed by leading Silicon Valley investors, including the 1st investor in Zoom. We have a very high close rate as our product is the #1 rated venue management tool on G2.com. Since our product is essentially a CRM for restaurants, it will feel familiar to you which makes it easy to learn and sell with conviction.

Responsibilities

Attract, hire, and manage a world-class team
Lead a team of SDRs & AEs to hit and exceed goals through effective recruiting, training, and coaching
Co-sell larger deals
Build a world-class in-office sales culture
Collaborate with growth, product, and customer success leaders to drive results
Be flexible! At the end of the day, we're a startup - so things are always changing


NEED TO HAVE

5+ years sales leadership experience & 3+ years of closing experience
First sales leader at a high-growth seed stage SaaS startup and have built sales teams from the ground up
SMB and Mid-Market experience
Strong prospecting experience (list building, email sequences, cold calling, etc)
Excited to build an in-office sales culture
Set high standards and is never satisfied with anything - ever
Experience training and coaching reps using Active Listening Skills


NICE TO HAVE

PLG motion experience
Worked closely with marketing to develop unified GTM motions
You've sold hospitality tech or worked in hospitality in the past
Hubspot experience
Outside sales experience


Benefits

Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance
Complimentary One Medical membership for you and your family
401(K)
Flexible PTO
Company laptop + equipment
Extremely comfortable company swag (it's really soft)
Company offsites


Perfect Venue is committed to building a winning team

About Motorsport Network

Motorsport Network is a global media powerhouse, producing premium racing and automotive content with a reach of over 50 million fans, professionals, and enthusiasts across more than 25 markets. Our portfolio includes some of the most respected and influential properties in the category, including Motorsport, Autosport, Motor1, and InsideEVs. Led by world-class editorial talent, we deliver news, entertainment, experiences, and intelligence spanning digital, video, social, and audio. Acquired by GMF Capital in June 2023, Motorsport Network is emerging as the leading platform for motorsports and automotive culture in the U.S. and worldwide. Motorsport Network’s commercial division leverages our influence on behalf of brands, orchestrating industry-defining sponsorship, advertising, and marketing partnerships.

Position Overview

Motorsport Network is in search of a seasoned Sales Director to join our team as an individual contributor. With a minimum of 5 years of digital media sales experience, the ideal candidate will thrive in driving revenue growth not only through media sales but also through partnership and sponsorship sales. An appreciation and enthusiasm for motorsports and automotive are essential, with direct or indirect sports experience considered a valuable asset. Motorsport Network collaborates with brand partners spanning various sectors such as automotive, technology, financial services, travel, beverages, consumer packaged goods, apparel, footwear, watches, and luxury goods. This role presents a unique opportunity to take ownership of sales strategies, foster key client relationships, and unlock new business opportunities that propel Motorsport Network forward.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies focused on digital media advertising, partnership, and sponsorship sales to meet and exceed revenue targets.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key clients, media and sports marketing agencies, and potential partners, serving as the primary point of contact for all sales-related activities.
Identify and pursue new business opportunities through proactive outreach, networking, and strategic prospecting efforts.
Collaborate closely with internal teams, including marketing, editorial, and product, to develop customized advertising solutions and partnership packages that align with client objectives.
Lead negotiations and contract discussions with clients and partners, ensuring mutually beneficial terms and agreements.
Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.
Provide regular sales performance updates and reports to senior management, highlighting key achievements and areas for improvement.
Represent Motorsport Network at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to promote our brand and expand our network within the motorsport community.

Skills/Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in digital media sales, with a proven track record of exceeding sales targets.
Strong understanding of the digital advertising landscape, including programmatic buying, native advertising, and branded content.
Experience in partnership and sponsorship sales within the sports or media industry is highly desirable.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and solutions to clients effectively.
Strategic thinker with the ability to identify and capitalize on market opportunities.
Proactive, self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a passion for motorsports and automotive.
Ability to travel as needed for client meetings, industry events, and conferences.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) is desirable.
Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
Results-oriented mindset with a commitment to driving revenue growth and achieving business objectives.

Compensation

The hiring range for this position in New York, NY is $130k-$160k per year, plus eligibility for an annual bonus based on meeting OTE (“On-Target-Earnings). The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate's geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The compensation package also includes the medical, dental, and vision and an unlimited PTO plan a 401(k) with employer match.

Application Process

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply here, and we will review your application as soon as possible.

Motorsport Network is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.

In this role, the Area Business Manager (ABM) will develop the territory business plan to achieve/exceed business and sales goals. You will work closely with your team and others across the organization to execute and deliver sales results that contribute to the overall performance, culture, and success of the organization. The Area Business Manager will play a pivotal role in introducing Madrigal and our potential groundbreaking first-to-market product addressing a significant patient unmet need. As an Area Business Manager, you will be responsible for building relationships with healthcare professionals, driving product adoption, and, achieving sales goals within your designated territory. You will work closely with a cross-functional team to educate healthcare providers about the product profile of our innovative therapy.

The Area Business Manager will exhibit exceptionally strong clinical and business acumen. Existing relationships with local GI HCPs is strongly preferred, as is working knowledge of market access and local impacts on territory-level business trends. The successful candidate will have an in-depth understanding of analytics to identify business opportunities and create actionable business plans for execution at launch. It is expected that this team member will display a high level of collaboration with cross-functional colleagues to create a positive customer experience for a diverse range of healthcare professionals.

Position Responsibilities:

Develop a deep understanding of resmetirom, its mechanism of action, and its clinical benefits
Effectively communicate the clinical profile of the product to healthcare professionals
Tailor product presentations to the specific needs and interests of each healthcare provider
Create a detailed territory-level business plan to ensure successful launch execution post FDA approval
Strategically plan and prioritize sales activities to maximize coverage and impact within your assigned territory
Identify and target key healthcare providers, including gastroenterologists, endocrinologists, and APPs
Analyze and ensure utilization of sales and marketing tools and other resources provided to educate healthcare professionals on the company’s product(s)
Provide in-depth product training and education to healthcare professionals and their staff
Stay up to date on the latest clinical data and treatment guidelines related to GI specialty
Ability to display a high level of clinical and business acumen; accountability for self to demonstrate mastery level of clinical knowledge, including assessments
Develop an actionable business plan to execute effective sales strategies and tactics to drive product adoption to meet or exceed sales objectives
Continuously analyze sales data and market trends to adapt your approach and improve performance
Drive sales results while effectively and compliantly promoting the company’s product(s) to targeted HCPs and other healthcare professionals
Work collaboratively and compliantly with cross-functional field-facing partners to develop internal and external customer focused initiatives and deliver a positive customer experience
Demonstrate patient centric mindset
Follow up on customers’ and cross-functional partner requests with a sense of urgency in a legal and compliant manner
Establish and cultivate strategic relationships with physicians and other healthcare professionals within a designated geography
Spearhead cross-functional collaboration and serve as a commercial lead for customer engagement model
Comply with all legal, regulatory, compliance, and company policies and demonstrate a high level of integrity and professionalism at all times
Maintain accurate and timely records of sales calls, interactions, and expenses
Generate regular reports on territory performance and market insights
Attend all company-sponsored sales and medical meetings as directed by management; attend live conferences and/or programs as necessary as a Madrigal representative

Qualifications and Skills

Bachelor’s degree required
5+ years of pharmaceutical or biotech industry experience required
Prior specialty launch experience is preferred
Proven track record of success in the pharmaceutical/ biopharmaceutical, medical device, or related sales; GI experience is strongly preferred
Strong understanding of the local GI market and the challenges faced by healthcare providers
Local experience; proven access to local GI thought leaders within assigned territory strongly preferred
Ability to utilize sales and market data to create actionable territory business plans to drive sales results
Excellent communication and presentation skills; including proven ability to successfully influence in the virtual setting
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Highly motivated, self-driven, goal-oriented, and adaptable
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with healthcare professionals
Ability to learn complex scientific and technical information and effectively communicate to a broad audience of healthcare professionals
Advocate for creating an inclusive, diverse, and positive culture based on trust, transparency, and teamwork
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
A valid driver’s license and ability to travel as needed (including overnights and/or weekends) is required
Frequent travel between meeting sites, requiring the ability to sit for extended periods of time
Frequent use of a computer, iPad, telephone, printer, or other office equipment
Ability to lift up to 20 pounds
Must live within territory boundaries and ideally near the workload center to ensure a positive work/life balance

Compensation

The expected annual base salary range for this role is between $140,000-$190,000 a year. An attractive compensation package will be offered to the successful candidate. It will include a competitive base salary, incentive bonus, and car allowance for travel within the territory. A benefits package customary to the position will also be provided including 401k match, medical and dental.

Madrigal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran or disabled status, or other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Unsolicited resumes from agencies should not be forwarded to Madrigal. Madrigal will not be responsible for any fees arising from the use of resumes through this source. Madrigal will only pay a fee to agencies if a formal agreement between Madrigal and the agency has been established.

Please be aware that we are currently receiving numerous reports of individuals misrepresenting themselves as Madrigal Pharmaceuticals’ Hiring Managers, seeking to engage with job candidates through fraudulent online advertisements or job posting sites. These unauthorized individuals are using Madrigal’s name and logo in an attempt to solicit up-front fees and obtain personal information from interested job candidates. Please know that Madrigal does not conduct interviews via text or in chat rooms; conduct interviews via Skype, RingCentral or solely via telephone; charge candidates an advance fee of any kind (e.g., fees for purchasing equipment); nor does it offer positions of employment without undergoing a thorough recruiting process. Interviews with Madrigal are conducted via the Zoom platform.

Please also note that any correspondence with regard to employment would come from an authorized madrigalpharma.com email address or from an email address from one of our trusted search firm partners. We are aware that incorrect/fraudulent email addresses, with Madrigal misspelled, have been utilized in these most recent fraud attempts. If you receive unsolicited employment offers from people claiming to work for Madrigal we recommend that you: do not respond to their questions; do not open any attachments; and do not click on any hyperlinks.

Job Description

Job Title: Sales Engineer

Company: Aisin World Corp of America

Department: OE Sales - Drivetrain Sales

Location: Northville, MI

Position Responsibilities

The incumbent is expected to perform the following functions that the company has determined are essential to this position:

Support the sales activities for Drivetrain products. Core activities are as follows (but not limited to):

Analyze cost received from overseas and local counterparts based on respective product and manufacturing process.
Build piece price and tooling quotations and submit to customers on time, by understanding the products, target & market price for the products, manufacturing processes, cost structures and profit potential.
Negotiate pricing with each customer's Purchasing personnel based on submitted quotations, data, and logic.
Develop and execute short and long-term sales plans based on gathered account data/information, considering product, AISIN, customer and market conditions.
Support the launch of new programs or ECI’s by tracking open issues and risks, recovering costs, and reporting profitability.
Conduct regular meetings with various departments (including internal, overseas, North American Plants and customer) to share program status and review open issues.
Support AISIN cross-functional teams in their daily activities and drive issues to closure.
Operate with "cross-functional" and “team” mindset and be willing to take on additional responsibilities as dictated by business environment.

Required Skills And Abilities

Essential Skills and Experience:

Related experience, including internship or Co-op, in a professional environment, ideally automotive.
Proven critical thinking skills and data-driven decision making.
Strong organization skills (e.g. issue prioritization, time management, consistent and diligent record-keeping, etc.).
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Computer expertise (MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint).
Global mindset to work with international counterparts.

Beneficial Skills And Experience

Familiarity with OEM purchasing procedures and systems, in particular Toyota and Honda.
Sales experience or internship in the automotive industry, preferably with a Tier One supplier relating to Drivetrain products (e.g. transmissions, transfer cases, electric motors, etc.)
Project Management experience and / or prior use of MS Project.

Education/Training/Certifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Applied Science or Business.

Travel Requirements

Approximately 0-5 %
Must be willing and available to travel to such locations and with such frequency as is necessary and desirable to meet business needs.

Work Environment Requirements

With reasonable accommodation:

Must be able to operate a personal computer, telephone, and other office equipment.
Must perform job duties onsite, when necessary, except those duties that are customarily or by their nature performed offsite (for example, offsite customer visits).
Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Must be able to work on multiple assignments at once, and complete assignments within deadline and budget (if applicable) with satisfactory quality.
Must be able to operate as an effective team member.
Must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all company safety policies.

Attendance/Work Hour Requirements

Must maintain an acceptable attendance record.

A $35 billion company, AISIN is the largest manufacturer of automatic transmissions in the world and employs more than 120,000 team members at 216 consolidated companies.

Chances are that the vehicle you're riding in is equipped with an Aisin product.

Direct, coach and manage performance of the team to comply with company and territory/regional goals and drive success

Implement tracking systems to measure outcomes and progress; lead forecasting efforts

Maintain strong relationships and rapport with customers and key opinion leaders within region
Enforce company code of conduct and policies/procedures as well as duties and responsibilities within department

Travel requirement up to 70% including overnight

Bachelor’s Degree required, Master’s of Audiology or Doctorate Audiology Preferred
2+ years’ experience in field sales management and supervision

Proven track record of leading successful teams

Focus on building strong customer relationships
Focus on achievement of growth goals and staff accountability

Job Description

At Solatube International, Inc., we pride ourselves on manufacturing the world's #1 Tubular Daylighting Device. Our ability to accomplish this goal is based primarily on the people we hire. We look for adaptable, self-motivated, passionate, creative team players. If this sounds like you, why not bring your talents and skills to Solatube International?

To help us continue to grow our offerings, we’re searching for a Corporate Sales Trainer. The Sales Trainer acts as a subject matter expert for in-home sales and inside sales employees. The right candidate will champion sales workflow training and best practices, and develop/deliver training programs to Solatube Home employees. You will drive sales growth by assessing gaps in employee knowledge, develop training programs to close these gaps, and and implement those programs throughout the organization

Benefits include a competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance with HSA plan, retirement plan with 4% company match, 13 days of Paid Time Off and 10 paid company holidays, and upward advancement potential.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Develops content suited for classroom, virtual and self-guided learning.
Develops “Train the Trainer” programs for business leaders.
Works with the regional business leaders to develop high performing field sales teams and inside sales teams.
Trains field sales teams and inside sales teams in the existing Six-Step Consultation Process.
Demonstrates best practices throughout the sales workflow.
Works collaboratively with the regional business leaders to develop customized sales coaching programs for sales teams based on the Solatube Home sales process.
Supports continuous training and performance development by creating relevant content.
Assesses sales teams' metrics to identify areas of improvement.
Provides software training to track client data and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Develops sales onboarding programs for Solatube Home.
Conducts seminars, workshops and individual training sessions.
Communicates effectively between departments and with external contacts.
Attends meetings and classes as required.
Performs all related duties as assigned.

Qualifications For Position

3+ years' experience training adult learners, and/or experience with instructional design.
Excellent communication, organizational, and mathematical skills.
Computer competency in word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and database.
Ability to analyze and prioritize.
Ability to multitask.
Valid driver’s license and proof of insurability.
Ability to travel up to 50% annually
Ability to commute to corporate offices on a full time basis

Learn more about our company and products by visiting our website at: http://www.solatubehome.com

At Solatube, we believe our employees are our greatest resource. Therefore, we offer a competitive salary, benefits, and vacation package for all full-time permanent positions. Kingspan is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.

Prolucent is on a mission to change healthcare by helping organizations fundamentally change how health systems solve labor challenges in healthcare through innovation, sustainability, and thoughtful disruption. For the team at Prolucent, this isn’t just a job; it is a driving force in knowing we can align to make it better for all… It is investing to ensure that we have care when we need it for our families, loved ones, and communities.

More About Prolucent and Our Team Click

Role & Responsibilities:

The Vice President of New Sales will be a cornerstone to the business’ commercial growth strategy with a clear focus on accelerating new logo sales in the U.S. This growth-minded individual should have a proven track record of consistently achieving annual sales targets selling strategic solutions to U.S. Health Systems. This role will initially be an individual contributor, with the opportunity to build a team as the company grows. The ideal candidate has significant experience managing a complex sales process, possesses an executive presence, fosters relationships with key stakeholders, is personable, and is eager to disrupt the status quo.

Responsibilities include:

Collaborate with and leverage company stakeholders and executive team, internal and external sales, technical, and channel partners to build an opportunity pipeline and close deals;
Conduct technical/consultative selling in person, via and video conferencing;
Work with customers to provide guidance, present benefits, and solutions in a way that addresses their specific needs, and guide them through solution selection;
Generate and provide pricing and quotes to customers;
Use selling techniques to advance the sales cycle; leverage points of agreement to gain buy-in and commitment for moving forward;
Understand and communicate the value of doing business with our company;
Self-prioritize daily activities, meet goals and timelines and utilize exceptional time management skills;
Utilize a CRM to accurately track activity and to update lead, account, and opportunity information, as well as sales pipeline with a focus on winning business; and
Assist in the development of best practices within sales process
Increase revenue through acquisition of net new logos;
Create and execute short and long-term sales plans, including strategies to accelerate new and existing sales pipeline;
Work collaboratively with channel partners to exec

Required Skills & Education:

10 + years sales experience with workforce solutions and technology products;
B2B SaaS experience targeting enterprise, regional and midmarket healthcare clients, including hospitals & health systems
Background in driving large complex deals with multiple buyers, departments and stakeholders;
Demonstrated ability to operate independently, with initiative and good business judgment;
Strong organizational and time management skills, ability to effectively learn and utilize online CRM applications and social media resources to grow pipeline and close deals;
Demonstrated success in developing/prospecting new business;
Outstanding strategy & growth capabilities with exceptional business acumen;
Knowledge and experience with business software applications including, CRM (HubSpot preferred), MS Outlook Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel,), and virtual communication tools (Zoom, Microsoft Teams)

Reports To: Chief Revenue Officer

Division: Sales and Marketing

Primary Location: Local to the DFW area preferred/remote is available.

Preferred Experience: Experience selling strategic solutions to U.S. Health Systems

Direct Reports: No

Exemption Status: Exempt

What We Offer:

Medical, dental, life, vision insurance and 401K
Unlimited PTO — we believe in time off!
Company Celebrations! We work hard and we reward ourselves. Company-sponsored virtual and in person events, monthly lunches, happy hours and team-building activities, and special treats on your birthday and anniversary!

Compensation:

140,000-150,000

Prolucent strongly believes in the health and well-being of its employees and makes every effort to create a culture where employees are valued, respected, coached, and supported to be their best selves.

More About Prolucent and Our Team

The meaningful impact we are having is a testament to the power of experienced and mission driven talent united by a shared passion for creating positive change. It is because of our team’s unwavering commitment coupled with a diverse range of skills, knowledge, and expertise that we stand as trailblazers at the forefront of transformative initiatives shaping a brighter future for healthcare.

Position Summary

Instructs students in one or more contents/areas, such as Reading, ELA, Math, Science, and Social Studies. May be designated according to subject matter/content specialty. Utilizes current strategies and theories to plan and implement lessons. This position reports to the Principal.

Key Responsibilities

Instructs students, using various teaching methods, such as lecture, audiovisual aids, demonstration and other materials to supplement presentations relative to specific content field.

Assigns lessons and corrects homework; administers tests to evaluate students’ progress, record results and issue reports to inform parents of progress. Maintains discipline in classroom. Supervises behavior outside the classroom (i.e., halls, bus, lunch/cafeteria, rest room duty).

Prepares course outlines and objectives according to curriculum guidelines or state and local requirements.

Conducts parent/teacher conferences to review student’s progress, performance, and behavior problems. Participates in faculty and professional meetings, educational conferences and teacher training workshops.

All other duties, as assigned and required, in order to perform the above services.

Key Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or higher required.

Minimum Of One (1) Year Of Teaching Experience Preferred.

Makes recommendations and/or decisions which usually affect the entire school.

Certification by the State of Georgia in Education T-4 to T-7 as required by the GaPSC.

Normal classroom/school setting.

Must be able to stand and walk approximately seven (7) to seven and one-half (7½) hours per day. Light duty - On most occasions sitting at a desk or table; intermittently sitting, standing, or stooping. Light lifting or carrying; twenty (20) lbs. or less.

The 2024-2025 salary scales are not yet available. The 2023-2024 salary schedules may be accessed via the following link: 2023-2024 Teacher Salary Scale

Certified Classroom Teacher

I. General Description: To provide quality classroom instruction guided by the Arizona State Standards and Governing Board policies and regulations. Improve instructional practice through ongoing collaboration with master and mentor teachers.

II. Qualifications

Valid Arizona teaching certificate
Must meet all Arizona Department of Education certification requirements
SEI Endorsement (minimum requirement)
Bachelor’s Degree (minimum requirement)
III. Duties And Responsibilities

Participate in the Teacher Advancement Program (TAP) teacher instructionally focused accountability system.
Attend ongoing applied professional growth groups (clusters).
Participate in the TAP team-teaching/coaching model in collaboration with mentor and master teachers to enhance teacher expertise.
Collaborate on lesson planning and develops expertise in all areas of instruction by working with the mentor and master teachers.
Develop expertise through creating and maintaining an Individual Growth Plan (IGP).
Use formal and informal assessment to monitor student progress toward the school achievement goals, including cluster focus.
Use all resources available to support instructional programs.
Align lessons to district curriculum and state standards.
Demonstrate accurate content knowledge of all subjects taught to include integration and connection to other content areas.
Assist in the design and implementation of individualized education programs through diagnostic teaching, instructional adaptations, and individual behavior management techniques.
Conduct instruction with clearly stated objectives giving a variety of information to aid students in the achievement of the objective.
Use effective modeling, guided practices, closure, and independent practice as appropriate to the lesson.
Use questioning and discussion strategies and higher level thinking skills.
Adjust the lesson as appropriate to meet the diverse needs of all students.
Integrate the use of educational technology in the classroom.
Demonstrate appropriate teacher-student interactions with general warmth, caring, respect within the developmental and cultural norms.
Maintain polite, respectful and positive student interactions.
Set high academic and behavioral expectations for every student.
Convey high expectations for instructional goals, activities, interactions, and classroom environment for student achievement.
Maintain organized and well-managed instructional groups, transitions, as well as supervision of volunteers and paraprofessionals, when appropriate.
Maintain a safe, organized, and high quality environment that facilitates learning and minimizing student disruptions.
Maintain accurate records that meet district, state, and federal timelines.
Maintain and document effective lines of communication with students and their peers.
Communicate and cooperate with other staff members, support personnel and administration.
Participate in professional growth activities and seeks to improve teaching skills.
Establish efficient systems for performing non-instructional duties resulting in minimal loss of instructional time.
Demonstrate punctuality and dependability in the performance of school duties.
Follow district policies, procedures, and directives in a timely and appropriate manner.
Perform such other tasks as may be assigned.

Reports to: Building Administrator

Status: Certified Salary Schedule and District Benefits Package

Application Requirements: All applicants must complete an online application, which requires 3 professional letters of recommendation, 3 professional references, a valid AZ Teaching Certificate, a valid Fingerprint Clearance card, Transcripts, Cover Letter, and Resume.

Salary Range: Certified Salary Schedule / Per Year

Shift Type: Full-Time

About Us

We're a reputable educational publisher with over 45 years of experience in crafting top-notch educational materials. Our mission is to foster a love for learning among children worldwide while ensuring our products are renowned for their effectiveness. Although based in Huntington Beach, California, our impact spans globally, thanks to educators, parents, caregivers, and partners who embrace our resources. At our core, we prioritize positive interactions with customers, authors, communities, and employees, aligning closely with our company values.

Location:

Remote Home Office (Must be based in Orange County or LA County, CA)

Position Summary

We deeply value our connection with teachers, students, and classrooms. In line with this commitment, we're thrilled to offer a Teacher Intern program. This initiative invites teachers to infuse their creativity, passion, and teaching expertise into our Content Development team, ensuring the creation of exceptional products loved by both teachers and students. No previous editorial or publishing experience is necessary; this is a fantastic opportunity for teachers to contribute their enthusiasm and innovation to our vision of fostering a love for learning among children.

Essential Duties / Responsibilities

Review materials in development (teacher materials, student materials, digital components, etc.) to ensure alignment with the needs of today's educators and learners.

Provide direct-from-the-classroom feedback on products in development, ensuring they are purposeful, effective, engaging, clear, and user-friendly.

Collaborate closely with project managers and/or editors to implement changes for clarity, including potential rewrites or reorganization of materials.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in education, journalism, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

Previous K-12 Classroom Teaching Experience Is Essential.

Content area specialization is a plus.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Attention to detail, ability to multitask, and adaptability to changing priorities.

Physical Requirements

Ability to sit for extended periods, including at a computer.

Occasional lifting up to 15 lbs.

Frequent use of computer keyboard and mouse, requiring repetitive hand and wrist movements.

Work Conditions

Typical home office environment.

Ref: PCN779

More than ever, we appreciate our Oakland educators. We can agree that we have experienced an unprecedented year in education as our students, communities and families have returned to in-person school. We are continuously learning that we are stronger together - Oakland educators are passionate, equity-focused, and resilient. Oakland Unified is an incredible place to build and develop your career in service of our core values: students first, joy, equity, excellence, integrity, and cultural responsiveness.

Our Mission and Vision

The Oakland Unified School District's mission is to build a Full Service Community District focused on high academic achievement while serving the whole child, eliminating inequity, and providing each child with excellent teachers, every day.

Our vision is that all OUSD students will find joy in their academic experience while graduating with the skills to ensure they are caring, competent, fully-informed, critical thinkers who are prepared for college, career, and community success.

Our Strategic Plan

The four key initiatives of our current district wide strategic plan are:

Ensuring Strong Third Grader Readers (Catalyze citywide effort to guarantee literacy for all third graders)
Supporting Powerful Graduates (Develop essential skills to secure post secondary success),
Creating Inspiring Schools (Redesign schools to be places of joy, inclusion and beauty)
Growing a Diverse and Stable Staff (Attract and retain staff reflective of Oakland's rich diversity)

We Are Seeking Educators Who Believe That

Building and maintaining caring relationships with students and families is a key part of the foundation of teaching;
Maintaining high expectations for all students is best accomplished through a persistent asset-based lens of what students can do;
Your actions can directly lead to creating more equitable conditions in public schools;
Your work is most effective in collaboration with colleagues, families, and students;
Developing as an anti-racist educator requires investing time in self-reflection, listening and incorporating feedback from students, their families, other educators, and school leaders and is critical to your growth as an educator and leader.
Working for racial justice requires close attention to educational systems and policies, and working to eliminate racism is critical to the educational success of all students.

What We Offer Teachers

Oakland Unified has received substantial funding to support pathway programs including tuition and debt relief for selected middle school teachers, Special Education teachers, and for pathway programs, including Classified-to-Teacher, Maestr@s, and the After-School-to-Teacher programs. We are invested in creating and maintaining affinity spaces for educators that support retention and socio-emotional support. We provide extensive professional development and training for teachers, innovative curricula, ongoing mentoring and advancement opportunities. Our teachers are also given abundant opportunities to work together in Professional Learning Communities within and across schools in the District.

In addition to professional development and training, we offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes:

Competitive salaries determined by experience, education level, and credentials
We accept up to twelve years of full time teaching experience in other school settings on the salary schedule (please see our salary schedule here: https://www.ousd.org/Page/16118)
Full medical, dental, and vision benefits, including Flexible Spending Accounts, plus life insurance and long-term disability coverage
Retirement benefits through the CALSTRS Retirement System
Read more about benefits here: https://www.ousd.org/benefits

Qualifications

Candidates must have a Bachelor's degree, must be eligible for employment in the US and pass a criminal background check. Candidates must possess, or be willing to earn, a California teaching credential authorizing instruction in core curriculum.

Additional Requirements

Completed online application
Resume and cover Letter
Two current professional references, including from a Supervisor
Upon request, must be able to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination or commitment to weekly testing

You can also learn more about our teaching opportunities and hiring events here: https://www.ousd.org/careers

If you have questions or would like more information, please email recruitment@ousd.org

To hear about news and events to support you in becoming an OUSD educator, please fill out this form.

NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY

The Oakland Unified School District does not discriminate in any program, activity, or in employment on the basis of actual or perceived race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, gender, sex, or sexual orientation.

Salary Range: $62,695.25 - $109,878.22 / Per Year

Dwight School is the first school in the Americas to offer all four International Baccalaureate programs from preschool to grade 12. Guided by our philosophy of igniting the spark of genius in every child, Dwight is an inclusive school that aims to meet the unique needs, abilities, and interests of each student. At the same time, Dwight challenges every student to develop intellectual independence, respect for diversity and belonging, and to become innovators and thought leaders.

Known for its low student-teacher ratio, Dwight enrolls 1,100 students with 400 faculty and staff. Our School rests on three pillars: personalized learning, community, and global vision. As part of a leading global network of schools, Dwight offers employees exciting cross-campus opportunities. Additionally, with the support of The Dwight School Foundation’s generous grants, Dwight provides faculty professional development, enabling teachers to deepen their content knowledge and pursue their own sparks of genius to be shared with the community.

At Dwight, we strive to ensure that our environment is welcoming — a place in which everyone can thrive — and an organization we are proud of. We recognize that this takes trusting relationships and ensuring that all individuals feel valued regardless of their backgrounds. At Dwight, we encourage diversity in all respects, including diversity of thought, and embrace innovation and foster collaboration and growth.

We consistently strive to advance the equity, diversity and belonging of our community in all domains, including the curriculum, admissions, environment, and hiring. Upper School Math Teacher

Grades 9-12

Full Time, 7:30 am - 4 pm

Position Overview

Dwight School, an innovative preschool-grade 12 coeducational school on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, is currently seeking a self-directed teacher who is able to deliver various types of high school mathematics instruction for the 2024-2025 academic year.

Responsibilities

Foster a positive and constructive learning environment in the math classroom
Use a variety of instructional strategies to activate math learners
Display a willingness to integrate technology into the math classroom
Foster the development of students academic and social-emotional skills in math classes
Display a commitment to diversity and creating a culture of equity, inclusion, and belonging in approach to teaching and learning, as they are recognized and valued by Dwight
Completion of an online anti-bias training program in the first year of teaching

Prefer prior teaching experience in a Middle or Upper School setting
Prefer experience teaching to a range of learners
Experience with thoughtful technology integration in a Mathematics class
Experience with International Baccalaureate Middle Years Program and/or Diploma Program highly preferred
Experience teaching Algebra II, Trigonometry, Statistics
Eager to contribute positively to the Dwight community
Willingness to engage with and learn from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences

Position Summary

Instructs students in one or more contents/areas, such as Reading, ELA, Math, Science, and Social Studies. May be designated according to subject matter/content specialty. Utilizes current strategies and theories to plan and implement lessons. This position reports to the Principal.

Normal classroom/school setting.

Dwight School is the first school in the Americas to offer all four International Baccalaureate programs from preschool to grade 12. Guided by our philosophy of igniting the spark of genius in every child, Dwight is an inclusive school that aims to meet the unique needs, abilities, and interests of each student. At the same time, Dwight challenges every student to develop intellectual independence, respect for diversity and belonging, and to become innovators and thought leaders.

Known for its low student-teacher ratio, Dwight enrolls 1,100 students with 400 faculty and staff. Our School rests on three pillars: personalized learning, community, and global vision. As part of a leading global network of schools, Dwight offers employees exciting cross-campus opportunities. Additionally, with the support of The Dwight School Foundation’s generous grants, Dwight provides faculty professional development, enabling teachers to deepen their content knowledge and pursue their own sparks of genius to be shared with the community.

At Dwight, we strive to ensure that our environment is welcoming — a place in which everyone can thrive — and an organization we are proud of. We recognize that this takes trusting relationships and ensuring that all individuals feel valued regardless of their backgrounds. At Dwight, we encourage diversity in all respects, including diversity of thought, and embrace innovation and foster collaboration and growth.

We consistently strive to advance the equity, diversity and belonging of our community in all domains, including the curriculum, admissions, environment, and hiring.
